schedule.title: These ARE My Pirate Monkeys
schedule.description: A DEXCON 22 EXCLUSIVE! Bring Your Favorite Character From Any Game or Fandom! The Pirates were pretty terrible. The Monkeys? They were also pretty terrible. That's nothing compared to what happens when the Monkeys end up with their own ship. Arr, ya mateys! Come aboard for banana daiquiris and a multiverse-hopping good time in this original Nexus event. This event is set in The Nexus, a persistent living RPG setting developed to co-exist with Double Exposure events. Characters from all games, genres, universes, and fandoms are welcome. Everything you need to know will be taught when you arrive. Join us for a reality-bending jaunt to the center of the Multiverse.

schedule.title: Planetfall: Delphine
schedule.description: A DEXCON 22 EXCLUSIVE! A new live action adventure from Phoenix Outlaw Productions! After waking up and being confronted by disturbing memories of their past, the passengers and crew of the Alexandria escape the clutches of the insidious Slake and land on the planet of Delphine. But Delphine may not be the sanctuary they have hoped for. Welcome to Arksong and "Planetfall: Delphine", a freeform live action event for up to 75 players. Set in a sci-fi adventure setting, players take on the roles of the lost crew of an ark with a dark past and a hopeful future. No previous knowledge is required for play, but costumes are highly encouraged. Learn more about Arksong on our Facebook game at www.facebook.com/arksonglarp. Got questions? Reach out to us at arksong@phoenixoutlaw.com - characters can be made in advance or else will be distributed on site or at the LARP Bazaar.

schedule.title: Quest
schedule.description: A DEXCON 22 EXCLUSIVE! Newcomers from a different era have started to appear in the Brightside, and with them, all the wonders and challenges of epic fantasy stories. Now, the brave champions who once helped to restore the legendary Castle Bestcastle must gather to guide new friends to their place in the world. Grab your adventuring gear: it's time to set off on a heroic Quest! Bright Story is a live action role playing game with optional live combat elements, inspired by animated media like Steven Universe, Adventure Time, and Gravity Falls. You'll level up by making friends and restore your abilities through self-care. Bright Story will have some physical movement aspects and involve the optional use of contact-safe weapons to simulate combat. Please consider these aspects before deciding to attend. Email Josh Harrison at jharr421 at gmail dot com with questions, or search for Bright Story LARP on Facebook to find our group. You can bring your own costuming and contact-safe weapons, use some of our loaners, or use only the power of your imagination. Write or visit our group to talk character creation, or pick up a pre-generated character at the event to get started.

schedule.title: Broketown Drift: A Post-Apocalyptic LARP
schedule.description: A DEXCON 22 EXCLUSIVE! An original LARP inspired by Mad Max and the works of Avery Alder. Keep society stitched together, die for glory, and enjoy intimate moments in a dead and desolate world. The stories we leave behind are the proof of our existence. May the headlights shine bright on the people of Broketown. With the horrifying tyrannical rule of Ragnar Van Money over, a new social order needs to be founded. The Saviors, as they are called, work tirelessly to create a safe home for all those in need, but they have no experience in such matters. Are they capable? Others wonder if a victory won by bloodshed can lead to anything but. The farmers, the Textile Guild, and neighboring populations seem to seek a peaceful balance but resources are limited, people are fearful, and self-serving bandits are around every corner it seems. Not all find themselves bogged down by such conversations and considerations, as they live day to day in dangerous, thrilling careers, protected only by their modded vehicles on the roads once owned by the Metal Masters, slowly crumbling around them as players traverse the treacherous terrain. This is a consent-heavy game influenced by American Freeform. No LARP experience needed, new players welcome. Costumes recommended. (The setting locations are dilapidated cities.) Toy cars, also in costume, optional and recommended if you have one. Yes, that one works. Necessary supplies provided. Character creation done in game. For questions, please email anne.ratchat@gmail.com.

schedule.title: Retribution
schedule.description: A DEXCON 22 EXCLUSIVE! A high-intensity boffer LARP with themes of supernatural and sci-fi horror. There's a war going on, just beyond the limits of human understanding. Creatures that can not exist. Phenomena that is scientifically impossible. Magic itself. The SCP Foundation, for time immemorial, has fought for three tenets that are meant to keep humanity safe. Secure. Contain. Protect. For the first time in history, one of the Foundation's oldest and most powerful enemies, the Church of the Broken God, has exposed themselves, allowing the location of their Basilica of Ruin to fall into the hands of the Foundation. An opportunity like this will only strike once. The Mobile Strike Team cannot fail. It's time for you to go into the breach. BREACH: An SCP Inspired Horror LARP is proud to bring you our third installment, "Retribution". Players will fill the role of agents in the SCP Foundation, using boffer weapons, nerf guns, and their wits and skills to strike back against the dark and mysterious cultists of the Church of the Broken God. To check out the rulebook for BREACH, please visit www.facebook.com/PandaragonGames. If you'd like help with building a character, feel free to drop us an email at pandaragongames@gmail.com or join us at the LARP Bazaar.

schedule.title: The $500 David Stern Memorial Summer Poker Championship
schedule.description: Double Exposure's traditional Poker tournament. Played as No Limit Texas Hold 'Em, tables will be pared down as necessary. The grand prize is a $500 Gift Certificate for the DEXCON 22 Dealers' Room! Numerous small prizes will be awarded throughout the night, including a Bad Beat bonus prize of a 10-Point Prize Certificate, and a Royal Flush JACKPOT! NOTE: THERE IS NO GAMBLING AT DEXCON 22; ALL TRANSACTIONS ARE IN CHIPS WITH NO VALUE OUTSIDE OF THE GAME.

schedule.title: The DEXCON 22 LARP Bazaar
schedule.description: DEXCON is proud to present a showcase of LARPs which will be occurring during the convention. Don't know which ones to play in? Come and talk to the GMs of most of the over 40 LARP events which will be taking place during the next four days, and sit down with any of them for character creation and general shmoozing. Even if you are already signed up for some LARPs, come to the Bazaar and learn about all of the others! You didn't expect to sleep during DEXCON, did you?

schedule.title: Sign
schedule.description: Nicaragua in the 1970s had no form of sign language. In 1977 fifty deaf children from across the country were brought together to an experimental school in Managua. Without a shared language to express themselves, the children did the only thing they could - they created one. In Sign, we follow a small piece of their journey. Taking on roles inspired by these children, players will develop their own sign language.

schedule.title: Roll-Your-Own
schedule.description: The Nexus is Double Exposure's persistent living RPG. New and established players are welcome to join this flexible tabletop and/or semi-live event where we will explore character development and world building together.

schedule.title: Incandescent War: Rescue Ranging
schedule.description: Welcome to Eos Academy. We will show you that the world you thought was real is just a shell holding in the truth. Magic is real, and we can teach it to you. We can teach you the truth. Come and join us. Incandescent War uses ASL signs as a somatic component to shape the spells. Choices have been made and now several people are in danger, and it's up to the students of Eos Academy, both new and old, to come together and try to pull off the rescues of the century, across multiple dimensions.

schedule.title: Us and Them
schedule.description: The world ended quietly, differently, for all of us. We all saw a different end, through different eyes. What did you see? A ritual LARP about those who followed the monsters during the apocalypse, designed by a trauma survivor. With thanks to Stephen Dewey from Cavalry Games. Content warning for mentions of violence, abuse, ableism, and survival.

schedule.title: Welcome to the Other Side!
schedule.description: In an instant, a darkness unlike any you have ever known. In the next instant, a cold starlit night in the middle of a cemetery. A cruel face appears in the sky. The face tells you bluntly that you are dead. Now, choose your fate and how you will spend your afterlife. Players will arrive, and role play their stories with one another. Along the way, players will determine a supernatural House or Tribe that they will join. Then, and only then, will they learn their fate. This is a pure role playing event with absolutely no combat.

schedule.title: Blue Plate Hour at the Golden Meanwhile
schedule.description: The crowd's a little different during earlybird hours in a seaside tavern. Tank MacKenzie, friendly proprietor, invites you to The Golden Meanwhile, an historic coastal watering hole, located in The Nexus. Enjoy (role play only - no alcohol will actually be served) local microbrews, top shelf spirits, a great glass of blueberry lemonade, or a pot of tea while you get to know your neighbors. It's a chance to introduce yourself, meet newcomers, discuss community issues, and maybe even earn your own signature cocktail on the menu. The pub is open to all ages. This event is set in The Nexus, a persistent living RPG setting developed to co-exist with Double Exposure events. Characters from all games, genres, universes, and fandoms are welcome. Everything you need to know will be taught when you arrive.

schedule.title: Welcome to the Other Side!
schedule.description: In an instant, a darkness unlike any you have ever known. In the next instant, a cold starlit night in the middle of a cemetery. A cruel face appears in the sky. The face tells you bluntly that you are dead. Now, choose your fate and how you will spend your afterlife. Players will arrive, and role play their stories with one another. Along the way, players will determine a supernatural House or Tribe that they will join. Then, and only then, will they learn their fate. This is a pure role playing event with absolutely no combat.

schedule.title: LARP Character Toolbox
schedule.description: Join a trained and working improvisation actress to learn tips to take your LARP characters to the next level. Using methods from the world of improv you will leave the seminar with an arsenal of tricks to make each of your characters unique people. Come prepared to move and use your voice as you are able as we will be putting the various methods to the test.

schedule.title: Warlocked: An Escape Room Experience
schedule.description: You and your friends were exploring the lava tubes and strangely ended up in an unused wing of the notorious underground wizard prison, Avernus. Can you escape the trap before the tunnel collapses? Your only chance is to discover the clues left by the former prisoners outlining their escape plans via a teleportation rune. They didn't make it, but you might.

schedule.title: Once in a Lifetime
schedule.description: You are requested to attend the Last Will and Testament of Reginald Thorngate - businessman, humanitarian, and father. It is at this time the affairs of his substantial estate will be resolved. Survived by his loving adopted children and his loyal staff, his celebrations of life shall commence this evening at Thorngate Manor. Once In A Lifetime is a Cthulhu Live! event by Gaslight set in the latter Victorian Period, 1890's. Pulled from the archives of the PST Library, join us for this classic event. Characters provided. For a pre-registered character, please contact us at pstproductions@gmail.com.

schedule.title: Bosnian Crisis Council: 1992
schedule.description: Yugoslavia has been teetering on the edge of total collapse for five years. Croatia and Slovenia have already seceded, and Bosnia-Herzegovina looks like it will be next. The Serbian government views this as a betrayal of the Serbian nationals within the border of the region, and would like nothing more than to stop that from happening. Talk of war is in the air, and the entire region is preparing. NATO and the UN are frantically trying to keep the peace. What happens next is in your hands. This LARP will be run almost exactly like a high school Model UN crisis council simulation. Parliamentary procedure ("parlipro") will be observed - to a point. Please email Jacqueline at jacquelinembryk@gmail.com for character assignments and questions.

schedule.title: Inheritance
schedule.description: A 10th century Viking funeral told in three acts. Players take on the roles of the family and kin of the deceased patriarch and come to terms with the past, the truth, and each other. For some, the funeral is a chance to even old scores. For others, it is a chance to forgive. For all, to get what they want, they must be willing to fight for what they believe.

schedule.title: Warlocked: An Escape Room Experience
schedule.description: You and your friends were exploring the lava tubes and strangely ended up in an unused wing of the notorious underground wizard prison, Avernus. Can you escape the trap before the tunnel collapses? Your only chance is to discover the clues left by the former prisoners outlining their escape plans via a teleportation rune. They didn't make it, but you might.

schedule.title: So You Want to LARP
schedule.description: Have you been thinking about attending a LARP, but have questions and no one to ask? Join a panel of experienced LARPers and get all of your questions answered. Learn about the different types of LARP and what to expect at each.

schedule.title: Send N00ds
schedule.description: A rules-light cyberbono noodle joint romp, where overworked cooks and servers contend with cyberpunk stereotypes. A submission to the 2018 Golden Cobra Challenge.

schedule.title: Warlocked: An Escape Room Experience
schedule.description: You and your friends were exploring the lava tubes and strangely ended up in an unused wing of the notorious underground wizard prison, Avernus. Can you escape the trap before the tunnel collapses? Your only chance is to discover the clues left by the former prisoners outlining their escape plans via a teleportation rune. They didn't make it, but you might.

schedule.title: Forgotten Imaginary Friends
schedule.description: Doctor Dolotts is back from vacation and set to lead a new group therapy session. Everyday across the world, children grow up and leave their imaginary friends behind. Now these imaginary friends are coming together to discuss how they're coping with being parted from their real friends and moving on with their lives. The Adventures of Dr. Dolotts is a LARP where the players will come up with a character based on the scenario and then role play that character in a group therapy style setting. This is a pure role play event with no combat whatsoever.

schedule.title: Warlocked: An Escape Room Experience
schedule.description: You and your friends were exploring the lava tubes and strangely ended up in an unused wing of the notorious underground wizard prison, Avernus. Can you escape the trap before the tunnel collapses? Your only chance is to discover the clues left by the former prisoners outlining their escape plans via a teleportation rune. They didn't make it, but you might.

schedule.title: Misunderstood Kaiju
schedule.description: Doctor Dolotts is back from vacation and set to lead a new group therapy session. The Kaiju, large creatures known for flattening entire cities with minimal effort. For generations these misunderstood beings have been feared and hunted by humans just for existing. Now, in a new group therapy, the Kaiju discuss their lives and the misconceptions about what it means to be one. The Adventures of Dr. Dolotts is a LARP where the players will come up with a character based on the scenario and then role play that character in a group therapy style setting. This is a pure role play event with no combat whatsoever.

schedule.title: Electric Sheep
schedule.description: Remember who you are? No, of course you don't. How could you, being pulled out of cryo so abruptly? Inspired by Ridley Scott's Blade Runner and Phillip K. Dick's 'Do Android's Dream of Electric Sheep?'. Electric Sheep is a freeform LARP exploring the lives of the crew aboard the crippled star ship Chronos. This game will gaze into the depths of what it means to be human vs. artificial, and the nature of humanity itself.

schedule.title: Between Two Worlds
schedule.description: A DEXCON 22 EXCLUSIVE! There was a sign posted late last night at the gatehouse to the fence which separates this ghetto from the town of Warsaw. What it says must be done. Tomorrow will bring terrible dawn - and a ceaseless march to Treblinka; but tonight families come together at their walled in synagogue to pray, or to plan. Someone begs the Rabbi for a wedding, others cry out for anyone hale to join them in rebellion, and there are others who whisper of unspoken mystical ways - clues from the Torah - in which to implore the Holy for intervention on their behalf. Here, between two worlds, their fate will be decided. Written by Emily Monster. For characters contact us at pstproductions@gmail.com. Content Warning: Historic WWII Themes & Events - Warsaw Ghetto, Nazis.

schedule.title: Tomb Priestesses of the Nameless Dead
schedule.description: Partly inspired by Ursula K. Le Guin fantasy novel, The Tombs of Atuan (1971), this is a live-action game exploring sporadic events in the lives of a group of priestesses charged with serving dead spirits that are nameless, ancient, and often hostile. The players will take turns portraying either the priestesses or the Nameless Dead in a series of scenes that are chronological but not clearly located in time. Moments, days, months, or years may pass between scenes. There is also no fixed ending to the game, so things continue in a cyclical pattern even including characters dying or leaving the sisterhood and new characters being inducted as members unless the characters themselves decide to break that pattern.

schedule.title: Bank Notes
schedule.description: Greetings! I'm your host, Mr. White. Tonight's going to be quite interesting. A bunch of people walk into a bar, sounds like the beginning of a bad joke, I know, but trust me, it's no joke. How they got here and why, well, that's the fun part of the story and I'm not going to spoil the details here. You'll just have to stop in and learn what's going on for yourselves. All this and more at a quaint little place called the Purgatory Saloon. Players will create a Purgatory Saloon customer who happens to be present at the time of the incident in question, and then role play that character in a bar-type scenario. This is a pure role play event with no combat whatsoever.

schedule.title: Beware the Dark
schedule.description: Darkness swallowed the Earth three days ago. There are no stars, no sun, no moon. Vampires revel in their new freedom, the Masquerade has fallen. For the shapeshifters of Rockcreek Park, the Veil still holds, for now. The pack must find some way of restoring the heavens to their rightful state, or remain cut off from Luna forever. Where do they even start looking? The End is no longer coming, the end is here. This game will be played in darkness, with limited visibility. Flashlights will be provided.

schedule.title: Roadside Assistance
schedule.description: Greetings! I'm your host, Mr. White. Tonight's going to be quite interesting. It's late, it's cold, and chances are good that it's also raining. As misfortune would have it, your car's broken down on the side of the road. But there's a light at the end of this miserable little tunnel. Come on in. Wet your whistle and grab a snack while you wait for help to arrive at a little place called the Purgatory Saloon.  You won't regret it, I guarantee. Players will create a Purgatory Saloon customer who happens to be present at the time of the incident in question, and then role play that character in a bar-type scenario. This is a pure role play event with no combat whatsoever.

schedule.title: The Vesten Expedition
schedule.description: No more parties. Now is a time of grave danger. War looms large over Thea. A Warlord has taken over Vestin, forcing the warring clans into an uneasy alliance. Aided by a mysterious wizard with unknown magic. The other nations have sent you, to aid and discover the true nature of the threat. Everyone, every skill is needed. Blacksmiths, potters, fletchers, scouts, furriers, Soldiers and Mages. Don't let a chance for glory, honor, and moving up the ranks pass you by!

schedule.title: The Puzzling Tea Party Social
schedule.description: Join the Munchausen Society for a couple of hours of tea and fellowship. At the party, however, you might notice a series of locked boxes, each with its own treasure inside. Clues will be hidden within tea, food, and atmosphere that, if deciphered, can show you how the boxes might be opened. Each player will automatically be given one opportunity to attempt to open a box. However, players can earn additional opportunities by contributing to the atmosphere through fancy dress, exceptional role play, bringing you own special mug/tea cup, contributing to the entertainment (reading poetry or prose, singing an appropriate song, etc.), or bringing a few extra teabags or snacks to share with the party.

schedule.title: A Rough Night at the Hotel Royale
schedule.description: The year is 2094. Crime runs rampant as oppressive governments and corporations work to drain the life from the populace. Those who oppose the system and those who want to break the rules for profit are hunted all the same. Mercenaries, activists, mafiosi, assassins, guerrilla medics and more thrive in the dark places, finding profit, community, and soul in the places where the corporate police state refuses to look. In the heart of Metro City's downtown lies a place where all these "criminals" (the good, the bad and the in-between) flock. The Hotel Royale, a hive of scum and villainy that prides itself on providing excellent service - and greasing all the right hands to keep prying eyes away - acts as a sanctuary of sorts for the denizens of the Metro underground. What happens when the limits of that sanctuary are tested? Come check in for a stay at the Hotel Royale. This game is a parlor LARP featuring themes of drugs, violence, and other adult themes. Email Materias777@gmail.com for questions prior to the event.

schedule.title: I Still SAW What You Did
schedule.description: You wake up in a locked room not knowing how you got there, or why. All you know is you are not alone. With the clock ticking, you all must solve a series of riddles and puzzles to unlock the door and save yourselves from becoming the latest victims of the notorious serial killer, the Voyeur. The classic characters of Clue are coming together where murder is the order of the day.

schedule.title: Town Meeting
schedule.description: Hear ye, Hear ye! The bells - we have bells?? - sound, summoning you to an official Town Meeting. Join us at the appointed time as the Nexus asks you existential questions and demands communal decisions be made. Our town - Index - wants to be affirmed. Port Authority wishes to open. Guilds would like to be acknowledged by your joint will. But the Nexus shrugs off attempts to establish legislation while raising questions about injustice and restoration. Sounds like there's an agenda - are you going to join us and be heard?

schedule.title: Wolves in the China Shop
schedule.description: Poison fills the skies as people are unaware of the disease filling the streets. The source of these travesties has been found and Pentex is to blame. Are the members of the Garou Nation and their allies strong enough to bring down the heavily guarded poison factory, or will they just be another tale of fallen heroes? Come join us as the werewolves, protectors of the earth and defenders of countless spirit pacts, make a push on an enemy's heavily guarded compound. Hosted by the Princeton Domain of the Mind's Eye Society. Characters can be created in advance by emailing apocvst.mesprinceton@gmail.com.

schedule.title: Cryosleep When I'm Dead
schedule.description: The crew of a deep space exploration vessel has awoken only to discover that something has gone horribly wrong with their mission. Now they must piece together the details and discover exactly what happened and who is responsible. The classic characters of Clue are coming together where murder is the order of the day.

schedule.title: The Mystery of Sarryian Island
schedule.description: Utopian fantasy meets urban dystopia in the arcanapunk world of Torlain. Elysium is the largest known organization dedicated to resisting Nightcorp, a shady corporation which has amassed total control over the world’s mystech industry and has multiple prominent governments in its pockets. As a member of Elysium, you have been tasked to investigate an emergency distress signal from agents stationed in a Nightcorp research facility on a remote island. It seems, however, that whatever caused the agents to send the signal is far from ordinary...

schedule.title: What Dreams Are Made Of...
schedule.description: A DEXCON 22 EXCLUSIVE! Hollywood, 1964. Carlton Granger created magic. Rising from obscurity to become a titan in the entertainment industry with his beloved animated shorts, feature length films, and fairy tale storytelling, he brought the dreams of every young person to life upon the silver screen. With his recent passing, the world mourns. It is time, however, for his successors to soldier on to uphold his legacy, To do so, they gather at his secluded mansion to sift through his effects, to try to gain insight into the man and myth. Written by Mark Shireman. For characters contact us at pstproductions@gmail.com.

schedule.title: Late Night at the Golden Meanwhile
schedule.description: Tank MacKenzie, friendly proprietor, invites you to The Golden Meanwhile, an historic coastal watering hole, located in The Nexus. Enjoy (role play only - no alcohol will actually be served) local microbrews, top shelf spirits, a great glass of blueberry lemonade, or a pot of tea while you get to know your neighbors. It's a chance to introduce yourself, meet newcomers, discuss community issues, and maybe even earn your own signature cocktail on the menu. The pub is open to all ages. This event is set in The Nexus, a persistent living RPG setting developed to co-exist with Double Exposure events. Characters from all games, genres, universes, and fandoms are welcome. Everything you need to know will be taught when you arrive.

schedule.title: The Masquerade Makes Strange Bedfellows
schedule.description: There has long been a cold war brewing between the Domains of Trenton and New Brunswick. Both are Camarilla cities; strong and certain in their own ways. While their conflict has not spilled into the open, rumor is that this cold war caused the destruction of an entire Anarch Barony in Princeton - the Anarchs caught between warring Princes. With their own territory in West Windsor now threatened, the Independent Alliance has called for peace talks by issuing an invitation to the vampires of Trenton to talk on neutral ground. Only time will tell what the necromancers and snakes of the Alliance have to offer for peace. Hosted by the Princeton Domain of the Mind's Eye Society. Characters can be created in advance by emailing dst.mesprinceton@gmail.com. Join the Central New Jersey Domain of the Mind's Eye Society for glorious battle in Werewolf or social intrigue with Vampire the Masquerade. Make your own character by contacting the Storyteller at ApocVST.MESPrinceton@gmail.com for Werewolf and dst.mesprinceton@gmail.com for Vampire by 7/1/19. Those that attended our previous DEXCON or DREAMATION events are welcome to contact us about continuing their character. Pre-generated characters will be available on a first-come, first-served basis. For more information, please visit us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/MESPrinceton/.

schedule.title: Sleep: The LARP
schedule.description: A DEXCON 22 EXCLUSIVE! "Extremely realistic!" "Very well run!" "An incredible LARP experience!" The reviews are in from last year and this year we're introducing some new mechanics: Quadruple Pillows! As the energy surge from SUGARFEST wears off and the magnitude of DEXCON 22 settles firmly in your bones, you will begin to drift towards your hotel room for the ultimate LARP. Complete rules will be taught in your first dream. Good night.

schedule.title: In the Aftermath
schedule.system: Star Dust: A Mahou Shoujo LARP
schedule.description: A game that explores themes of teamwork, magic, and self- expression in a world filled with apathy and hate. In the battle against Entropy, where will you find your purpose? In this module of Star Dust, you will play Mahou in the aftermath of a battle against The Void. Dealing with civilians and the fall out of battle are just a few small details in the experience of being a Mahou. Star Dust uses thematic lights and lighting effects. As such, it has an epilepsy warning.

schedule.title: The Dark Cult
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! There are those who worship the Dark Prince, and the retributional Punishment he brought upon the six realms. You have been asked to find his followers. Prism is an aquatic role playing game about relationships and conflict resolution.

schedule.title: Badlands Patrol, Part One
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The USS Magellan, a Nova-class science vessel, begins its patrol along the Badlands in the Alpha Quandrant. Officially assigned here to study the peculiar anomalies of the sector, the officers of the Magellan are well aware of the delicate nature of patrolling so close to Cardassian space, especially as tensions with them and the Maquis rise. Playing in all rounds is not a requirement, but the storyline will be connected in each round.

schedule.title: The Doors to Heaven
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! For more than seven centuries Notre-Dame Cathedral has loomed over the life and legend of Paris. Now, impelled by alien frequencies, the church's eccentric organist uses a captive entity to turn its Gothic ironwork into a gate between our world and the horrific realm of Carcosa. Only your intrepid band of 1890s absinthe-soaked art students stand in his way.

schedule.title: The Challenge
schedule.description: In the Time of Troubles, also known as the Arrival, the Godswar, and the Avatar Crisis, was a cataclysmic time period in the chronology of Faerun. Taking place during 1358 DR, the Year of Shadows. The Time of Troubles was a period during which the deities of Faerun were forced to walk the earth in their mortal avatar forms. It was also the year Telamont Tanthul awoken the Tarrasque. This is the challenge in front of you. Bring your own Level 20 character or use one of the pre-gen ones.

schedule.title: Swords Without Master
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The Great Wyrm slithers menacingly in your direction. You ready your sword, while your companion creeps through the shadows towards its hoard. It's beaten you before, but today the fell beast will meet its end. SWM is a game about fantasy characters exploring the mysteries of their world, coming into conflicts with dread peril, and exhibiting feats of ingenuity and prowess. Please bring an inspiration piece for your character to the table! This can range from music to art, physical to digital.

schedule.title: The Wedding of Lord Scurlock
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Lord Scurlock an ancient noble in the Duskvol has found someone suitable to marry after years of being Duskvol's most interesting bachelor. Some say he is a sorcerer, a vampire, and immortal. Despite this scandalous gossip, Lord Scurlock's wedding is highly anticipated and much desired to attend. Your crew has been personally chosen by Lord Scurlock to plan and run the wedding to his exact specifications. Is your crew actually planning the wedding or are you pulling one over on Lord Scurlock? Will you all lose your souls because the napkins do not match the center pieces on the table? We play to find out.

schedule.title: Hammerheads!
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! A setting of teamwork, rescue and recovery in a near future beset by the ravages of climate change, corporate catastrophe, and crisis. You play a member of an elite global disaster management team - the best of the best - recruited from the ranks of first responders, the military, and the scientific community. Equipped with state-of-the-art technology and the impressive High-Altitude Multi-Mission Emergency Response technology. You and your team answer the call when no-one else can. Your latest mission: High in the Alps, a maglev train of dignitaries hangs precariously from a ruined bridge. Can you save them?

schedule.title: The Battling Bosses of Oz
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Like a lot of queer folks, you escaped the monochrome world to come to Oz, but then Oz fell. The City of Verdigris is what you have left. Verdigris, Far below the wastes of Oz that Was, to the Six Bosses who keep their cold peace out of fear of what open war would cost them. But now new players start to emerge, a Quadling fortune teller says she knows where to find the true queen, and you are starting to see monochrome memories of an old life you thought you'd escaped.

schedule.title: The Gate on the Mountain of Sorrows
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Somewhere on the Mountain of Sorrows is a mysterious gate. Legends tell that it leads to riches. Many who seek it are never heard from again. You believe the gate holds the answer to your greatest troubles, and have gone on a pilgrimage with four other strangers to find the gate.

schedule.title: The Angry Snitch
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! It's the final Quidditch game of the 2018-19 school year, and all four Houses are in a dead heat for the Hogwarts Quidditch Cup. Your team is locked in an intense match with your House's biggest rivals, when the Golden Snitch goes rogue! Could there be dark magic afoot? You and your friends will have to sneak away from the match, figure out what's going on, and set things right. Can you do it and get back in time to win the Quidditch Cup for your House? A new Powered by the Apocalypse RPG set in the world of Harry Potter.

schedule.title: You Can Never Go Home
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! It has been 10 years since you all graduated from high school. It has been years since you have been home, and for whatever reason, this seems to be a good time to head back to you quaint little home town in upstate NY. You have changed a lot in the last 10 years. You wonder, what's different back home? This is a two round, single-table event with with hopefully intense and adult horror themes. PLAYERS MUST PLAY IN BOTH ROUNDS.

schedule.title: Rumblings of the Earth
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Its been hundreds of years since the fall of the Old Empire, the Majimonsters running rampant, nearly wiping out the human races, the former masters of the Majimonsters. Now, the Empire is gradually rebuilding and slowly gaining a grasp of the Majimonsters again. Not long after a middle aged woman, a Binder of Majimonsters, there is a mysterious quake that shakes the village. At first everyone thinks its just an avalanche in the distance but they continue to happen. As the only people who can mostly travel safely with your new Majimonster companions, you young Binders are asked to investigate the cause of this and stop it before it causes serious damage to the village.

schedule.title: Assault On The Sky Tower
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! You and your friends are members of a simple tribe. You belong to a stone age tribe and it is now time for your rite of passage. Will you brave the ancients ruins and survive to become an adult. Welcome to the future, prepare to fight mutants and robots. Will you be a human warrior, a plant person, a intelligent animal, or a mutant who can shoot lasers from their fingers?

schedule.title: Poetry in Motion
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Nominated at Fastaval 2012 for Best Mechanics and Participant's Award, My Girl's Sparrow is a quiet science fiction drama about sex, love and alienation. In a not-so-distant-future where physical touch is going out of fashion, two couples and a widow quietly rebel by meeting in person to swap partners and explore themselves and each other. Your primary mode of expressing your characters will be through role playing sex (players hold hands and verbally describe their characters' actions), because what we do and how we react says a lot about who we are. Poetry in motion is not a pornographic scenario - it's also not about abuse. It's about little but crucial things like loneliness, love and desperate hope, and confused, alienated and amazing people. NOTE: Contains sexual situations.

schedule.title: The Adventure Club Chronicles: The Fool
schedule.description: A bent, twisted figure is seen cavorting around town. They are only ever seen in the distance or in a dark, shadowed place. Everywhere they are seen chaos has happened. Walls have become twisted and unable to support the building, sidewalks have turned into open pits. The Adventure Club calls you to action, come help solve the mystery of the shadowed figure.

schedule.title: Bad Blood
schedule.description: This game is part of a larger campaign set in the Magimundi, a new North American magical universe. It takes place in the Pacific Northwest in the mid-1990ss at the height of the grunge music scene and the Magimundi Vampire Wars. You're magic school students and bandmates just trying to make the grade and earn some fans. But your bass player is a vampire and there are rival clans seeking to cause trouble. As the Magimundi officials try to keep the peace (or not) and keep the secrecy of the magical and vampire worlds from the eyes of the mundanes, you just want to keep the band together and maybe get a sweet record deal. This is a whimsical and unpredictable magical universe with some serious undertones of conflict between species. The custom system uses Fate dice and is easy to learn. It focuses on collaboration to solve problems.

schedule.title: Excellent Adventure
schedule.description: It's 1988 and the weather in San Rufus California is GREAT! The birds are chirping, summer is around the corner and your band is finally gonna get serious about learning to play their instruments. The only problem is that if any of you fail your history final you'll never produce the music that changes the world. You are about to go on an Excellent Adventure. You and the members of your band will travel through time and space to meet the people you were supposed to be learning about for the past year. Just remember, the time in San Rufus is always ticking and you've got to be back in time to make your presentations. Don't forget to wind your watch!

schedule.title: Orion War: Character Workshop
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Guided character creation for the Orion War campaign, taking place in three sessions at DEXCON 22. Players will receive character sheets, build a character, and start their journey. www.afterver.se/orionwar

schedule.title: Princess World
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! A game of girls who rule. The capable heroines of the Princess Council struggle against enemies and expectations as they strive to find their place... or create one of their own. Working together, they will weave the tapestry of Princess World. Powered by the Apocalypse. This game is in development and feedback and help is greatly appreciated.

schedule.title: A Rather Short Engagement
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Conspiracy, deception, ink and parchment; A Dire Situation is an epistolary TTRPG in which players weave together a tragic and darkly comic tale of competing egos one letter at a time. Through pen, ink, a handful of stirring scenes and a collection of correspondence between the players at the table, players will establish powerful and bold correspondents, and find the story of their ruin. "A Rather Short Engagement" views a circle of correspondents vying for the attentions, friendship, and for some, resources of a dashing war hero returning to the city of Pholli. The agent in question, Varaquess Bont, discovers that they have been widowed during their dutiful absence, and it is up to the circle of correspondents to attempt to fill the void, whether it be through earnest support or other means. This game is in late playtest.

schedule.title: Recruits Wanted!
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Tired of polishing bulkheads? Sick of scrubbing power conduits? Feel like making a difference to the galaxy at large? Join the Explorer's Guild! We're always in need of enterprising individuals seeking glory and wealth for exploration and salvage missions. Meet new and interesting people from across the galaxy! Explore alien ruins and abandoned ships! Confront exciting new life forms and new civilizations! And of course: bring home lots and lots of treasure! Minus our fee and any medical/funeral expenses, of course, but that hardly ever happens. Really. Join now and get a spiffy recruit's uniform, complete with the official Explorer's red shirt!

schedule.title: Stories of Antiquity
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! In a world where the gods are cruel and powerful, a few heroes choose to stand against them. This GM-guided playtest of a new story game lets players take the role of a hero in the Classic Greek mold, seeking glory and to be remembered in myth. The Great Deeds have already been done, the Perils faced, the Journeys part of legend; here, you play through the story as it has been told through the ages and look to stand higher than all others even as the gods would smite you for your hubris

schedule.title: Thirteen
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! This sleepover was meant to be the best night of your 13 year old life, but what you've found yourself in is a nightmare. Can you and your cohorts save yourselves? Or will this sleepover never end? Content warning: Body horror, death.

schedule.title: Swansgrave Academy for Eldritch Studies: Year 1
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! What is Swansgrave? Think Hogwarts in Lovecraft Country. The players will take on the roles of year one students at Swansgrave Academy for Eldritch Studies. It is the early 1920s and magically apt children from all over the world are recruited to learn the unseen arts and be trained to one day aid in the struggle against the threat of the Elder Dark. As one of those new students, you will encounter danger and explore the unknown. Learn more at https://swansgrave.blogspot.com and contact me at Carcosa.Judge@gmail.com.

schedule.title: They Call Us Chaotic Evil
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Girl by Moonlight is about the tragic struggles of a crew of magical girls against the darkness of an oppressive society. It explores the heartbreak of denying who you really are, and the transcendent power of relationships and community. In this one shot the oppressive society is an adventure's guild. The Guild's purpose to is to plunder temples, lairs, and settlements to acquire items to become more powerful so they may plunder more dangerous places. Those against the Guild system are branded as chaotic evil and written in the Book of Monsters. Your crew of magical girls cannot be bear to be witnesses to this cycle of violence and desecration any longer. Together you look to help these areas of culture reclaim the power that was taken from them. Can the members of the Guild change their ways? Can the world be whole again? Can the cycle of violence be stopped? What does your entry in the Book of Monsters say? We play to find out.

schedule.title: The Bracknell Horror
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Roseville Beach isn't one of those blueblood summertowns like Saltbreeze, Charmington, or Destiny Bay, and it definitely isn't a place that Shoreline County police like to come... just a few years ago they made an annual practice of raiding the beaches for any sign of "deviant activity." Roseville Beach is a queer community, so when Shoreline PD dismisses the recent murders "homocide," it's up to group of locals to figure out who the killer is before they kill again. Take "Shadow over Innsmouth," add a pinch of "Murder She Wrote," and a blend it in to a queer romantic beach thriller, and you'll get "Moonlight on Roseville Beach."

schedule.title: The Great Perdition Heist
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! In just a few days a fortune in gold will be in the vault of the Perdition Bank for one night, and you are going to steal it. You are about to pull off the biggest robbery in a century. All your gang has to do is check out the town, make your final plan, and stay out of trouble.

schedule.title: The Dark Cult
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! There are those who worship the Dark Prince, and the retributional Punishment he brought upon the six realms. You have been asked to find his followers. Prism is an aquatic role playing game about relationships and conflict resolution.

schedule.title: Total Alien Drama Force
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! It's 1993, and you and your friends are just, like, a bunch of regular teens, you know? Or at least you were, until things got hella weird. Aliens? Powers? Saving the world!? As if. You're just trying to, like, make it through high school! Can you get over all your drama and work together to take down the bad guys, or are you headed for a mondo gnarly time? This is a playtest of a new game in progress.

schedule.title: The Tomb of Eternity
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! You, the guardians of the tomb have slumbered for an eternity. Every passing thief, robber, burglar, and invader will never forget the day they stumbled into your tomb for it was their last. Over the centuries, you and your fellow guardians reminisce about the past and what made them what they are. A meditative, introspective freeform game.

schedule.title: Exit Wound
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! People disappear every day in this city. They fall through cracks in the world, go down narrow alleyways and never come out, get arrested by the Transport Police, or the trail of their footprints on the sand just ends suddenly, as if they were swallowed by the clouds. One more disappearance shouldn't matter - so why does Mayor Ward himself want you to look into it? And why you? Does he know the secrets you hide?

schedule.title: Blood Orgy on Vampire Island
schedule.description: While the investigators are enjoying a party cruise, one squall leads the yacht to a floundering fisherman's boat and his statements of doom. Warned away from the "cursed" Wolfstone Island, the decadent host can't resist heading to the shores and carrying on the party there. Uses the Pulp Cthulhu rules, which will be taught at the table if needed. Pregenerated adventurers provided.

schedule.title: Beyond the Valley of the Lunar Amazons
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! From the shadow of Solar City history comes a multiversal positivism known as Totally Radical Champions. 1979, Baltimore. When a SOS signal from a paragon peer Sentinel reaches the Wells Manor's Crime Computer, the Action Team mounts a magnificent mission to the Moo which soon leads them to a verdant valley vouchsafed to viscous vixens and their veiled viscount. Will the Action Team fare well in finding and freeing their fellow or will our heroes be forever lost to the moon side mayhem? A Bronze Age Champions adventure set in an alternate Champions Universe continuity.

schedule.title: Into The Unknown
schedule.description: One of the deadliest artifacts in existence is rumored to have been found. Since its discovery, many expeditions have tried to claim it. Now it's your turn. A fifth edition dungeons and dragons game for level eight.

schedule.title: Ultima Forsan: The Body and Soul
schedule.description: At the end of the Middle Ages, the Plague of the Dead has spread through Europe, Africa and Asia giving rise to the darkest time in history. Now, in the year 1515, heroes from the New Kingdoms are ready to fight to reconquer the World. Ultima Forsan is a game of wild adventures and deadly dangers, set in a macabre alternate version of our Renaissance. It uses the Savage Worlds system.

schedule.title: May The Crocus Never Bloom
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The spirits of winter, Flame, Hunger, Cold, and Fear have been called upon by Yuki Onna to hunt, harry, and capture a lone wandering mortal who has become lost in her winter woods and swiring blizzard. Who will gather the greatest favor of Yuki Onna's in success? Who will be pitied the least in failure? May the crocus never bloom, for you have work to do...

schedule.title: Orion War: Crimes Against Humanity
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! A Human trader has gone missing; you must investigate the Bactaran mine where he was seen last. www.afterver.se/orionwar - Part One of a Living Campaign taking place in three sessions at DEXCON 22. Players do NOT need to play in all three sessions. Note that there is a character creation session at 11:00AM Thursday.

schedule.title: King of Bandits
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Virtue vs. Villainy! Obligation vs. Passion! Justice vs. Tyranny! The heroes of Wulin battle for a better world while struggling with their own intertwined duties, desires, and destinies. You are heroes trying to serve your family, faction, or ideals. High-flying action, romantic confusions, and secret schemes abound. The King of Bandits has died mysteriously, and the region is in peril as bandit chieftains converge to vie for his empty throne.

schedule.title: Blood and Snow, Part One
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! As the ice recedes from the most recent Ice Age, your tribe struggles to survive in a world filled with danger but also wonder. Will you be the Chief or maybe the shaman or the village healer? Will you go on the mammoth hunt, or step into the cave of the short faced bear? Come tell a neolithic tale of wonder, mysticism, and natural beauty from a period of time with no written record. This will be played as a generational game, advancing time as decided by the players. New players are welcome in any slot. Playing in all rounds is not a requirement, but the storyline will be connected in each round.

schedule.title: Mr. Giggles Comes to Dinner
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Alex is a single devoted parent struggling to raise their child Sam. They would do anything for Sam, but Sam has acquired a new imaginary best friend named Mr. Giggles. Everyone will look  through the eyes of Alex to discover the truth behind Sam’s recent phase of trouble making.

schedule.title: Poetry in Motion
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Nominated at Fastaval 2012 for Best Mechanics and Participant's Award, My Girl's Sparrow is a quiet science fiction drama about sex, love and alienation. In a not-so-distant-future where physical touch is going out of fashion, two couples and a widow quietly rebel by meeting in person to swap partners and explore themselves and each other. Your primary mode of expressing your characters will be through role playing sex (players hold hands and verbally describe their characters' actions), because what we do and how we react says a lot about who we are. Poetry in motion is not a pornographic scenario - it's also not about abuse. It's about little but crucial things like loneliness, love and desperate hope, and confused, alienated and amazing people. NOTE: Contains sexual situations.

schedule.title: A Fistful of Shins
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Shins make the Ninth World go around: A shin is a bit of the old worlds, shiny and hard. The Energons of Picalah will pay you some for work digging in the Lambent Fields. A shin will buy you a meal, or a tool, or a body for a night. First you get the shins, then you get the numenera, then you get yourself in a heap of trouble, because a billion years in the Earth's future, so much has changed, and so much stays the same.

schedule.title: Out of the Frying Pan
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Become a Super Hero and take on the nefarious villain BreakFast in the ever darkened streets of The Atomnyy Zavod. This game is playable with younger children but a load of fun for adults. Sign up for some pun-filled, lighthearted adventure.

schedule.title: Fight For What You Love
schedule.system: Red Carnations on a Black Grave
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! For just over two months in 1871, the Paris Commune tried to make an egalitarian, socialist state a reality despite disagreement within their walls and attacks from outside it. This is the story of 12 Communards, their messy personal lives and their attempts to create a utopia in the face of impending death. How far would you go for what you believe in? Would you stand firm even if it meant your death?

schedule.title: Vaporwear
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The world has ended but the rent is still due. Players take on the roll of "Takers", retrieval specialists who venture into the zombie infested heart of fallen America. IN the game of Economic Horror, you aren't out looking for adventure. You are looking to get paid, feed your family, and make it to retirement. Best of luck.

schedule.title: End of the Line
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The Queen has no heirs. Nor does it look likely she will bear any. Adoption is likely the best route forward, but she has not identified a suitable candidate. Can you convince her it should be you? Or perhaps a malleable protege, one easy for you to control? The only problem is that every courtier in the empire is maneuvering to do the same. PLAYERS MUST PLAY IN ALL THREE SESSIONS.

schedule.title: World of Warriors: Champion of the Multiverse!, Part One
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Ms. Marvelous, the Top Notch Champ has gone missing, and the World of Warriors needs to crown a new champion of the Multiverse! Do you have what it takes to battle past the greatest warriors throughout space and time to become the champion of the Multiverse? World Wide Wrestling is a pro wrestling RPG based on the Apocalypse World engine, with strong narrative element. This game is inspired by the world of comic books and wrestling organizations like Chikara, and Lucha Underground. So while everyone's on screen character is a hero, they are still just normal people putting on a show. So like most wrestling, this federation is entirely about playing heroes and villains, whether from a favorite comic of yours, or one you made up in your head! Players are encouraged to sign up for all three event slots, but may sign up for any or all. Players who pre-register for all three slots will be given first priority in choosing characters.

schedule.title: Night of Masks
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! As art students in 1890s Paris, waking up in on the floor of your garret, suffering the after-effects of epic absinthe overindulgence is less remarkable than you’d care to admit. Last night you attended your art school’s annual costume ball, a legendary bacchanal so wild that riots sometimes result. But hazy memory tells you that something else happened...something unearthly. Something dreadful. If only you could remember what it was...

schedule.title: Weird Stories
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A one-shot, zero-prep, GM-less storytelling RPG where players will tell stories similar to the films of David Lynch, novels by Hiroki Murakami or Jeff VanderMeer, and the TV series Lost. These stories have many more questions than answers, and remain shrouded in mystery throughout. This is a playtest of the first RPG from Formal Ferret Games!

schedule.title: A Safe Fairyland
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! An investigation into a shadowy organization leads the party into what seems to be an idyllic pastoral countryside. This adventure will deal with themes of life, innocence, and competing concepts of peace.

schedule.title: Help Wanted
schedule.description: The strange events related in this dark tale from legend-haunted Arkham center upon a strange series of 'help wanted' advertisements that have been appearing in the Arkham Advertiser over a period of months. Each advertisement has a very similar, and very odd, style but asks for assistance with a different - but equally specialized - skill. The advertisement runs sporadically for weeks on end, then disappears, only to be replaced with another variant version a few days later. Anyone whose curiosity is piqued by these cryptic "want ads" will find themselves swept up in a most unusual mystery - perhaps one of the weirdest cases of their investigative careers. Why would someone have need of such oddly specific skills? What pattern is there in the serial disappearances? How do these events tie in with unbelievable tales about an 18th Century self-style sorcerer from Arkham's dark past? Investigators are provided but players may bring their own favorite 1920s character.

schedule.title: The Horde
schedule.description: It was supposed to be so easy. In and out, no one gets hurt. Then the trap went off and all hell broke loose. The Horde is chasing you and you have no way out. "Quick into the arena at least we will have room to move as we fight." Let's hope for your sake, that the dead, stay dead. A fifth edition dungeons and dragons game for players of level ten.

schedule.title: Rogue Two
schedule.description: You are a member of a rebel special ops/undercover multi-discipline team, and are being trained at a secret base on Yavin 4 in counter-intelligence, insurgency, information gathering. Rumor is, you're about to get orders sending you to a 'pit' of a system called Tatooine. We will be using the an updated version of the classic 1987 Star Wars Roleplaying Game D6 system from West End Games. Simple and fast game mechanics; no experience necessary. Captures the feel of the Rebellion era very well. Players will select one of the character templates included in the system, provided by the game-master. Force abilities for player characters have significant restrictions; no one will be playing a Jedi. But remember, the Force will be with you... always.

schedule.title: A Small Assignment
schedule.description: Debt is a hard master, but trying to find work on Absalom Station when you're basically fresh off a shuttle from whatever part of the Pact Worlds you left behind and have no contacts or references. Alphonse is probably not a legitimate businessman, but he was willing to loan you the credits you needed to outfit yourself with decent gear. Now he has an offer; a chance to settle your debt and maybe even earn some extra credits. Dinner and drinks at Scafuolis. Don't be late. This is a teaching scenario designed to give players a feel for the Starfinder game system and world. Pregenerated characters provided; bring dice and a pencil if possible.

schedule.title: Still Waters
schedule.description: The Temerian Capital of Vizima has fallen under a tidal wave of black and gold. You were there, you saw everything. The Nilfgaardian war machine hit the walls of the capital and suddenly everything was blood and steel. You managed to drag yourself out of that hell and head north. With Nilfgarrdian scouting patrols hounding you, the few survivors, you've stopped recognizing the deep forest and rural towns you're passing though. Only when you hit the swamp did your group realize you were near the Pontar River. Now all that's left is to cross and look for shelter in Redania.

schedule.title: Four Sherlock Holmes and a Vampire
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The title pretty much says it all. The game concept was proposed by the McElroy Brothers on the MBMBAM podcast (creators of the Adventure Zone), and created by fan Andrew Young. It's a very silly game where all the players are different versions of Sherlock Holmes (from various TV shows and movies), there's a murder to be solved, and one of them is secretly a vampire.

schedule.title: Seance
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The Widower begs you to attend the seánce of their most recently passed. The medium must surely be a hack, but whatever brings comfort to those who mourn so be it. But surely the happenings around the house are only in your head. Or are they...?

schedule.title: Badlands Patrol, Part Two
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The USS Magellan, a Nova-class science vessel, continues its patrol along the Badlands in the Alpha Quandrant. Officially assigned here to study the peculiar anomalies of the sector, the officers of the Magellan are well aware of the delicate nature of patrolling so close to Cardassian space, especially as tensions with them and the Maquis rise. Playing in all rounds is not a requirement, but the storyline will be connected in each round.

schedule.title: Swords Without Master
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The Great Wyrm slithers menacingly in your direction. You ready your sword, while your companion creeps through the shadows towards its hoard. It's beaten you before, but today the fell beast will meet its end. SWM is a game about fantasy characters exploring the mysteries of their world, coming into conflicts with dread peril, and exhibiting feats of ingenuity and prowess. Please bring an inspiration piece for your character to the table! This can range from music to art, physical to digital.

schedule.title: Recruits Wanted!
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Tired of polishing bulkheads? Sick of scrubbing power conduits? Feel like making a difference to the galaxy at large? Join the Explorer's Guild! We're always in need of enterprising individuals seeking glory and wealth for exploration and salvage missions. Meet new and interesting people from across the galaxy! Explore alien ruins and abandoned ships! Confront exciting new life forms and new civilizations! And of course: bring home lots and lots of treasure! Minus our fee and any medical/funeral expenses, of course, but that hardly ever happens. Really. Join now and get a spiffy recruit's uniform, complete with the official Explorer's red shirt!

schedule.title: The Wedding of Lord Scurlock
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Lord Scurlock an ancient noble in the Duskvol has found someone suitable to marry after years of being Duskvol's most interesting bachelor. Some say he is a sorcerer, a vampire, and immortal. Despite this scandalous gossip, Lord Scurlock's wedding is highly anticipated and much desired to attend. Your crew has been personally chosen by Lord Scurlock to plan and run the wedding to his exact specifications. Is your crew actually planning the wedding or are you pulling one over on Lord Scurlock? Will you all lose your souls because the napkins do not match the center pieces on the table? We play to find out.

schedule.title: Hammerheads!
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! A setting of teamwork, rescue and recovery in a near future beset by the ravages of climate change, corporate catastrophe, and crisis. You play a member of an elite global disaster management team - the best of the best - recruited from the ranks of first responders, the military, and the scientific community. Equipped with state-of-the-art technology and the impressive High-Altitude Multi-Mission Emergency Response technology. You and your team answer the call when no-one else can. Your latest mission: High in the Alps, a maglev train of dignitaries hangs precariously from a ruined bridge. Can you save them?

schedule.title: The Battling Bosses of Oz
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Like a lot of queer folks, you escaped the monochrome world to come to Oz, but then Oz fell. The City of Verdigris is what you have left. Verdigris, Far below the wastes of Oz that Was, to the Six Bosses who keep their cold peace out of fear of what open war would cost them. But now new players start to emerge, a Quadling fortune teller says she knows where to find the true queen, and you are starting to see monochrome memories of an old life you thought you'd escaped.

schedule.title: You Can Never Go Home
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! It has been 10 years since you all graduated from high school. It has been years since you have been home, and for whatever reason, this seems to be a good time to head back to you quaint little home town in upstate NY. You have changed a lot in the last 10 years. You wonder, what's different back home? This is a two round, single-table event with with hopefully intense and adult horror themes. PLAYERS MUST PLAY IN BOTH ROUNDS.

schedule.title: Rumblings of the Earth
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Its been hundreds of years since the fall of the Old Empire, the Majimonsters running rampant, nearly wiping out the human races, the former masters of the Majimonsters. Now, the Empire is gradually rebuilding and slowly gaining a grasp of the Majimonsters again. Not long after a middle aged woman, a Binder of Majimonsters, there is a mysterious quake that shakes the village. At first everyone thinks its just an avalanche in the distance but they continue to happen. As the only people who can mostly travel safely with your new Majimonster companions, you young Binders are asked to investigate the cause of this and stop it before it causes serious damage to the village.

schedule.title: Under Construction
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Everybody knows construction sites make the best playgrounds. They're places where kids can bond on their own terms, and learn how to solve their own disputes without adult interference...who are we fooling? They're insanely dangerous places where you can balance a risk of severe bodily harm against not being a chicken. Speaking of chicken...

schedule.title: Apocalypse on Infinite Worlds
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The settings of every single Apocalypse World hack have collided in a mysterious multiversal cataclysm. Sinister factions such as the shadow patriarchy, the wolves of the Maelstrom, the darkness over Dragonia, conniving wrestling promoters, and the jocks from the high school football team have joined forces to spread ruin. A ragtag party of unlikely allies from across the Apocalypse Worlds is the only hope to stop them. Prior PbtA experience is strongly recommended; bring a couple of your favorite playbooks and we'll see if we can make this work long enough to save the multiverse.

schedule.title: Humanity's Exodus
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! A sci-fi role playing game where you play fighter pilots aboard Forward Base Osiris: the last human colony in the universe. The Earth has been ravaged by the all-consuming Hivemind, forcing humanity to flee into uncharted space in search of a new home. In play, you lead the fleet on a galaxy-spanning quest to escape the Hivemind before it’s too late. This game uses the Powered by the Apocalypse engine and draws inspiration from Battlestar Galactica and The Expanse.

schedule.title: The Expanse AU: Anywhere in the Galaxy But Here
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! What does this button do? Where does this wormhole go? Answer life's important questions quickly as you struggle to escape an unknown alien war machine. This sci-fi action adventure is very loosely based on the Expanse TV series. (No knowledge of the series is required.)

schedule.title: The Weight of Judgment
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! In the year of our Lord 1350, an unholy plague sweeps across our beloved Britain. They say that one in three have been marked for death. But marked by whom? Are the sick being punished for their sins by God? No. This foul curse is the work of the Devil and his wicked agent, the Witch. The woman must be taken in a caged cart to the Holy Island of Lindisfarne. Once there, an ancient ritual will be performed to cleanse this land of her and her black plague. It will take two weeks to reach the site, but as the sun breaks the horizon on the Sabbath then the Witch will face her absolution. This is the story of that journey.

schedule.title: The Cosmic Tyrant Next Door
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! It's been ten years since Xarlaa, Queen Priestess of the Antarean Star Empire, saved the universe by betraying The Gnawer of Reality to the heroes of Earth. Since then, she's been living simply as "Ms. X" in a quiet neighborhood of Omnidelphia. What effect has her alien technology had on her neighbors? What will those neighbors do when Ms. X's old enemies show up looking for revenge?

schedule.title: Darn His Luck
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! 1980, Baltimore, opening day of Harborplace, our heroic Action Team is in attendance when super stinky Darn Tooting pays a visit and an extreme case of luck just happens to be on his side. Can our heroes break the super criminal's winning streak or will they just have to suffer their loss poorly and darn his luck? A Bronze Age Champions adventure set in an alternate Champions Universe continuity.

schedule.title: The Adventure Club Chronicles: The Tower
schedule.description: The sleepy little town of Dunnsburg is ripped from it's slumber as a series of explosions rip through the center of town. What or who caused this? The Adventure Club helps the police find the evil scoundrel that is responsible.

schedule.title: Crisis in Caracas
schedule.description: Torn from today's headlines, instability in Venezuela has reached a tipping point as President Nicolas Maduro holds on to power despite hyperinflation, mass exodus of the middle class and increasing isolation in the global community. Our agents are tasked with overthrowing Maduro in order to allow the uprising’s leader, Juan Guaido, to assume the Presidency. We'll use streamlined, player-facing version of Top Secret rules to play an adventure in TV’s Mission: Impossible style—where subterfuge and deception are essential to success.

schedule.title: A Conspiracy of Dragons
schedule.description: Ben Forest presents his one-of-kind eight-hour extravaganza game; an all new adventure for DEXCON 22. The young High Lady Laura of Silverymoon; depends on your wit and wisdom during these challenging times. Many are working to disrupt and destroy High Lady Laura's work to build a grand alliance in the North. New and returning members of the "Bloomfield's Heroes" adventuring company are welcome. Join the "(Young) Bloomfield's Heroes" adventuring company; new members are always welcome. Adventures are based out of city-state of Silverymoon in the D&D Forgotten Realms North setting with some modifications. Challenges for players may include: monsters, foul-conditions, love, politics, treachery, friends and rivals, a war. As with all Bloomfield's Heroes adventures; outcomes and events can be unique; more like a home game. Pre-made characters are available or you're welcome to create your own; for guidelines for building your 12th level party member please email me at: benforest1@gmail.com. We will take a one-hour lunch break. Please note, this is a friendly game that takes the better part of a day; there is role playing and action with the core objective being fun for everyone. Please do not sign up if you're (1) only interest is battles, (2) do not enjoy team play or (3) have been up all-night. Small computers and tablets are welcome for use with the game; bring a 5th Edition Player's Handbook, real dice and a character printout if you create your own.

schedule.title: For the Queen
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The queen is on an important journey, accompanied only by those that love her most. But will they love her when she needs them? A card-based story-building game

schedule.title: Mission: Accomplished!
schedule.description: Once the mission is over, it's time to sit down with your friendly HR manager and hash things out as a team. Finger pointing, credit stealing, and unfounded accusations against your teammates are your weapons in the meeting room. Your job, no, your DUTY as a secret agent, is to get as much credit as possible for being the one that saved the day. You are welcome to be a spectator in the audience, watching the actual players entertain you with freeform nonsense.

schedule.title: The Underground: A Sam & Fuzzy RPG
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Fans of Sam and Fuzzy may have noticed the dark tide beneath Pittsburgh. This is not the first time such things have been unleashed and the secret life of Robert Boyle! New players may just want to run around chasing subterranian robot ninja vs. shape shifting slug people in the tunnles under WW2 steel mills. Strangeness abounds can you solve the myteries or will you become part of the Underground conspiracy?

schedule.title: A Rather Short Engagement
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Conspiracy, deception, ink and parchment; A Dire Situation is an epistolary TTRPG in which players weave together a tragic and darkly comic tale of competing egos one letter at a time. Through pen, ink, a handful of stirring scenes and a collection of correspondence between the players at the table, players will establish powerful and bold correspondents, and find the story of their ruin. "A Rather Short Engagement" views a circle of correspondents vying for the attentions, friendship, and for some, resources of a dashing war hero returning to the city of Pholli. The agent in question, Varaquess Bont, discovers that they have been widowed during their dutiful absence, and it is up to the circle of correspondents to attempt to fill the void, whether it be through earnest support or other means. This game is in late playtest.

schedule.title: Orion War: Battle of Ceres
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The Bactarans have blown through the blockade and must be stopped before they can report to their homeworld. www.afterver.se/orionwar - Part Two of a Living Campaign taking place in three sessions at DEXCON 22. Players do NOT need to play in all three sessions. Note that there is a character creation session at 11:00AM Thursday.

schedule.title: Nuns vs Evil
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! A game of darkness, sisterhood, and faith. Something sinister is threatening your convent this hallowmass season. How will you and your sisters rally to renounce Satan and all his works? How will your faith be tested from All Hallows' Eve to All Saints' Day to All Souls' Day? Playbooks based on archetypes of religious sisters. Will you be the naive Novice, the crotchety Elder, the alarming Mystic?

schedule.title: Stories of Antiquity
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! In a world where the gods are cruel and powerful, a few heroes choose to stand against them. This GM-guided playtest of a new story game lets players take the role of a hero in the Classic Greek mold, seeking glory and to be remembered in myth. The Great Deeds have already been done, the Perils faced, the Journeys part of legend; here, you play through the story as it has been told through the ages and look to stand higher than all others even as the gods would smite you for your hubris

schedule.title: Thirteen
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! This sleepover was meant to be the best night of your 13 year old life, but what you've found yourself in is a nightmare. Can you and your cohorts save yourselves? Or will this sleepover never end? Content warning: Body horror, death.

schedule.title: Murder in a Small Town
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! It's a small town and somebody has been murdered. Everyone is a suspect.
