Including everyone at this table. *Especially* everyone at this table. In this game, everyone plays a character connected to a murder victim. They will all be incredibly suspicious, like they could each be the murderer. The style of storytelling is flexible, so this game is welcoming for both beginners and experienced role players. Content Warning: Violence. Murder.

schedule.title: Swansgrave Academy for Eldritch Studies: Year 1
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! What is Swansgrave? Think Hogwarts in Lovecraft Country. The players will take on the roles of year one students at Swansgrave Academy for Eldritch Studies. It is the early 1920s and magically apt children from all over the world are recruited to learn the unseen arts and be trained to one day aid in the struggle against the threat of the Elder Dark. As one of those new students, you will encounter danger and explore the unknown. Learn more at https://swansgrave.blogspot.com and contact me at Carcosa.Judge@gmail.com.

schedule.title: They Call Us Chaotic Evil
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Girl by Moonlight is about the tragic struggles of a crew of magical girls against the darkness of an oppressive society. It explores the heartbreak of denying who you really are, and the transcendent power of relationships and community. In this one shot the oppressive society is an adventure's guild. The Guild's purpose to is to plunder temples, lairs, and settlements to acquire items to become more powerful so they may plunder more dangerous places. Those against the Guild system are branded as chaotic evil and written in the Book of Monsters. Your crew of magical girls cannot be bear to be witnesses to this cycle of violence and desecration any longer. Together you look to help these areas of culture reclaim the power that was taken from them. Can the members of the Guild change their ways? Can the world be whole again? Can the cycle of violence be stopped? What does your entry in the Book of Monsters say? We play to find out.

schedule.title: The Search for Nessie
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The Loch Ness Monster has captured the world's attention, one blurry photo at a time. But that's not enough for this intrepid crew! You're ready to take the search for Nessie into her natural habitat. Delve into the unknown depths of the mysterious loch, where more than just monsters may be found...

schedule.title: Ghost Mountain
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The western frontier was wild and dangerous, and there were many stories that few lived to tell. In some places the lands of the living and the dead became entangled. A terrible thunderstorm tore one of these places away from this mortal coil, and it became a sort of purgatory. Only the deeds of great heroes can keep Ghost Mountain from falling into hell, but you seem to be closest thing to heroes the mountain has.

schedule.title: That Lobster Stole My Tuna Sandwich!
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Giant lobsters have swarmed throughout the city, stealing seafood snacks, triggering traffic tie-ups, and being a general nuisance. People will pay good money for the InSpectres to corrall these crafty crustaceans. Who you gonna call?

schedule.title: With Great Hope, Comes Great Responsibility
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Set 10 years after the events of "My Name is Ruin" (from DREAMATION 2019), things have not gone well for the citizens of Earth. The world is still recovering from the betrayal of Praetorian, the disbanding of the Tribune program and the Otherworldly horrors that descended on the earth during the Battle of Halcyon City. But a new generation of heroes have risen and hope springs eternal. But will hope be enough? This is a two round, single-table event with elements of superhero and horror themes and id for adults only. PLAYERS MUST PLAY IN BOTH ROUNDS.

schedule.title: Assault On The Sky Tower
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! You and your friends are members of a simple tribe. You belong to a stone age tribe and it is now time for your rite of passage. Will you brave the ancients ruins and survive to become an adult. Welcome to the future, prepare to fight mutants and robots. Will you be a human warrior, a plant person, a intelligent animal, or a mutant who can shoot lasers from their fingers?

schedule.title: The Dark Cult
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! There are those who worship the Dark Prince, and the retributional Punishment he brought upon the six realms. You have been asked to find his followers. Prism is an aquatic role playing game about relationships and conflict resolution.

schedule.title: Vive la Commune!
schedule.system: Red Carnations on a Black Grave
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! For just over two months in 1871, the Paris Commune tried to make an egalitarian, socialist state a reality despite disagreement within their walls and attacks from outside it. This is the story of 12 Communards, their messy personal lives and their attempts to create a utopia in the face of impending death. How far would you go for what you believe in? Would you stand firm even if it meant your death? A freeform game very much in the spirit of Montsegur: 1244 and Witch: the Road to Lindisfarne. Content warnings: character death, doomed revolution.

schedule.title: The Hackey Sack of Rome!
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! 1500 years ago the Visigoths were one of the most powerful of the barbarian tribes tearing the Roman Empire apart. In a tragic ouija board accident, a Mall Goth accidentally summoned a clan of Visigoths forward to the year 1996! The Visigoths have sworn to conquer Los Angeles and extract revenge on the Mall Goths - where conquest means opening up several stores in the mall, and revenge may involve some kissing. A lighthearted game of dating, paganism, 90's goth culture, and more bisexuals than you can shake a stick at.

schedule.title: Adventures in Middle Earth: Everybody Wants to Go to Heaven
schedule.description: Recent turmoil in the lands south of Gondor has led to ancient secrets emerging from the sands. A group of enterprising individuals have taken advantage and begin a journey to absolve themselves of past misdeeds. This is an Arcane Circle role playing event, based on an original RP variant based on the old Dungeon & Dragons RPS. The game setting is in Tolkien's Middle Earth during the mid-Third Age around 1700. This system is for mature players, emphasizing interactive role playing using real-time combat, and occurs in a current Middle Earth campaign. No previous experience with the system necessary.

schedule.title: Spoiled Milk
schedule.description: The strange events related in this dark tale from legend-haunted Arkham center upon the public health crisis that has swept to the attention of many locals. Some foul taint seems to have settled upon the milk supplies which are delivered daily to thousands of Arkhamites. People have reported vomiting, bleeding... and other, far, stranger symptoms. The authorities have been aiming to keep a lid on it, but a plucky reporter from the Arkham Advertiser has received an 'inside tip' that promises to blow the whole scandal wide open. Authorities are keen to stop the reporter from publishing any follow-ups to his initial story, but it's not as easy as that ... for, the reporter has himself mysteriously gone missing. What shadowy forces are behind the fouling of Arkham's milk supply? Are the local dairies - each scrabbling to establish their "healthful" image - somehow to blame? Or is there something more sinister behind the weird mutations which sufferers of poisoning are starting to display? Investigators are provided. Players may bring their favorite 1920s CoC character to play as well if they so choose.

schedule.title: The Challenge
schedule.description: In the Time of Troubles, also known as the Arrival, the Godswar, and the Avatar Crisis, was a cataclysmic time period in the chronology of Faerun. Taking place during 1358 DR, the Year of Shadows. The Time of Troubles was a period during which the deities of Faerun were forced to walk the earth in their mortal avatar forms. It was also the year Telamont Tanthul awoken the Tarrasque. This is the challenge in front of you. Bring your own Level 20 character or use one of the pre-gen ones.

schedule.title: Bones Of Dead Gods
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! The world's governments have kept the ruins of the Lost City of Atlantis a secret for years. So when the sensors protecting it at the bottom of the ocean are breached, the Freedom Five are asked to investigate.

schedule.title: Throne of the Mnoren
schedule.description: The Omniscient Emperor of Cidri, last scion of the mighty Mnoren planeshifters who created the transdimensional world of Cidri in all of its immense variety and majesty, has just abdicated in favor of a merely human functionary. In the Palace Ultima that looms over the Imperial capital of Predimuskity, the resulting power vacuum is a chance for gold and glory. The reins of power are up for grabs - who will seize the throne of the Mnoren? The PCs are courtiers and soldiers in the Palace Ultima who have to decide how to hold the Empire together - or how to get a piece of it for themselves.

schedule.title: Crossroads at the Cannons
schedule.description: "We showed them good. How far have we gotten?" "Not far enough. Let's go!" The band of NATO soldiers needs to decide what to do next after helping their fellow soldiers by destroying two Warsaw Pact howitzers. They are completely surrounded. Third session (prior experience NOT required) of this post-nuke, conventional combat, World War III RPG that is Twilight 2000.

schedule.title: DIE
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! You were just a normal group of teens. You were in the drama club, or the punk band, or just the people who sat at the reject table in high school. You got together, you played a fantasy RPG. Some of you thought it was the best thing ever, some of you thought it was dumb, and some of you both. And you stopped. You grew up. Some of you had families, some of you didn't. And now, you're all back together. Older. Imaginations run down. Back to play one last session. This time though, there's something uneasy about the glimmer in your GM's eyes. This time, it's just not an escape. DIE is a game about a bunch of people transported from their mundane lives to a fantasy world, and about them trying to find their way home - or not.

schedule.title: Jorune: The Trouble with Thriddle
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Ossat, the town handyman, is off on one of his occasional prospecting tours. So why is a thriddle knocking at your door on a cold, rainy evening, looking for him? Something smells funny, and it's not just the wet thombos outside. The Trouble with Thriddle is an adventure set on the fantastic world of Jorune, using a much lighter rule set.

schedule.title: Orion War: Rival War
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The murder of a Bactaran aboard an asteroid mine has drawn attention from the EGF authorities. You must investigate and learn about the Bactarans. www.afterver.se/orionwar - Part Three of a Living Campaign taking place in three sessions at DEXCON 22. Players do NOT need to play in all three sessions. Note that there is a character creation session at 11:00AM Thursday.

schedule.title: The Most Nakedest Game
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Once again the ship's cook has roped the crew into competing in a reality tridee. This time it's Galactic Survivor, the hit show where contestants must endure a series of hostile alien environments armed with their wits alone. Will you win the prize? Or will your bleached hard body parts join those of other non-winners?

schedule.title: Rogues of Ravnica
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! In the labyrinthine catacombs of the city-plane of Ravnica lie vast troves of treasure and knowledge—but the powerful Guilds of the plane don't trust each other enough to collaborate on an excavation. The solution? You: a disposable, deniable group of misfits, cobbled together from the various Guilds, and dispatched to investigate a dangerous but potentially lucrative hoard. What will you discover? And will your inter-Guild party end up killing each other along the way? This game will use the Dungeon World system, be set in Magic: The Gathering's Ravnica, and incorporate material from the D&D supplement The Guildmaster's Guide to Ravnica. Players will choose Guild affiliations and have access to custom moves based on those Guilds.

schedule.title: The Sunless Citadel
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! A fortress that became buried in the earth ages ago became known as the Sunless Citadel. In the citadel's core grows the terrible Gulthias Tree, shepherded by the twisted druid, Belak the Outcast. The Tree spawns magical life giving (and life stealing) fruit, as well as evil creatures known as twig blights. This classic adventure has been adapted to use the Dungeon World system.

schedule.title: The Gate on the Mountain of Sorrows
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Somewhere on the Mountain of Sorrows is a mysterious gate. Legends tell that it leads to riches. Many who seek it are never heard from again. You believe the gate holds the answer to your greatest troubles, and have gone on a pilgrimage with four other strangers to find the gate.

schedule.title: King of Bandits
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Virtue vs. Villainy! Obligation vs. Passion! Justice vs. Tyranny! The heroes of Wulin battle for a better world while struggling with their own intertwined duties, desires, and destinies. You are heroes trying to serve your family, faction, or ideals. High-flying action, romantic confusions, and secret schemes abound. The King of Bandits has died mysteriously, and the region is in peril as bandit chieftains converge to vie for his empty throne.

schedule.title: Blood and Snow, Part Two
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! As the ice recedes from the most recent Ice Age, your tribe struggles to survive in a world filled with danger but also wonder. Will you be the Chief or maybe the shaman or the village healer? Will you go on the mammoth hunt, or step into the cave of the short faced bear? Come tell a neolithic tale of wonder, mysticism, and natural beauty from a period of time with no written record. This will be played as a generational game, advancing time as decided by the players. New players are welcome in any slot. Playing in all rounds is not a requirement, but the storyline will be connected in each round.

schedule.title: Overlord
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Live Free or Die (LFOD) is a hack of Don't Rest Your Head (DRYH), by Evil Hat Games. Inspired by the novels of Eric Ambler, Alan Furst, Colleen Hoover's _Verity_ and others, LFOD is a game about average people called upon to do extraordinary things. Dice categories in DRYH are replaced by Liberty, Capture, and Collaboration with characters caught at the intersection between forces of authority and forces of liberty. In June 1944, the Allied invasion to begin the liberation of Europe is imminent. Resistance networks throughout France operate in the shadows to help prepare the way. Each character must decide the cost they are willing to pay to survive the coming crucible.

schedule.title: Short Stories About Princesses
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! A game of girls who rule. The capable heroines of the Princess Council struggle against enemies and expectations as they strive to find their place... or create one of their own. Working together, they will weave the tapestry of Princess World. Powered by the Apocalypse. This game is in development and feedback and help is greatly appreciated.

schedule.title: Fight For What You Love
schedule.system: Red Carnations on a Black Grave
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! For just over two months in 1871, the Paris Commune tried to make an egalitarian, socialist state a reality despite disagreement within their walls and attacks from outside it. This is the story of 12 Communards, their messy personal lives and their attempts to create a utopia in the face of impending death. How far would you go for what you believe in? Would you stand firm even if it meant your death?

schedule.title: Paris is Burning
schedule.system: Red Carnations on a Black Grave
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! For just over two months in 1871, the Paris Commune tried to make an egalitarian, socialist state a reality despite disagreement within their walls and attacks from outside it. This is the story of 12 Communards, their messy personal lives and their attempts to create a utopia in the face of impending death. How far would you go for what you believe in? Would you stand firm even if it meant your death? A freeform game very much in the spirit of Montsegur: 1244 and Witch: the Road to Lindisfarne.

schedule.title: End of the Line
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The Queen has no heirs. Nor does it look likely she will bear any. Adoption is likely the best route forward, but she has not identified a suitable candidate. Can you convince her it should be you? Or perhaps a malleable protege, one easy for you to control? The only problem is that every courtier in the empire is maneuvering to do the same. PLAYERS MUST PLAY IN ALL THREE SESSIONS.

schedule.title: World of Warriors: Champion of the Multiverse!, Part Two
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Ms. Marvelous, the Top Notch Champ has gone missing, and the World of Warriors needs to crown a new champion of the Multiverse! Do you have what it takes to battle past the greatest warriors throughout space and time to become the champion of the Multiverse? World Wide Wrestling is a pro wrestling RPG based on the Apocalypse World engine, with strong narrative element. This game is inspired by the world of comic books and wrestling organizations like Chikara, and Lucha Underground. So while everyone's on screen character is a hero, they are still just normal people putting on a show. So like most wrestling, this federation is entirely about playing heroes and villains, whether from a favorite comic of yours, or one you made up in your head! Players are encouraged to sign up for all three event slots, but may sign up for any or all. Players who pre-register for all three slots will be given first priority in choosing characters.

schedule.title: Weird Stories
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A one-shot, zero-prep, GM-less storytelling RPG where players will tell stories similar to the films of David Lynch, novels by Hiroki Murakami or Jeff VanderMeer, and the TV series Lost. These stories have many more questions than answers, and remain shrouded in mystery throughout. This is a playtest of the first RPG from Formal Ferret Games!

schedule.title: Adventures in Middle Earth: While the Master is Away
schedule.description: In the wild lands of Harendor, a new realm flourishes in a burst of growth after its conception. While its Lord and Master journeys abroad, its growth and protection lies in able hands left behind. Opportunity is yours, but so is the danger. First of a convention-long story arc; includes character growth. This is an Arcane Circle role playing event, based on an original RP variant based on the old Dungeon & Dragons RPS. The game setting is in Tolkien's Middle Earth during the mid-Third Age around 1700. This system is for mature players, emphasizing interactive role playing using real-time combat, and occurs in a current Middle Earth campaign. No previous experience with the system necessary.

schedule.title: Help Wanted
schedule.description: The strange events related in this dark tale from legend-haunted Arkham center upon a strange series of 'help wanted' advertisements that have been appearing in the Arkham Advertiser over a period of months. Each advertisement has a very similar, and very odd, style but asks for assistance with a different - but equally specialized - skill. The advertisement runs sporadically for weeks on end, then disappears, only to be replaced with another variant version a few days later. Anyone whose curiosity is piqued by these cryptic "want ads" will find themselves swept up in a most unusual mystery - perhaps one of the weirdest cases of their investigative careers. Why would someone have need of such oddly specific skills? What pattern is there in the serial disappearances? How do these events tie in with unbelievable tales about an 18th Century self-style sorcerer from Arkham's dark past? Investigators are provided but players may bring their own favorite 1920s character.

schedule.title: Into The Unknown
schedule.description: One of the deadliest artifacts in existence is rumored to have been found. Since its discovery, many expeditions have tried to claim it. Now it's your turn. A fifth edition dungeons and dragons game for level eight.

schedule.title: Tomb of Horrors
schedule.description: In the Far reaches of the world lies the Tomb of Horrors. A place filled with monsters, traps, and gold. Can you survive it? A 5E Dungeons and Dragons Adventure for characters of level 9 to 12. Players may bring their own characters. GM has final say if characters are allowable.

schedule.title: Magical Creatures Round-Up
schedule.description: The Care of Magical Creatures professor, the groundskeeper, and a mysterious researcher have designed a group field exam that is perfectly safe! You're competing against other teams and you pass or fail as a group. What cryptids and creatures will you encounter, and will you have the tools to find them, meet the goals of the exam, and get out alive?

schedule.title: Rogue Two
schedule.description: You are a member of a rebel special ops/undercover multi-discipline team, and are being trained at a secret base on Yavin 4 in counter-intelligence, insurgency, information gathering. Rumor is, you're about to get orders sending you to a 'pit' of a system called Tatooine. We will be using the an updated version of the classic 1987 Star Wars Roleplaying Game D6 system from West End Games. Simple and fast game mechanics; no experience necessary. Captures the feel of the Rebellion era very well. Players will select one of the character templates included in the system, provided by the game-master. Force abilities for player characters have significant restrictions; no one will be playing a Jedi. But remember, the Force will be with you... always.

schedule.title: Still Waters
schedule.description: The Temerian Capital of Vizima has fallen under a tidal wave of black and gold. You were there, you saw everything. The Nilfgaardian war machine hit the walls of the capital and suddenly everything was blood and steel. You managed to drag yourself out of that hell and head north. With Nilfgarrdian scouting patrols hounding you, the few survivors, you've stopped recognizing the deep forest and rural towns you're passing though. Only when you hit the swamp did your group realize you were near the Pontar River. Now all that's left is to cross and look for shelter in Redania.

schedule.title: The Liebwitz Folly
schedule.description: Elector-Countess Emmanuelle von Liebwitz is throwing a ball for all the best and most interesting people in Nuln; an event that you have been invited to attend. It is certain to be a phenomenally dangerous affair politically - but to decline the invitation would be an even more certain social death.  What madness does the Elector-Countess have in store, and will you profit by it, or be swept away?

schedule.title: Badlands Patrol, Part Three
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The USS Magellan, a Nova-class science vessel, continues its patrol along the Badlands in the Alpha Quandrant. Officially assigned here to study the peculiar anomalies of the sector, the officers of the Magellan are well aware of the delicate nature of patrolling so close to Cardassian space, especially as tensions with them and the Maquis rise. Playing in all rounds is not a requirement, but the storyline will be connected in each round.

schedule.title: DIE
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! You were just a normal group of teens. You were in the drama club, or the punk band, or just the people who sat at the reject table in high school. You got together, you played a fantasy RPG. Some of you thought it was the best thing ever, some of you thought it was dumb, and some of you both. And you stopped. You grew up. Some of you had families, some of you didn't. And now, you're all back together. Older. Imaginations run down. Back to play one last session. This time though, there's something uneasy about the glimmer in your GM's eyes. This time, it's just not an escape. DIE is a game about a bunch of people transported from their mundane lives to a fantasy world, and about them trying to find their way home - or not.

schedule.title: The Garden
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! In the beginning, before the fall, there we’re Gardens in every town. Their doors always open, their breadsticks always warm. That is the tradition we have kept alive. In the middle of nothing, we must protect it. Unlimited salad and breadsticks for the brave travellers who walk through our doors. When you’re here, we’re the only family you got.

schedule.title: Screams of the Children
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! A tabletop roleplaying game of cosmic horror, in the style of H.P. Lovecraft. It's about the things we fear, amplified until they are unbearable. It's about stories that genuinely creep you out, not well-worn tropes and creatures you've seen hundreds of times before. And it's about bleak horror, in which humans are powerless when confronted by hyper-intelligent alien horrors. You can't beat them. You can't fight them. You can only watch, run, hide and fear. Content warnings: Characters will have little power in society. So there will definitely be themes related to class and power; Pregnancy, childbirth, and monstrous offspring.

schedule.title: Stranger Things: You Turn My World Upside-Down
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! You just wanted a tankard of ale, but things quickly spun out of hand. It seems the local villagers need your help. As your party hunts the most-feared beast, the trail takes an unexpected turn. Maybe these two-wheeled, metal "pedal-carts" you found by the road could come in handy. Grab your sword and potions for a Netflix-inspired story adventure with an 80's fantasy vibe. (Knowledge of the series is helpful, but not required.)

schedule.title: Murder in a Small Town
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! It's a small town and somebody has been murdered. Everyone is a suspect. Including everyone at this table. *Especially* everyone at this table. In this game, everyone plays a character connected to a murder victim. They will all be incredibly suspicious, like they could each be the murderer. The style of storytelling is flexible, so this game is welcoming for both beginners and experienced role players. Content Warning: Violence. Murder.

schedule.title: The Search for Nessie
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The Loch Ness Monster has captured the world's attention, one blurry photo at a time. But that's not enough for this intrepid crew! You're ready to take the search for Nessie into her natural habitat. Delve into the unknown depths of the mysterious loch, where more than just monsters may be found...

schedule.title: Paradox Lost
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! For hunters of the unnatural, museums are a relatively common place for mysterious curses, but this time you feel completely out of your depths. What was supposed to be a simple reconaissance mission immediately spirals out of control, with our heroes facing otherworldly creatures that not only break the laws of nature, but also those of space, time, and causality as well.

schedule.title: Under Construction
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Everybody knows construction sites make the best playgrounds. They're places where kids can bond on their own terms, and learn how to solve their own disputes without adult interference...who are we fooling? They're insanely dangerous places where you can balance a risk of severe bodily harm against not being a chicken. Speaking of chicken...

schedule.title: Out of the Frying Pan
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Become a Super Hero and take on the nefarious villain BreakFast in the ever darkened streets of The Atomnyy Zavod. This game is playable with younger children but a load of fun for adults. Sign up for some pun-filled, lighthearted adventure.

schedule.title: Disco Ambulance
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Get ready for slam-bang action and high octane excitement with Spirit of 77 - the 1970's pop culture RPG that turns up the volume and never slows down! Kung-fu tough guys, good old boy truckers, starry-eyed rockers and hardboiled sleuths, all jam-packed into one funky, easy to learn game system that's Powered by the Apocalypse. Hit the siren and the rotating disco ball as you make your way through the crowded city streets as members of the B&D Ambulance Company. Put on your scrubs and dancing shoes, it's all about stayin' alive

schedule.title: Second Wave
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! When the space invaders attack our cities you are our defense. The Preservation Force's elite Saint pilots. Tears of a Machine is a game of giant robot action and teenage drama. Take control of a monstrous war machine and save humanity, when you aren't trying to get out of doing your math homework. The second edition features new rules for quick, yet strategic pla

schedule.title: Humanity's Exodus
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! A sci-fi role playing game where you play fighter pilots aboard Forward Base Osiris: the last human colony in the universe. The Earth has been ravaged by the all-consuming Hivemind, forcing humanity to flee into uncharted space in search of a new home. In play, you lead the fleet on a galaxy-spanning quest to escape the Hivemind before it’s too late. This game uses the Powered by the Apocalypse engine and draws inspiration from Battlestar Galactica and The Expanse.

schedule.title: Lost Hall of the Dwarves
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The dwarves of the Lonely Mountain embarked on a quest and recovered their ancestral hall from the grips of a dragon. Why can't other dwarves do the same? Well, now the first expedition sent to recover an ancient dwarf hall in the Grey Mountains has disappeared. Time to gather a new group of adventurers and find out what happened.

schedule.title: The Cosmic Tyrant Next Door
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! It's been ten years since Xarlaa, Queen Priestess of the Antarean Star Empire, saved the universe by betraying The Gnawer of Reality to the heroes of Earth. Since then, she's been living simply as "Ms. X" in a quiet neighborhood of Omnidelphia. What effect has her alien technology had on her neighbors? What will those neighbors do when Ms. X's old enemies show up looking for revenge?

schedule.title: Party of One: Live!
schedule.description: Party of One is an actual play RPG podcast where the table is always set for two. Every week GM Jeff Stormer sits down with exactly one player to play a table top role playing game. Party of One: Live! is basically the same thing, but with an audience.

schedule.title: Goons Get Physical
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! 1982, Baltimore, as aerobic gym franchises take the city by storm, a rash of ridiculous robberies riddles the Action Team into a new riveting round of risk-taking. Will the Action Team emerge from the enigma unscathed or will the our heroes get swept up in the craze? A Bronze Age Champions adventure set in an alternate Champions Universe continuity.

schedule.title: The Adventure Club Chronicles: The Devil
schedule.description: A spell of forgetfulness has affected anyone 19 and older in town. Everyone affected is acting as if they are back in middle/high school. The Adventure Club springs into action.

schedule.title: Excellent Adventure
schedule.description: It's 1988 and the weather in San Rufus California is GREAT! The birds are chirping, summer is around the corner and your band is finally gonna get serious about learning to play their instruments. The only problem is that if any of you fail your history final you'll never produce the music that changes the world. You are about to go on an Excellent Adventure. You and the members of your band will travel through time and space to meet the people you were supposed to be learning about for the past year. Just remember, the time in San Rufus is always ticking and you've got to be back in time to make your presentations. Don't forget to wind your watch!

schedule.title: Streets of New York: Crime Wave 1982
schedule.description: Mayor Ed Koch needs your help! The public is upset about crime rates in the city, and a shrinking tax base has resulted in an understaffed police force. The solution? Super-powered costumed vigilantes, as authorized by an act of Congress, patrolling the five boroughs! Can you dig the worm of crime out of the Big Apple?

schedule.title: The 14th Annual David Stern Memorial RPG: The Moria Adjustment
schedule.description: A DEXCON 22 EXCLUSIVE! An all-new adventure by Kanarek & Kanarek. Take your own desperately heroic journey through the world of Lord of the Rings, filled with orcs, swords, Black Riders, magic rings, and secret dungeons under mountains, and D&D thieves, paladins, wizards, clerics, rangers, and whatever you might imagine. Frodo would never pass through Moria without your help, though he will never know. A MULTIMEDIA mind-bending event. Bring your favorite character, any genre, any system, with/without stats, or from literature. A character that you know well will be more fun (lots of roleplay! lots of combat!), but not required. Characters MUST play well in a party and not eat each other; you get the idea. Classic AD&D 1 & 2 is used to synchronize all systems together. The DMs will do this for you, don’t worry about it.

schedule.title: For the Queen
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The queen is on an important journey, accompanied only by those that love her most. But will they love her when she needs them? A card-based story-building game

schedule.title: Princess World
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! A game of girls who rule. The capable heroines of the Princess Council struggle against enemies and expectations as they strive to find their place... or create one of their own. Working together, they will weave the tapestry of Princess World. Powered by the Apocalypse. This game is in development and feedback and help is greatly appreciated.

schedule.title: The Underground: A Sam & Fuzzy RPG
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Fans of Sam and Fuzzy may have noticed the dark tide beneath Pittsburgh. This is not the first time such things have been unleashed and the secret life of Robert Boyle! New players may just want to run around chasing subterranian robot ninja vs. shape shifting slug people in the tunnles under WW2 steel mills. Strangeness abounds can you solve the myteries or will you become part of the Underground conspiracy?

schedule.title: The Immortal City
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! House Fell brought you to the Immortal City, and you thought it would be a grand adventure: great temples, grand museums, vast markets, and halls of learning. Nothing in the city is what you expected, and some nights, you suspect you'll be lucky to escape it alive. Using Diogo Noguiera's game of occult adventure, we'll explore a fictional "fantasy du siecle" city of intrigue, romance, and horror.

schedule.title: Stories of Antiquity
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! In a world where the gods are cruel and powerful, a few heroes choose to stand against them. This GM-guided playtest of a new story game lets players take the role of a hero in the Classic Greek mold, seeking glory and to be remembered in myth. The Great Deeds have already been done, the Perils faced, the Journeys part of legend; here, you play through the story as it has been told through the ages and look to stand higher than all others even as the gods would smite you for your hubris

schedule.title: Doom Hides Behind A Smile
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Virtue vs. Villainy! Obligation vs. Passion! Justice vs. Tyranny! The heroes of Wulin battle for a better world while struggling with their own intertwined duties, desires, and destinies. You are heroes trying to serve your family, faction, or ideals. High-flying action, romantic confusions, and secret schemes abound. This game aims to emulate the high drama feel of stories like Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon; Laughing in the Wind; and more. Tales of misunderstandings, betrayals, and farce mix with martial arts action. Hearts of Wulin borrows elements from Apocalypse World, Masks, Monsterhearts, The Veil, and beyond.

schedule.title: With Great Hope, Comes Great Responsibility
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Set 10 years after the events of "My Name is Ruin" (from DREAMATION 2019), things have not gone well for the citizens of Earth. The world is still recovering from the betrayal of Praetorian, the disbanding of the Tribune program and the Otherworldly horrors that descended on the earth during the Battle of Halcyon City. But a new generation of heroes have risen and hope springs eternal. But will hope be enough? This is a two round, single-table event with elements of superhero and horror themes and id for adults only. PLAYERS MUST PLAY IN BOTH ROUNDS.

schedule.title: The Pale Agenda
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Corporate espionage meets the occult in sunny Barcelona. A U.N. task force combatting human trafficking has the drop on a smuggler meeting significant new suppliers in Spain. The agents must decide between a raid or reconnaissance - the bird in hand versus the two in the bush.

schedule.title: A Fistful of Shins
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Shins make the Ninth World go around: A shin is a bit of the old worlds, shiny and hard. The Energons of Picalah will pay you some for work digging in the Lambent Fields. A shin will buy you a meal, or a tool, or a body for a night. First you get the shins, then you get the numenera, then you get yourself in a heap of trouble, because a billion years in the Earth's future, so much has changed, and so much stays the same.

schedule.title: Out of the Frying Pan
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Become a Super Hero and take on the nefarious villain BreakFast in the ever darkened streets of The Atomnyy Zavod. This game is playable with younger children but a load of fun for adults. Sign up for some pun-filled, lighthearted adventure.

schedule.title: Second Wave
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! When the space invaders attack our cities you are our defense. The Preservation Force's elite Saint pilots. Tears of a Machine is a game of giant robot action and teenage drama. Take control of a monstrous war machine and save humanity, when you aren't trying to get out of doing your math homework. The second edition features new rules for quick, yet strategic pla

schedule.title: Adventures in Middle Earth: The Lord's Apprentice
schedule.description: Continuing the initial trials and successes in your young realm, your growth is noticed. Fame and Reputation; Infamy and Retribution, new challenges are presented. Second of a convention-long story arc; includes character growth. This is an Arcane Circle role playing event, based on an original RP variant based on the old Dungeon & Dragons RPS. The game setting is in Tolkien's Middle Earth during the mid-Third Age around 1700. This system is for mature players, emphasizing interactive role playing using real-time combat, and occurs in a current Middle Earth campaign. No previous experience with the system necessary.

schedule.title: Spoiled Milk
schedule.description: The strange events related in this dark tale from legend-haunted Arkham center upon the public health crisis that has swept to the attention of many locals. Some foul taint seems to have settled upon the milk supplies which are delivered daily to thousands of Arkhamites. People have reported vomiting, bleeding... and other, far, stranger symptoms. The authorities have been aiming to keep a lid on it, but a plucky reporter from the Arkham Advertiser has received an 'inside tip' that promises to blow the whole scandal wide open. Authorities are keen to stop the reporter from publishing any follow-ups to his initial story, but it's not as easy as that ... for, the reporter has himself mysteriously gone missing. What shadowy forces are behind the fouling of Arkham's milk supply? Are the local dairies - each scrabbling to establish their "healthful" image - somehow to blame? Or is there something more sinister behind the weird mutations which sufferers of poisoning are starting to display? Investigators are provided. Players may bring their favorite 1920s CoC character to play as well if they so choose.

schedule.title: The Atlantic Charter Affair
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! In the summer of 1941, President Roosevelt and Prime Minister Churchill met secretly in Canada to plan how they would work together to defeat the Axis. America's greatest super-team, the Defenders Of Justice, have been asked to provide security in case the secret has gotten out!

schedule.title: Downtime
schedule.description: A DEXCON 22 EXCLUSIVE! The 20th Anniversary Aetherco CONTINUUM Championship. The Fraternities of the Continuum may have their differences, but all perform their tasks to ensure that spacetime unfolds as it must. But then some veteran Foxhorn enforcers are stymied from a long-anticipated round of bloodsoaked R&R. Who is just kicking back and watching your eternal alliance tear itself apart? Called "unusual" by the Sci-Fi Channel, and "unique and painfully satisfying" and "very cool" by player-reviewers on Amazon.com, CONTINUUM has broken new ground by logically solving every time travel conundrum, and actually made a civilization of time travelers outrageously playable.

schedule.title: Ultima Forsan: The Body and Soul
schedule.description: At the end of the Middle Ages, the Plague of the Dead has spread through Europe, Africa and Asia giving rise to the darkest time in history. Now, in the year 1515, heroes from the New Kingdoms are ready to fight to reconquer the World. Ultima Forsan is a game of wild adventures and deadly dangers, set in a macabre alternate version of our Renaissance. It uses the Savage Worlds system.

schedule.title: The Brave Listener
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! An understanding heart warms all that are graced with its presence. Lucky numbers: 14-06-42-08-30-27. What does it mean to be chosen by fate? Only you know the battle that lies within. Fight for the story you want to tell! Devise dastardly and improbable obstacles for your foes. Satisfy your hunger for adventure! The rules are very simple. Bring cash and show up early if you want to order Chinese (optional). Extra fortune cookies will be provided.

schedule.title: Jorune: The Trouble with Thriddle
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Ossat, the town handyman, is off on one of his occasional prospecting tours. So why is a thriddle knocking at your door on a cold, rainy evening, looking for him? Something smells funny, and it's not just the wet thombos outside. The Trouble with Thriddle is an adventure set on the fantastic world of Jorune, using a much lighter rule set.

schedule.title: Living Labyrinth of Lemuria
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! February 10, 2116 - It's been ten months since the first ancient artifacts were brought back from the world of Lemuria, and the artifact hunts have well and truly begun. The hot and hostile planet is worth enduring and exploring now, thanks to the massively valuable, wildly advanced artifacts from an ancient, extinct alien race to be found. Pregen characters provided. For more information and quickstart rules see www.afterver.se

schedule.title: The Most Nakedest Game
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Once again the ship's cook has roped the crew into competing in a reality tridee. This time it's Galactic Survivor, the hit show where contestants must endure a series of hostile alien environments armed with their wits alone. Will you win the prize? Or will your bleached hard body parts join those of other non-winners?

schedule.title: Rogues of Ravnica
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! In the labyrinthine catacombs of the city-plane of Ravnica lie vast troves of treasure and knowledge—but the powerful Guilds of the plane don't trust each other enough to collaborate on an excavation. The solution? You: a disposable, deniable group of misfits, cobbled together from the various Guilds, and dispatched to investigate a dangerous but potentially lucrative hoard. What will you discover? And will your inter-Guild party end up killing each other along the way? This game will use the Dungeon World system, be set in Magic: The Gathering's Ravnica, and incorporate material from the D&D supplement The Guildmaster's Guide to Ravnica. Players will choose Guild affiliations and have access to custom moves based on those Guilds.

schedule.title: Three is a Magic Number
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! A demon and two mortals walk into a bar, or was it two angels and a redhead? Maybe it was two fairies and a little girl, or two seniors and a vampire... The point is there were three of them; only one of them wasn't what they seemed, being less or more than the others by way of immortality. And these three claimed they were in LOVE of all things!!! Well that was enough to summon the gods of Love, Death and Justice. So let the trial begin, let the lovers be loved on penalty of death for false love. This is a game where the three lovers are players and the rest are co-GMs.

schedule.title: Blood and Snow, Part Three
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! As the ice recedes from the most recent Ice Age, your tribe struggles to survive in a world filled with danger but also wonder. Will you be the Chief or maybe the shaman or the village healer? Will you go on the mammoth hunt, or step into the cave of the short faced bear? Come tell a neolithic tale of wonder, mysticism, and natural beauty from a period of time with no written record. This will be played as a generational game, advancing time as decided by the players. New players are welcome in any slot. Playing in all rounds is not a requirement, but the storyline will be connected in each round.

schedule.title: That Lobster Stole My Tuna Sandwich!
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Giant lobsters have swarmed throughout the city, stealing seafood snacks, triggering traffic tie-ups, and being a general nuisance. People will pay good money for the InSpectres to corrall these crafty crustaceans. Who you gonna call?

schedule.title: Short Stories About Princesses
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! A game of girls who rule. The capable heroines of the Princess Council struggle against enemies and expectations as they strive to find their place... or create one of their own. Working together, they will weave the tapestry of Princess World. Powered by the Apocalypse. This game is in development and feedback and help is greatly appreciated.

schedule.title: Paris is Burning
schedule.system: Red Carnations on a Black Grave
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! For just over two months in 1871, the Paris Commune tried to make an egalitarian, socialist state a reality despite disagreement within their walls and attacks from outside it. This is the story of 12 Communards, their messy personal lives and their attempts to create a utopia in the face of impending death. How far would you go for what you believe in? Would you stand firm even if it meant your death? A freeform game very much in the spirit of Montsegur: 1244 and Witch: the Road to Lindisfarne.

schedule.title: The World is Dark
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! A tragic horror game about hope in the darkness. About connection in the face of certain death. About the things that lurk in the black and come for you with teeth and claws. About fear. About love. About despair.

schedule.title: End of the Line
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The Queen has no heirs. Nor does it look likely she will bear any. Adoption is likely the best route forward, but she has not identified a suitable candidate. Can you convince her it should be you? Or perhaps a malleable protege, one easy for you to control? The only problem is that every courtier in the empire is maneuvering to do the same. PLAYERS MUST PLAY IN ALL THREE SESSIONS.

schedule.title: The Unstoppable Thrust
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! With their Fencing Master's claim of creating an "unstoppable thrust", a group of fencing students find themselves much in demand by newfound friends and enemies. The students must decide between sharing what they know for their own gain or remaining loyal to their instructor by keeping the maestro's technique secret.

schedule.title: Humanity's Exodus
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! A sci-fi role playing game where you play fighter pilots aboard Forward Base Osiris: the last human colony in the universe. The Earth has been ravaged by the all-consuming Hivemind, forcing humanity to flee into uncharted space in search of a new home. In play, you lead the fleet on a galaxy-spanning quest to escape the Hivemind before it’s too late. This game uses the Powered by the Apocalypse engine and draws inspiration from Battlestar Galactica and The Expanse.

schedule.title: Adventures in Middle Earth: But Nobody Wants to Die
schedule.description: The fellowship finishes it's preparations and embarks on a legendary journey that seeks to ensure their place amongst heroes of old. The treacherous voyage ahead will test long friendships and loyalties, but fortune favors the bold. This is an Arcane Circle role playing event, based on an original RP variant based on the old Dungeon & Dragons RPS. The game setting is in Tolkien's Middle Earth during the mid-Third Age around 1700. This system is for mature players, emphasizing interactive role playing using real-time combat, and occurs in a current Middle Earth campaign. No previous experience with the system necessary.

schedule.title: Blood Orgy on Vampire Island
schedule.description: While the investigators are enjoying a party cruise, one squall leads the yacht to a floundering fisherman's boat and his statements of doom. Warned away from the "cursed" Wolfstone Island, the decadent host can't resist heading to the shores and carrying on the party there. Uses the Pulp Cthulhu rules, which will be taught at the table if needed. Pregenerated adventurers provided.

schedule.title: The Candy Isle
schedule.description: You and your party have found your selves stuck on a mysterious island. A fabled land of candy! Where everything from plants to animals is made of delicious candy. Beware not everything is so sweet. Brave gummi snakes and hostile candy folk. A 5E Dungeons and Dragons game. For Player characters of levels 1 to 2. Players may bring their own characters, subject to DM approval.

schedule.title: Dragon Age: Mala Suledin Nadas
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Change comes, even to the long benighted alienage of Denerim, where your people have lived and died under the yoke of the humans who so long ago shattered the elven empire that even the Hahren know only broken fragments, preserved orally in rhymes and songs. What will you make of the times to come? Will you seek to better the lot of your people in the city? Attempt to escape and rejoin your long lost Dalish kin? Perhaps some other road is there. However you go, whatever decisions you make, now you must endure them. Warning: The elves of the world of Thedas are - especially the 'domesticated' city elves - a heavily oppressed and restricted people, with little freedom and almost no room to better themselves. This is an integral part of the theme of the event.

schedule.title: The Extraordinary Adventures of Baron Munchausen
schedule.description: Once more into the breach dear friends! The Baron invites the finest of gentlefolk to a soiree of good spirits and cheer! Thrill to tales of his latest exploits and he will thrill to tales of yours! Let the speaking of absolute truth begin (unless you are a damnable liar, rapscallion or charlatan, in which case you will be called so and exposed for your unseemly behavior! There are always gatecrashers at the Baron's parties). You are welcome to be a spectator in the audience, watching the actual players entertain you with freeform nonsense.

schedule.title: Four Sherlock Holmes and a Vampire
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The title pretty much says it all. The game concept was proposed by the McElroy Brothers on the MBMBAM podcast (creators of the Adventure Zone), and created by fan Andrew Young. It's a very silly game where all the players are different versions of Sherlock Holmes (from various TV shows and movies), there's a murder to be solved, and one of them is secretly a vampire.

schedule.title: Seance
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The Widower begs you to attend the seánce of their most recently passed. The medium must surely be a hack, but whatever brings comfort to those who mourn so be it. But surely the happenings around the house are only in your head. Or are they...?

schedule.title: Badlands Patrol, Part Four
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The USS Magellan, a Nova-class science vessel, continues its patrol along the Badlands in the Alpha Quandrant. Officially assigned here to study the peculiar anomalies of the sector, the officers of the Magellan are well aware of the delicate nature of patrolling so close to Cardassian space, especially as tensions with them and the Maquis rise. Playing in all rounds is not a requirement, but the storyline will be connected in each round.

schedule.title: Or How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love Climate Change
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Winter has come, and it has come hard. The whole world is now blanketed in a layer of ice and snow. Humanity is dying. We’ve assembled a team of the worlds greatest scientists, doctors, soldiers, and engineers to save the world, or at least the ones we have left. And even though it’s a long shot, it may be our last best hope.

schedule.title: Out of the Frying Pan
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Become a Super Hero and take on the nefarious villain BreakFast in the ever darkened streets of The Atomnyy Zavod. This game is playable with younger children but a load of fun for adults. Sign up for some pun-filled, lighthearted adventure.

schedule.title: Vaporwear
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The world has ended but the rent is still due. Players take on the roll of "Takers", retrieval specialists who venture into the zombie infested heart of fallen America. IN the game of Economic Horror, you aren't out looking for adventure. You are looking to get paid, feed your family, and make it to retirement. Best of luck.

schedule.title: Murder of Champions
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! The winner of a local chili cook-off, dead. A college shot put champion, slain. When you find a blood-stained trophy that reads "East Coast Crossword Tournament: First Place" you know that another serial killer is on the hunt. Can you and the rest of the Serial Homicide Unit bring them to justice before they kill again?

schedule.title: Disco Ambulance
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Get ready for slam-bang action and high octane excitement with Spirit of 77 - the 1970's pop culture RPG that turns up the volume and never slows down! Kung-fu tough guys, good old boy truckers, starry-eyed rockers and hardboiled sleuths, all jam-packed into one funky, easy to learn game system that's Powered by the Apocalypse. Hit the siren and the rotating disco ball as you make your way through the crowded city streets as members of the B&D Ambulance Company. Put on your scrubs and dancing shoes, it's all about stayin' alive

schedule.title: Second Wave
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! When the space invaders attack our cities you are our defense. The Preservation Force's elite Saint pilots. Tears of a Machine is a game of giant robot action and teenage drama. Take control of a monstrous war machine and save humanity, when you aren't trying to get out of doing your math homework. The second edition features new rules for quick, yet strategic pla

schedule.title: Humanity's Exodus
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! A sci-fi role playing game where you play fighter pilots aboard Forward Base Osiris: the last human colony in the universe. The Earth has been ravaged by the all-consuming Hivemind, forcing humanity to flee into uncharted space in search of a new home. In play, you lead the fleet on a galaxy-spanning quest to escape the Hivemind before it’s too late. This game uses the Powered by the Apocalypse engine and draws inspiration from Battlestar Galactica and The Expanse.

schedule.title: World of Warriors: Champion of the Multiverse!, Part Three
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! Ms. Marvelous, the Top Notch Champ has gone missing, and the World of Warriors needs to crown a new champion of the Multiverse! Do you have what it takes to battle past the greatest warriors throughout space and time to become the champion of the Multiverse? World Wide Wrestling is a pro wrestling RPG based on the Apocalypse World engine, with strong narrative element. This game is inspired by the world of comic books and wrestling organizations like Chikara, and Lucha Underground. So while everyone's on screen character is a hero, they are still just normal people putting on a show. So like most wrestling, this federation is entirely about playing heroes and villains, whether from a favorite comic of yours, or one you made up in your head! Players are encouraged to sign up for all three event slots, but may sign up for any or all. Players who pre-register for all three slots will be given first priority in choosing characters.

schedule.title: Adventures in Middle Earth: It's a Risky Business
schedule.description: By now you have accomplished much and hopefully accumulated more, carving your own niche within a realm your neighbors have begun to notice and envy. Are you prepared for their responses, and the cleanup before your Lord's return? Will there even be anything left afterward? Finale of a convention-long story arc. This is an Arcane Circle role playing event, based on an original RP variant based on the old Dungeon & Dragons RPS. The game setting is in Tolkien's Middle Earth during the mid-Third Age around 1700. This system is for mature players, emphasizing interactive role playing using real-time combat, and occurs in a current Middle Earth campaign. No previous experience with the system necessary.

schedule.title: Crimson Carnivale
schedule.description: Abandoned by deserting carnies and performers, the few remaining members of the Great Romano Brother's Circus stand at graveside. The death of the lion tamer is but one of the many blows of fate laid on the shoulders of the investigators. But is it all bad luck and misfortune? Or is something to blame? Pre-gen adventurers provided.

schedule.title: Our Fellow Vampire Americans
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! 1987, Baltimore, when the heroine Flamebat is outed as a vampire, the trial of the millennium is on! Will the technically dead Flamebat become the first legally undead American citizen or will the Action Team fall to the...erm, other dark forces trying to stop it? A Bronze Age Champions adventure set in an alternate Champions Universe continuity.

schedule.title: The Horde
schedule.description: It was supposed to be so easy. In and out, no one gets hurt. Then the trap went off and all hell broke loose. The Horde is chasing you and you have no way out. "Quick into the arena at least we will have room to move as we fight." Let's hope for your sake, that the dead, stay dead. A fifth edition dungeons and dragons game for players of level ten.

schedule.title: The Adventure Club Chronicles: The Magician
schedule.description: A stranger has entered town and set up a small bakery in town. Rumor has it that they are willing to listen to your problems and will fulfill your greatest desire. The Adventure Club needs to investigate these rumors and find out the truth behind them.

schedule.title: Crimson Carnivale
schedule.description: Abandoned by deserting carnies and performers, the few remaining members of the Great Romano Brother's Circus stand at graveside. The death of the lion tamer is but one of the many blows of fate laid on the shoulders of the investigators. But is it all bad luck and misfortune? Or is something to blame? Pre-gen adventurers provided.

schedule.title: The Vegetable Chop
schedule.description: Got to the convention early? Waiting for Opening Ceremonies? Come on up to the Staff Suite and help the staff chop vegetables for the convention! We got carrots! We got celery! We got bunnies! No wait, we don't got bunnies. Never mind. Yes, we're serious (can't you tell?). Prizes will be awarded for volume and finesse and bunnies (no, wait...).

schedule.title: The ARENA Bring & Battle
schedule.description: Bring big things. No, we mean it - just about anything that could be a wargaming model. The Rage in ARENA combat and the best convention starter you could imagine. One year combatants were a snail riding lawn gnome, twin linked possums, a model monster with light-up laser eyes, and a sneaker! The rules system is so simple we get to playing the game right away! Bring something interesting (not TOO interesting) and we will make the rules for it and put it in the field of play! Sense of humor is one of the only requirements to this game, because it makes the word silly look serious. We will be using the BIGYNYD! System for "combat resolution".

schedule.title: 7 Wonders
schedule.description: Lead one of the seven great cities of the Ancient world. Exploit the natural resources of your lands, take part in the eternal march of progress, develop your commercial relationships and assert your military might. Leave your mark in the history of civilization by building an architectural marvel that will transcend the ages to come. Various expansions may be used at the discretion of the players.

schedule.title: Alien Artifacts
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A 4X-style card game in which you play as an interplanetary faction, sending your research vessels into uncharted space to expand your knowledge and power. Build powerful ships, develop new technologies, and explore distant planets for anything - or anyone - you can exploit. With over two hundred cards, Alien Artifacts offers players many scoring strategies and great replay-ability.

schedule.title: Cahoots
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Welcome to the world of Cahoots, a trick-taking card game in which you are forced to conspire (be "in-cahoots") with each of your opponents to win. Cooperate, negotiate, backstab, and bluff your way to a win in this world of noir and espionage. You can't trust anyone, but you've got to work together to score points because even though you win by yourself, you can't win alone!

schedule.title: Captain Marvel: Secret Skrulls
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A hidden identity game in which players take on the roles of their favorite characters, including Captain Marvel herself, to defend Earth in an intergalactic war against shape-shifting Skrulls in disguise. Players must decide whom to trust, defend their alliance, and restore the planet's virtue. The gameplay in Captain Marvel: Secret Skrulls is based on the hidden identity game BANG!

schedule.title: Chimera Station
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Chimera Station brings a new twist to the worker placement genre: Customizable workers. Each worker can be modified in-game by splicing claws, tentacles, leafs or additional brains (or any combination of those) on them. These workers are used to gather resources: Points, food, credits, and living parts of aforementioned workers! During the game you'll build and expand the space station and open up tons of different strategic and tactical possibilities.

schedule.title: Dominion
schedule.description: In this popular Rio Grande game, each player starts with an identical, very small deck of cards. In the center of the table is a selection of other cards the players can "buy" as they can afford them. Through their selection of cards to buy, and how they play their hands as they draw them, the players construct their deck on the fly, striving for the most efficient path to the precious victory points by game end. Dominion is not a CCG, but the play of the game is similar to the construction and play of a CCG deck. We might be using the expansion sets, as players want.

schedule.title: Dominoes
schedule.description: The game, not the pizza. Played with 4 players to a table, this classic game is served up with official rules according to Hoyle's Rules of Games, Third Revised and Updated Edition. No house variations allowed.

schedule.title: Drop It
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Circles, triangles, squares and diamonds: Drop It is about letting go, with the pieces you drop landing somewhere in the vertical game board, ideally where they'll score the most points, but the tiles bounce around and don't always land where you expect them to!

schedule.title: Grackles
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Grackles are noisy, iridescent birds that love to gather on telephone wires at sunset throughout the southwestern United States. In this lightly-themed abstract strategy game, you line up your birds on the telephone wire to score as many points as possible. Each turn, players choose between drawing and placing a tile, connecting two spots on the telephone wire with their birds, extending a line of birds, or rotating an empty tile. After the board has been built to five tiles by five tiles and all available pairs of spots on the telephone wire have birds on them, the player with the most birds on the telephone wire wins.

schedule.title: Lancaster
schedule.description: In 1413, the new king of England, Henry V of Lancaster, has ambitious plans: The unification of England and the conquest of the French crown! Each player takes the role of an ambitious aristocratic family. Who will be the best supporter of this young king, and the most powerful Lord of his time? In Lancaster the players want to proceed from simply being a Lord to the most powerful ally of the king. They may achieve this by developing their own knighthood as well as by clever deployment of individual knights in the counties of England, at their own castle, and to conflicts with France. In parliament, they try to push laws from which they will benefit themselves most. The player with the most power points at the end of the game is the winner.

schedule.title: PitchCar
schedule.description: The drivers are ready, fingers twitching as the tension mounts, the starting signal lights and the race is ON! PitchCar is an Action/Dexterity game of strategy and skill for up to 8 players racing on a large wooden 3-D racetrack with the racers using finger flicks to propel their wood puck "cars" around the track. Choose the best trajectory, take advantage of safety rails, avoid (or intentionally jostle) other cars as you race around the track without running off it all together as you dash for the finish line. While it rewards both skill and strategy PitchCar offers a fun, rowdy, hilarious time for all regardless of the final rankings.

schedule.title: Scrabble
schedule.description: The classic word game. The Official Scrabble Dictionary will be used for guidance as official tournament rules are enforced.

schedule.title: Sorcerer: A Strategy Card Game
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Sorcerer: A Strategy Card Game is set in what the company describes as a grim, gaslamp lit world full of fantastic, mythical creatures and sorcery. Designed for two to four players, the game pits two ancient beings of great power against one another to determine which of their lineage are strongest. The players use sorcery to conjure minions, cast minions, and wield enchanted items to reach the game's goal of conquering three battlefields.

schedule.title: Sparkle*Kitty
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Nobody puts princess in a tower! Sparkle*Kitty is an adorably fun, social, and magical spell card game for all ages, sizes and genders. This hilarious party game from Breaking Games is absolutely addictive and was a surprise smash hit of 2017.

schedule.title: Terraforming Mars
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! In the 2400s, mankind begins to terraform the planet Mars. Giant corporations, sponsored by the World Government on Earth, initiate huge projects to raise the temperature, the oxygen level, and the ocean coverage until the environment is habitable. In Terraforming Mars, you play one of those corporations and work together in the terraforming process, but compete for getting victory points that are awarded not only for your contribution to the terraforming, but also for advancing human infrastructure throughout the solar system, and doing other commendable things.

schedule.title: Ultimate Werewolf
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Your quiet little 16th century village has suddenly become infested with some very unfriendly werewolves...can you and the other villagers find them before they devour everyone? Each player has an agenda: as a villager, hunt down the werewolves; as a werewolf, convince the other villagers that you're innocent, while secretly dining on those same villagers each night. Dozens of special roles are available to help both the villagers and the werewolves achieve their goals while thwarting their opponents.

schedule.title: Witless Wizards
schedule.description: A mysterious has gathered the most powerful wizards in the world to battle and decide who is the strongest! However, the chosen wizards are getting on in years, even forgetting what most of their spells actually do! Pulling weapons and armor from across time and space, these Witless Wizards begin the final battle.

schedule.title: The Captain is Dead
schedule.description: Imagine that you are one of the crew in your favorite science fiction TV show. Now imagine that in the last 10 minutes of the show things have gone so badly that the captain is dead and you and the surviving members of your crew have to pull together and save the day yourselves! The Captain Is Dead is a co-op game.

schedule.title: The Red Dragon Inn
schedule.description: The adventure is over, but the party is just beginning! Choose from 20 different zany characters as you drink, brawl, and gamble, and try to be the last one standing. Will you be Fiona the Volatile? Or Pooky, the rabbit familiar who is seriously crazy...seriously. What about Wizgille, the Gnome Artificer? Or Gog...just Gog. This will be run using the Sea Event Deck from RDI4, but not the "Gambling? I'm in!" expansion. Beginners more than welcome, all rules will be taught before the game starts.

schedule.title: Bring & Battle
schedule.description: Bring 1850 points and play against friends or challenge the host. Super heavies and VDR vehicles welcome. Emphasis is on fun!

schedule.title: Space Hulk
schedule.description: Double Exposure continues a tradition with Space Hulk battles throughout the convention! Play with your favorite squad (special rules regarding various races will be available onsite) or use our pre-made squads and GET THOSE BUGS! All rules will be taught to beginners in this very easy-to-learn game of futuristic spaceship exploration.

schedule.title: Backgammon
schedule.description: The classic board game. All standard rules apply.

schedule.title: Bosk
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A brand new release from Floodgate Games! From majestic Maples to ancestral Oaks, players nurture their trees aiming to thrive over the course of a year in a beautiful National Park. In the spring, players carefully grow their trees, scoring as hikers enjoy traveling the trails in summer. When autumn comes, leaves fall in the ever-changing direction of the wind, guided to cover the terrain and other players’ leaves. Points are awarded in winter for the most coverage of each region in the park. Gain your ground in the park to be victorious in Bosk!

schedule.title: Hanabi
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A cooperative game from R&R Games in which players try to create the perfect fireworks show by placing the cards on the table in the right order. The card deck consists of five different colors of cards, numbered 1–5 in each color. For each color, the players try to place a row in the correct order from 1–5. Sounds easy, right? Well, not quite, as in this game you hold your cards so that they're visible only to other players. To assist other players in playing a card, you must give them hints regarding the numbers or the colors of their cards. Players must act as a team to avoid errors and to finish the fireworks display before they run out of cards.

schedule.title: Letter Tycoon
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! In the game, players take turns forming a word using a seven-card hand and a three-card community card pool, scoring money and stock rewards based on their word. Players may use their earned money to buy one letter "patent" in the word they make. In the future, whenever another player uses one of your owned letters on their turn, you earn money from the bank. Letters that are used less frequently have special abilities, increasing their power. When enough of the alphabet has been claimed, players finish the current turn, then score all money, stock and letter patents owned. Create the most valuable empire and you can become the letter tycoon!

schedule.title: Mysterium
schedule.description: In Mysterium, a reworking of the game system present in Tajemnicze Domostwo, one player takes the role of ghost while everyone else represents a medium. To solve the crime, the ghost must first recall (with the aid of the mediums) all of the suspects present on the night of the murder. A number of suspect, location and murder weapon cards are placed on the table, and the ghost randomly assigns one of each of these in secret to a medium.

schedule.title: Palaces
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A deck-building bidding game in which you win cards and build towers. On a turn, the active player chooses to draw from one of three stacks of cards, then all players bid or drop out. There is only one round of bidding per card. Bids are valued based on the size of a suit (e.g., three-of-a-kind beats two-of-a-kind, etc.), and if the size matches, you compare suits: Gold, Silver, Crystal, Marble. If size and suit match, compare a secondary bid (3 gold and 2 marble beats 3 gold and a silver).

schedule.title: PitchCar
schedule.description: The drivers are ready, fingers twitching as the tension mounts, the starting signal lights and the race is ON! PitchCar is an Action/Dexterity game of strategy and skill for up to 8 players racing on a large wooden 3-D racetrack with the racers using finger flicks to propel their wood puck "cars" around the track.
