schedule.description: On August 20, 3028, Prince Hanse Davion stood before the leaders of the Great Houses and the other powerful people gathered on Terra for his wedding and toasted his bride with the fateful words, "I give you the Capellan Confederation."

schedule.title: Mech Race Returns
schedule.description: Long a staple of the various Racing Circuits, Battle Mech Racing was discontinued as the organizers and many racers were called up for Service with their various Successor States and the new SLDF. Now, the fabled light mech Race returns to the area! Can you take your chosen ride and complete the course while dodging the guns of your opponents? Random start positions... ten check points... As in the past, it can be anyone's race to win - hell, even a PNT-9R did so in one of the bloodiest races ever run. Will it be yours? Players may bring any Inner Sphere battlemech of LIGHT class and record sheet for the Mech being used or use one provided. Please bring your own - GM Supplies are limited!

schedule.title: Napoleon Heads Towards Waterloo!
schedule.description: Napoleon is back in France and he once again raised an army! He marches into Belgium towards Waterloo from three different directions. Play this classic Columbia Games favorite. Two players play the Allies and the Prussions and one plays Napoleon. Fog of war using wooden blocks adds to the overall strategy. Unique battle resolution. Vive le France! Or not!

schedule.title: Before There Were Stars...
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Since ancient times, the twinkling of the heavens inspired people across the globe to create stories that answered the most important of questions: "Who are we… and how did it all begin?" This "feel-good" game lets you appreciate the boundless imagination in all of us and awards points for the best story moments - allowing everyone to shine regardless of their skill as a storyteller. Playing this game is a breath of fresh air that never repeats itself, except in the fun and warmth of emotion it brings to your table.

schedule.title: Boomtown Bandits
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! You're all bandits trying to rob this boomtown blind! Take down the bank, train, stagecoach, and even the brothel in this frantic and fun real-time dice shoot em' up!

schedule.title: Carcassonne
schedule.description: In this classic game from Rio Grande, the southern French city of Carcassonne is famous for its unique Roman and Medieval fortifications. The players develop the area around Carcassonne and deploy their followers on the roads, in the cities, in the cloisters, and in the fields. The skill of the players to develop the area will determine who is victorious! This event might use expansion sets as requested by the players.

schedule.title: Celestia
schedule.description: Board an aircraft with a team of adventurers to perform many trips through the cities of Celestia and recover their wonderful treasures. Your journey will not be safe, but you will attempt to be the richest adventurer by collecting the most precious treasures!

schedule.title: Commissioned
schedule.description: Commissioned is a fascinating cooperative-style board game with a simple deck-building mechanism. Players are the early Christian Apostles and must work together to mature their faith decks, grow the church, collect the books of the New Testament, and overcome persecution. You do not need to know anything about Christianity to play.

schedule.title: Dice Throne
schedule.description: In this fast-paced compat game, select from a variety of heroes that play and feel completely distinct from one another. Attack opponents and activate abilities by rolling your hero's unique set of five dice. Accumulate combat points and spend them on cards that have a large range of effects, such as granting permanent hero upgrades, applying status effects, and manipulating dice directly whether yours, your teammate's, or even your opponent's.

schedule.title: Dixit
schedule.description: One player is the storyteller for the turn and looks at the images on the 6 cards in her hand. From one of these, she makes up a sentence and says it out loud (without showing the card to the other players). Each other player selects the card in their hands which best matches the sentence and gives the selected card to the storyteller, without showing it to the others. The storyteller shuffles her card with all the received cards. All pictures are shown face up and every player has to bet upon which picture was the storyteller's. If nobody or everybody finds the correct card, the storyteller scores 0, and each of the other players scores 2. Otherwise the storyteller and whoever found the correct answer score 3. Players score 1 point for every vote for their own card. The game ends when the deck is empty or if a player scores 30 points. In either case, the player with the most points wins the game.

schedule.title: Garbage Day
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players take turns stacking garbage cards one at a time onto the overflowing garbage can, or stashing garbage cards in their rooms. But once a player's room gets too full, they must clean it by stacking all the cards from that room on top of the garbage can, very carefully, one by one. If garbage cards fall off the garbage can during your turn, place them in your overflow pile. If your overflow pile gets too big, you're eliminated from the game. If all other players have been eliminated, you win!

schedule.title: Gerrymandering
schedule.description: All things being equal this town could go to you or your political opponent. But all things aren't equal, and you're going to make sure the odds are in your favor. Change political boundaries, campaign throughout precincts and encourage demographic shifts to ensure that your party stays in power. A tile and board manipulation game for two players.

schedule.title: Guardian's Call
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! There is danger in the West... Ferocious orcs are raiding and pillaging, and behind them comes the mighty dragon, Golianth. You are a Guardian, one of the five rival heroes sworn to defend the realm. The King has decreed that you must work together to send weapons and shields, search for ancient artifacts and call on the power of magical spells, all while bringing villagers to safety within the Castle. There are many Guardians, but there can only be one Guardian of the Realm, the leader who will lead their combined strength to victory. Bring the greatest resources to the Council and save the most villagers and you will be named the Guardian of the Realm.

schedule.title: Hero Realms
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A fantasy-themed deck-building game that is an adaptation of the award-winning Star Realms game. You start each turn with a new hand of five cards from your personal deck. When your deck runs out of cards, you shuffle your discard pile into your new deck. An 80-card Market deck is shared by all players, with five cards being revealed from that deck to create the Market Row. As you play, you use gold to buy champion cards and action cards from the Market. These champions and actions can generate large amounts of gold, combat, or other powerful effects. You use combat to attack your opponent and their champions. When you reduce your opponent's score (called health) to zero, you win!

schedule.title: High Noon Saloon
schedule.description: You are a combatant in an all-out brawl fought in an Old West Saloon. Shoot it out from a distance or get in close and beat on your opponents directly. Move between different parts of the saloon to get the upper hand. Whatever you do, make sure to keep your guard up… if you're not careful, you'll get beaten to a bloody pulp, shot full of holes, or both! The last one standin' wins, and there ain't no prize for second.

schedule.title: Indulgence
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A trick-taking game for 3-4 players. On their turn, players choose an edict that gives the rule for the hand. The other players then decide if they want to violate the edict by doing the opposite of what it commands. So "Don't take any Medicis" suddenly becomes "I must take all the Medicis". Committing a sin can be challenging, but a player attempting it gets the benefit of the indulgence, a token that turns one of their cards into a winning hand. Can you trick your opponents into committing sins without the indulgence? Can you avoid sinning yourself? Whoever can pull that off will end up with a pile of gems and the title of victor.

schedule.title: Jungle Speed
schedule.description: Give the tribe a hand in this game from Asmodee Editions! A lightning fast card game for the entire family, where you test your fast reflexes and good judgment. Grab the totem at the right moment to get rid of your cards and win the game!

schedule.title: Leaders of Euphoria
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A social deduction game in the style of Good Cop Bad Cop, but set in the world of Euphoria. It takes place earlier in the timeline than Euphoria, when the city was young and foolish. Players will have 3 cards in front of them that determine whether they are on the Euphorian or Subterran team that will be investigated throughout the game to figure out who's on their team and who's not.

schedule.title: New World Magischola: House Rivalry
schedule.description: Experience going to magical college by enrolling in courses, studying, surviving magical mishaps and sabotage by fellow players. Be the first to pass all your courses and collect the most house points and you take the trophy! Features strategy, surprises, chance, and magic as you choose your major, follow extra-curricular activities, and earn (or lose) house points for your efforts. Every player has a character, a House, and a magical pet.

schedule.title: Pickle Letter
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Just dill with it! In the lightning-fast letter-matching game Pickle Letter, you pick a peck of Pickleletters for a jarring good time. Time is ticking in the race to match the most letters before your opponents find them first. Find matches first and pickle the other players. But here's the dill: Things can go sour fast! You'll be in a pickle if it doesn't all match up and your opponents prove you wrong! So keep calm and crunch on.

schedule.title: Sagrada
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Each player builds a stained glass window by building up a grid of dice on their player board. Each board has some restrictions on which color or shade (value) of die can be placed there. Dice of the same shade or color may never be placed next to each other. Dice are drafted in player order, with the start player rotating each round, snaking back around after the last player drafts two dice. Scoring is variable per game based on achieving various patterns and varieties of placement...as well as bonus points for dark shades of a particular hidden goal color.

schedule.title: Subtext
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players try to communicate with one another by drawing hints about the word on their card. Drawing well is not required - just being clever in selecting your hints. Each round, one person is the dealer. This player looks at their word, then shuffles the card into the cards for the other players and distributes them randomly. By doing this, one player will have the same word as the dealer, but nobody - not even the dealer - knows who it is.

schedule.title: Thanos Rising: Avengers Infinity War
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A cooperative dice and card game where players recruit heroes and assemble a team to face off against Thanos and his villainous forces in an effort to thwart him from accomplishing his master plan: Collecting all six Infinity Stones to power the Infinity Gauntlet and wreak havoc on the very fabric of reality. Building upon the strengths of the characters on their team, as well as other players, winning requires critical thinking and communication to reach a common goal.

schedule.title: The Monster You Know
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! a super fun silly game that turns the players into monsters! Every turn each player recieves a monstrous trait they have to act out and then all players answer a question about their monster and every player adds an additional monsterous trait to thier previous one and the players monsters become more complex and hillarious to act out!  Find out who is The Monster You Know!

schedule.title: Ultimate Werewolf
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Your quiet little 16th century village has suddenly become infested with some very unfriendly werewolves...can you and the other villagers find them before they devour everyone? Each player has an agenda: as a villager, hunt down the werewolves; as a werewolf, convince the other villagers that you're innocent, while secretly dining on those same villagers each night. Dozens of special roles are available to help both the villagers and the werewolves achieve their goals while thwarting their opponents.

schedule.title: The Advanced Miniatures Painting Workshop
schedule.description: Having trouble trying to bring your work to the next level? Tired of having miniatures fielded on a table in just primer? Well come and sit in or take part in our workshops! Paints, brushes, and miniature provided! If you like in our advanced workshop, bring current work or continue the same piece as we go into further detailing and special effects. This workshop assumes basic knowledge of painting and focuses on more advanced techniques. Specific advanced topics will be chosen by the majority of participants. Don't forget, you get to take home your free mini!

schedule.title: Random Tournament
schedule.description: A video game competition like nothing DEXCON has seen before. This event pits random contestants against each other with a random game to play each round until one gamer stands on top as the master of chance. Where most tournaments test your strength in one type of game, this tournament requires that you be a jack of all trades. Each round a die is rolled to determined what game will be played that round. A fighting game professional may get lucky and pick Soul Calibur, or might get stuck in a Rock Band guitar dual. One round could be the epic sport of Rocket League, or they might be... Dancing with the Stars? We got a light saber duel game for the Wii in here too! What in the world is "Calvin Tucker's Redneck Jamboree" and which two competitors might be forced to play it?

schedule.title: Arkham Horror
schedule.description: The town of Arkham, Massachusetts is in a panic. Horrific and bizarre events have begun to occur with increasing frequency - all seeming to point towards some cataclysmic event in the near future that may spell disaster for everyone. Only one small band of investigators can save Arkham from the Great Old Ones and destruction! Arkham Horror was originally published by Chaosium, Inc. two decades ago.

schedule.title: Dark Moon
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! This release from Stronghold, formerly known as BSG Express, is a game of deception and betrayal at the cold edge of space. You are a crew member on a deep space mining expedition to Titan, the dark moon of Saturn. During a routine excavation, an "incident" occurs whereby some of the crew become infected with an unknown virus, and become paranoid, deceitful, and violent, trying to destroy the others. Roll dice, overcome traumatic events, throw your friends in quarantine when you don’t believe them, and (if you’re Infected) betray everyone at just the right moment to secure victory!

schedule.title: Dead Last
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Originally known as Tontine - it's a "social collusion" game of shifting alliances, betrayals, and murder for profit in which players must conspire and vote upon whom to kill each round. Any means of overt or covert communication is allowed - a glance, a nod, pointing under the table, flashing a card, anything – but make sure you don't tip off the target or they could ambush you instead! In the end, one or two players will remain, either claiming all the gold or squaring off in a final showdown before starting the next round of play. The first player to score 24 points of gold wins.

schedule.title: Guillotine
schedule.description: The revolutionary card game where you win by getting a head. This irreverent and humorous card game takes place during the French Revolution. Players represent rival guillotine operators vying for the best collection of noble heads over three rounds. Each round, twelve nobles are lined up for the guillotine. The nobles are worth varying points, depending on their notoriety. During your turn, you play action cards to change the order of the line so you can collect the best nobles. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!

schedule.title: Jenga
schedule.description: Do you have a steady hand? Test your skill as you balance the wooden blocks and stack up the stories. Don't let the tower fall!

schedule.title: Poison
schedule.description: A trick taking card game. Set in a high class cocktail party, players each lay Drinks cards of differing suits trying to win tricks by playing the highest card in the current suit. Winning tricks wins you points as does completing your open and hidden agendas which are different for every player. Unlike other trick taking games the trump suit in Poison is a bad thing that negatively affects you if you play it. It is literally a poisoned chalice. The player with the highest score after 9 hands wins the game.

schedule.title: Second Chance
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Each player starts with a 9x9 grid that they want to fill as completely as possible. To begin the game, everyone receives a different card with a starting tile and marks off its spaces on their grid. Every turn, two puzzle tile cards are revealed, and each player chooses one of them, then marks off squares on their personal grid that match the shape of the image shown on their chosen card. Multiple players can choose the same card. If a player cannot fit either revealed shape into their grid, they get a second chance and reveal one card from the deck just for them. If they can fit this shape in their grid, they do continue normally next round; otherwise they are eliminated from play. The game ends when all players have been eliminated, the deck of puzzle cards has run out, or a player has completely filled their grid.

schedule.title: Sparkle*Kitty Nights
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! What happens in the tower stays in the tower! Sparkle*Kitty Nights is an perfectly clean card game for the dirtiest minds. Discover wild new spell powers in this innuendo-filled, standalone version of the original game. Sparkle*Kitty Nights adds hidden roles and cooperative play to the game. Time to get ready, it's about to get naughty! Designed to easily mix and match with the original Sparkle*Kitty game and expansion packs, Sparkle*Kitty Nights adds So. Many. Naughty. Word. Spell. Combinations!

schedule.title: Steve Jackson Dice Games
schedule.description: A mash-up of Dice Games from Steve Jackson Games, including Batman: The Animated Series Dice Game, Mars Attacks: The Dice Game and Chupacabra: Survive the Night.

schedule.title: The Binding of Isaac: Four Souls
schedule.description: The official Binding of Isaac multiplayer card game, about sacrifice, betrayal and hoarding. Players take turns playing loot cards and using items to kill monsters that yield more items, loot, and sometimes souls. The first player to end their turn with 4 souls is the winner. Cooperation, barter, and betrayal is encouraged.

schedule.title: Ultimate Werewolf
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Your quiet little 16th century village has suddenly become infested with some very unfriendly werewolves...can you and the other villagers find them before they devour everyone? Each player has an agenda: as a villager, hunt down the werewolves; as a werewolf, convince the other villagers that you're innocent, while secretly dining on those same villagers each night. Dozens of special roles are available to help both the villagers and the werewolves achieve their goals while thwarting their opponents.

schedule.title: Quiplash 2 (Jackbox)
schedule.description: Quiplash 2 is the gut-busting battle of wits and wittiness! Just use your phone or tablet to answer simple prompts. Your answer will be pitted against another player's answer in a head-to-head battle. Other players - and even an audience of up to 10,000 people - then vote on their favorite answer. It's that simple. Once a game is started, players simply connect to the "jackbox.tv" web address on their device and then enter the on-screen room code to enter a game.

schedule.title: Space Hulk
schedule.description: Double Exposure continues a tradition with Space Hulk battles throughout the convention! Play with your favorite squad (special rules regarding various races will be available onsite) or use our pre-made squads and GET THOSE BUGS! All rules will be taught to beginners in this very easy-to-learn game of futuristic spaceship exploration.

schedule.title: The 2019 U.S. National Dragon Dice Championship: Single Race Intermediate Event
schedule.description: The13th U.S. National Dragon Dice Championship comes to DEXCON 22! Bring a 36-health army, no more than 50 percent magician dice from a single race with the following restrictions: No more than one of the same monster, no more than two of the same large, nor more than 3 of the same medium, and no more than 4 of the same small. Two Dragons must be brought (choose from black, blue, green, gold, ivory, or red), and any two terrains (including white-inked terrains from the Battlefields expansion). 4.0 Rules as found on the SFR website will be used. Players may play in any or all of the five preliminary sessions, but may only qualify once. The winners at each table will advance to the final round to play for the U.S. National Championship title and a trophy!

schedule.title: ARENA Wings of War
schedule.description: The popular tabletop card WWI fighter combat game has been recreated in 1/48th scale for your entertainment. The rules are simple to grasp; using the rules to best effect can take a long time to master. 16 planes will duel in the skies of the incredible 50' x 20' ARENA for supremacy. Who will be flying at the end? Only you can make that decision!

schedule.title: A Game of Thrones: Hand of the King
schedule.description: Send Varys out to select a new Hand of the King! Unique, quick strategy game where you need to collect personality cards from different houses in order to gain enough influence to get promoted to Hand of the King. Less than a minute to learn to play, but the strategy can be very deep, almost chess like. Lots of fun and fast. Will you be the next Hand?

schedule.title: Boggle
schedule.description: The family favorite game of creating words out of a random collection of letters in a grid. Can you make the most words?

schedule.title: Champions of Hara
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Beneath the roots, way, way down through the layers of what was, past the golden stove, and even deeper than darkness…the sky opens back up. At the core of everything, in the belly of the soul, you’ll find Hara. Look to it when you are tired, scared, or hungry. Call out, and it will find you. Champions of Hara is an adventure board game in which players race to protect a dying world. Players will contain destructive energy by defeating monsters, closing rifts, and exploring the six different zones within Hara. In order to rise to the challenge, players will need to unlock new abilities and collect powerful items.

schedule.title: Dominion
schedule.description: In this popular Rio Grande game, each player starts with an identical, very small deck of cards. In the center of the table is a selection of other cards the players can "buy" as they can afford them. Through their selection of cards to buy, and how they play their hands as they draw them, the players construct their deck on the fly, striving for the most efficient path to the precious victory points by game end. Dominion is not a CCG, but the play of the game is similar to the construction and play of a CCG deck. We might be using the expansion sets, as players want.

schedule.title: Expedition Zetta
schedule.description: You and your fellow travelers each represent a country in a maiden voyage of the first starship to ever use a newly developed warp drive. The goal is to brave the unknown and collect discoveries in four different star systems. Though you may have to cooperate, one player will bring special fame and fortune to their home country. Will it be you?

schedule.title: Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Welcome to Fireball Island! You may have heard stories. You may have visited when you were younger. Perhaps you even saw a fireball engulf a fellow traveler in a hellscape of horror that makes you afraid to close your eyes at night. Whatever the case, welcome back! Turns out that Vul-Kar didn't like having his gem stolen way back when, so there has been some volcanic upheaval, an explosion in our snake population, feral tigers, new types of trees bent on ending human life, and swarms of bees everywhere. But don't worry - we have top people working on it.

schedule.title: Futuropia
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! In Friedemann Friese's big utopian economic game, players live in a future Utopian society that possesses desirable lifestyle qualities for all of its citizens. Too bad this is not today's reality... In this Utopian society, we all will work much less. Our robots can do nearly everything already. There is no need for great envy. It is simply about equality, justice, and the fair allocation of the complete and still necessary work, which then gives us ALL more leisure time.

schedule.title: Innovation
schedule.description: Carl Chudyk's tour of humanity's ideas and advancements. Can you claim enough achievements before technology moves past you?

schedule.title: Kill Doctor Lucky
schedule.description: Welcome to Lucky Mansion, a sprawling country estate filled with unusual weapons, good hiding places, and craven killers. Killers like you. The object? To kill Doctor Lucky. The obstacles? For one thing, all your friends would rather do it first. For another, Doctor Lucky is aptly named. You would think that after being stabbed, poisoned, and poked in the eye, the old man would be long gone. But it’s been nearly 20 years since folks first started trying to kill him, and he keeps coming back stronger than ever.

schedule.title: Last Word Standing
schedule.description: Preview of a fun and engaging new word game coming from Chronicle Books this fall. In Last Word Standing, players must craft words that beat out the competition to the highest score - or lose half their own points in the fray! With action cards to turn the tables, swap cards, steal letters, and more, this fast-paced war of the words can be played by lexicon enthusiasts of every level. Whether you're a quick speller or a longterm strategizer, in the end, it’s not about who's the wordiest - but just who has the LAST WORD STANDING!

schedule.title: Lego Heroica: Twilight Parish
schedule.description: A one-of-a-kind cooperative dungeon crawl adventure made entirely from LEGO pieces. It's based on a simplistic game that LEGO released (called Heroica), but this version is completely custom and much more involved. The game does not involve building, as everything is pre-constructed, but the LEGO medium allows for a fully 3D game world with multiple layers and moving parts. Don't be fooled into thinking it's just for kids! No prior experience is expected or required, and the game is easily learned as it is played. The Twilight Parish scenario is a stand-alone adventure that has players investigating a graveyard and church to find the cause of a zombie outbreak.

schedule.title: No Holds Bard
schedule.description: The Shakespearean fighting game. Hamstring as Hamlet, beatdown as Beatrice, or pursue as the Bear! Choose from over a dozen of the Bard's characters and brawl for victory in a last-character-standing melee.

schedule.title: One Night Ultimate Werewolf
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! One Night Ultimate Werewolf is a fast game in which everyone gets a role: One of the dastardly Werewolves, the tricky Troublemaker, the helpful Seer, or one of a dozen different characters, each with a special ability. In the course of a single morning, your village will decide who is a werewolf...because all it takes is lynching one werewolf to win! This event will be played as several rounds, keeping score for each player (winning side or losing side). Each successive round will add more complex characters, which will also be incorporated from the Daybreak expansion.

schedule.title: Pioneer Days
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Saddle up and guide your wagon train along the perilous Oregon Trail! Build a team of hardy folk and gather resources and equipment with a unique dice drafting system. But dangers await in the dice you don't choose! You can hire townsfolk, buy wagons, pan for gold, and take on cattle - all the while preparing for inevitable raids, storms and famine. Who will best face the perils of the wild frontier and lead their wagon train to victory?

schedule.title: Smash Up
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! The "shufflebuilding" game Smash Up begins with a simple premise: take the 20-card decks of two factions, shuffle them into a deck of forty cards, then compete to crush more Bases than your opponents! Each faction involves a different gaming mechanism - the pirates move the cards, the zombies bring back the cards from the discard pile, the dinosaurs have enormous power - and each combination of factions brings a different gaming experience.

schedule.title: Soul of the Empire
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! An asymmetric strategy game about life in the first century. Players take on the perspective of Romans, Christians, Jews, or a Coalition of outside cultures (Germanic Tribes, Goths and Parthians) in an effort to accomplish their faction's unique objectives using asymmetric advantages.

schedule.title: Spirit Island
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A complex and thematic cooperative game about defending your island home from colonizing Invaders. Players are different spirits of the land, each with its own unique elemental powers. Every turn, players simultaneously choose which of their power cards to play, paying energy to do so. Using combinations of power cards that match a spirit's elemental affinities can grant free bonus effects. Faster powers take effect immediately, before the Invaders spread and ravage, but other magics are slower, requiring forethought and planning to use effectively. In the Spirit phase, spirits gain energy, and choose how / whether to Grow: To reclaim used power cards, to seek for new power, or to spread presence into new areas of the island.

schedule.title: This War of Mine: The Board Game
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! The tabletop adaptation of the award-winning video game that pictures the drama of civilians trapped in a war-torn city. You will enter this experience as a group of civilians trapped in a besieged and conflict-ridden city, enduring many hardships that often test the essence of humanity.

schedule.title: Time's Up!
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A party game for teams of two or more players. The same set of famous names is used for each of three rounds. In each round, one member of a team tries to get his teammates to guess as many names as possible in 30 seconds. In round one, almost any kind of clue is allowed. In round two, no more than one word can be used in each clue (but unlimited sounds and gestures are permitted). In round three, no words are allowed at all.

schedule.title: Titans of Empyrean
schedule.description: In a world ruled from the sky, where the ground is just a menagerie filled with prey, mighty titans battle for domination. Titans of Empyrean lets you take control of a team of Dragons, Griffins, Manticores, or Pegasi. For each of your titans, you will design a stack of maneuver cards that you play one at a time. Each maneuver card brings something special to your titan as you and your opponent dance around the tiny board in an effort to destroy each other. Like a game of chess, Titans of Empyrean does away with all manner of luck. There are no dice, there is no shuffling, and there are no blind draws. You choose the order in which you will stack your maneuvers. You choose how and when to move your titans. Your fate is up to you. Choose well, be cunning, and Empyrean will be yours.

schedule.title: Tokaido
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Each player is a traveler crossing the "East sea road", one of the most magnificent roads of Japan. While traveling, you will meet people, taste fine meals, collect beautiful items, discover great panoramas, and visit temples and wild places but at the end of the day, when everyone has arrived at the end of the road you'll have to be the most initiated traveler - which means that you'll have to be the one who discovered the most interesting and varied things.

schedule.title: Twilight Imperium 4th Edition
schedule.description: A game of galactic conquest in which three to six players take on the role of one of seventeen factions vying for galactic domination through military might, political maneuvering, and economic bargaining. Every faction offers a completely different play experience, from the wormhole-hopping Ghosts of Creuss to the Emirates of Hacan, masters of trade and economics. These seventeen races are offered many paths to victory, but only one may sit upon the throne of Mecatol Rex as the new masters of the galaxy.

schedule.title: Two Rooms and a Boom
schedule.description: In this social deduction party game, there are two teams: The Red Team and the Blue Team. The Blue Team has a President. The Red Team has a Bomber. Players are equally distributed between two rooms. The game consists of five timed rounds. At the end of each round, some players will be swapped into opposing rooms. If the Red Team's Bomber is in the same room as the President at the end of the game, then the Red Team wins; otherwise the Blue Team wins. Alternate facts (lying) encouraged.

schedule.title: Witless Wizards
schedule.description: A mysterious has gathered the most powerful wizards in the world to battle and decide who is the strongest! However, the chosen wizards are getting on in years, even forgetting what most of their spells actually do! Pulling weapons and armor from across time and space, these Witless Wizards begin the final battle.

schedule.title: Novice Tournament
schedule.description: Just learning Dragon Dice? Then get your tournament feet wet at our Novice event. Borrow a pre-constructed 2-player army from us, or bring your own.

schedule.title: Strip Twister
schedule.description: In the last few years, many contestants went behind closed doors to compete in this most unusual tournament. When they emerged an hour later, nobody would talk about what actually took place. What will happen this year? Sign up and find out!

schedule.title: Random Tournament
schedule.description: A video game competition like nothing DEXCON has seen before. This event pits random contestants against each other with a random game to play each round until one gamer stands on top as the master of chance. Where most tournaments test your strength in one type of game, this tournament requires that you be a jack of all trades. Each round a die is rolled to determined what game will be played that round. A fighting game professional may get lucky and pick Soul Calibur, or might get stuck in a Rock Band guitar dual. One round could be the epic sport of Rocket League, or they might be... Dancing with the Stars? We got a light saber duel game for the Wii in here too! What in the world is "Calvin Tucker's Redneck Jamboree" and which two competitors might be forced to play it?

schedule.title: Nicht Scheissen!
schedule.description: "Don't shoot!" Come and learn how to play the preeminent World War II squad infantry combat game by Multi-Man Publishing. We will be doing the first introductory scenario from Starter Kit #1. We know you have heard about this game, so don't hesitate, grab your helmet and your rifle and report for duty.

schedule.title: Mech Race Returns
schedule.description: Long a staple of the various Racing Circuits, Battle Mech Racing was discontinued as the organizers and many racers were called up for Service with their various Successor States and the new SLDF. Now, the fabled light mech Race returns to the area! Can you take your chosen ride and complete the course while dodging the guns of your opponents? Random start positions... ten check points... As in the past, it can be anyone's race to win - hell, even a PNT-9R did so in one of the bloodiest races ever run. Will it be yours? Players may bring any Inner Sphere battlemech of LIGHT class and record sheet for the Mech being used or use one provided. Please bring your own - GM Supplies are limited!

schedule.title: Island Towers of the Terror Folk
schedule.description: Journey to the towering jungle-covered islands of the Terror Folk in search of lost treasure. Who are the mysterious Terror Folk? Not the human tribesmen, and not the snake people, and not the explorers from far away: They have all come in search of something special, hidden high atop the mountainous jungle-covered Islands of the Ghost Archipelago. It will take a while to climb so high: if only you could fly...

schedule.title: Only War Tournament
schedule.description: A three round tournament presented by Mythicos Studios. Players will bring a 2,000 point army to compete with. We will be using the ITC missions. All mats and terrain will be supplied by Mythicos Studios.

schedule.title: The DEXCON 22 $100 Jigsaw Puzzle Championship
schedule.description: Another Double Exposure tradition! Players can play in any or all of the three speed qualifier sessions. Whoever can put their puzzle together the fastest will advance to the final session for a Trophy 'saw-off' - AND a $100 shopping spree in the DEXCON 22 Dealers' Room!

schedule.title: Amun-Re
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Everyone knows of the pyramids on the Nile - eternal monuments of a powerful and beautiful culture, that can still take our breath away. The pharaohs choose their sites, build their pyramids, and thank Amun Re and the other Gods for their bounty. Each player wants, as pharaoh, to build the most pyramids. To accomplish this, he must first acquire a province, where he can trade and farm. With his profits, he can buy new provinces and building stones to erect pyramids. For all his actions, the player must make clever use of his power cards, and always offer appropriate sacrifices to Amun Re. Players must always keep their eyes on the goal of the building of the eternal pyramids or risk falling behind in points.

schedule.title: Bigfoot vs
schedule.description: Yeti. A battle is brewing between the undisputed king of the cryptids Bigfoot and his stone cold cousin the Yeti, who is sick of playing second fiddle. Jersey Devil, Loch Ness Monster, Alligators in the Sewers and more too. Bigfoot vs. Yeti is a rummy style game with lots of twists and turns.

schedule.title: Colony
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Each player constructs and upgrades buildings, while managing resources to grow their fledgling colony. In a clever twist, dice are used as resources, with each side/number representing a different resource. Some resources are stable, allowing them to be stored between turns, while others must be used right away. Buildings provide new capabilities, such as increased production, resource manipulation, and additional victory points. Using dice-as-resources facilitates a dynamic, ever-changing resources management mini-game while players work to earn victory points by adding building to their tableau on their way to victory.

schedule.title: Dice Forge
schedule.description: A development game featuring innovative mechanics based on dice with removable faces. In this dice crafting game, players build their own dice. Roll your dice, manage your resources, complete ordeals before your opponents and explore multiple winning strategies. Now you control the luck of the dice!

schedule.title: Euchre
schedule.description: Join us for this fast-moving, trick-taking game (a scaled-down version of bridge with no bidding). Each hand is played in only five rounds, and each game is played to ten points. Partnership is important, but you can go it alone and try to sweep all five tricks for double points.

schedule.title: Expancity
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A city-building game in which players both collaborate and compete to build a thriving metropolis block by block! Lay down residential and commercial tiles, then claim them with your stackable building blocks to break ground on towers that will rise high above the playing field. Score extra points by building near common city buildings like banks, schools, and parks. You can also get a leg up on the opposition by working on secretly-held contract cards that offer players unique and challenging tasks to complete for bonus points. Cities expand both horizontally and vertically as the game progresses, and no two cities will ever be alike!

schedule.title: Flamme Rouge
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A fast-paced, tactical bicycle racing game where each player controls a team of two riders: a Rouleur and a Sprinteur. The players’ goal is to be the first to cross the finish line with one of their riders. Players move their riders forward by drawing and playing cards from that riders specific deck, depleting it as they go. Use slipstreams to avoid exhaustion and position your team for a well timed sprint for the win.

schedule.title: Grackles
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Grackles are noisy, iridescent birds that love to gather on telephone wires at sunset throughout the southwestern United States. In this lightly-themed abstract strategy game, you line up your birds on the telephone wire to score as many points as possible. Each turn, players choose between drawing and placing a tile, connecting two spots on the telephone wire with their birds, extending a line of birds, or rotating an empty tile. After the board has been built to five tiles by five tiles and all available pairs of spots on the telephone wire have birds on them, the player with the most birds on the telephone wire wins.

schedule.title: One Night Ultimate Super Villains
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players take on the roles of heroes or villains, each with amazing superpowers that help further their cause. The vile trio of Rapscallion, Dr. Peeker, and Henchman #7 are intent on getting away with their crimes, while the members of the Super Club Of Overt Powers (SCOOP), are all out to catch them. Shady Grove - maybe even the world - will never be the same.

schedule.title: Port Royal
schedule.description: The merchant players in this card drafting game, which won the Austrian Game Designers Competition under the title Handler der Karibik, are trying to earn as much as they can out of the Caribbean Sea, but if they set their goals too high, they might take home nothing for the day.

schedule.title: Say Anything
schedule.description: A light-hearted game about what you and your friends think. It gives you the chance to settle questions that have been hotly debated for centuries. For instance, "What is the most overrated band of all time?" or "Which celebrity would be the most fun to hang out with for a day?" So dig deep into your heart or just come up with something witty - this is your chance to Say Anything!

schedule.title: Star Realms: Frontiers
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A fast paced deck-building card game of outer space combat. It combines the fun of a deck-building game with the interactivity of Trading Card Game style combat. As you play, you make use of Trade to acquire new Ships and Bases from the cards being turned face up in the Trade Row from the Trade Deck. You use the Ships and Bases you acquire to either generate more Trade or to generate Combat to attack your opponent and their bases. When you reduce your opponent’s score (called Authority) to zero, you win!

schedule.title: Suited for Speed
schedule.description: Suited for Speed combines auto racing and cards. An entire 5 suited deck is dealt out to 3 - 6 players. If there are an even number of players, then the game is played as teams (before each hand, the teams are voted on). This usually leads to having different partners throughout the game. "Who starts?" "How many spaces the cars move?" and "What suit is trump?" are all voted on after the deal, before each hand. As each trick is taken, that team gets to move their cars. The winner is the person who completes the desired number of laps. Other variations are given as well.

schedule.title: The Table is Lava
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players are presented with a simple challenge: Toss cards onto the table to save your meeples, while trying to knock other players' pieces into the lava at the same time. Have the most survivors, and you win!

schedule.title: Tiny Epic Defenders
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players must select their classes and work together to defend against the evil horde and slay the Epic Foe. Will you take on the role of the Barbarian, the Sorcerer, the Cleric or the Warrior? Each class has a unique player power that you will need to use. In this fast-paced game, players will scramble between various regions outside their Capital City fighting off enemy hordes! Each region will offers unique properties that players must account for in their strategies. If your group is fortunate enough to defeat the wave of monsters, you may live long enough to face the Epic Foe! Which Epic Foe will it be? Will you be prepared!? Does your group have what it takes to survive? Will you have the skill to be crowned the Tiny Epic Defenders!?

schedule.title: Villainous
schedule.description: Each player takes control of one of six Disney characters, each one a villain in a different Disney movie. Each player has their own villain deck, fate deck, player board, and 3D character. On a turn, the active player moves their character to a different location on their player board, takes one or more of the actions visible on that space (often by playing cards from their hand), then refills their hand to four cards. Cards are allies, items, effects, conditions, and (for some characters) curses. You need to use your cards to fulfill your unique win condition.

schedule.title: Wasteland Trading Post
schedule.description: In a post-apocalyptic world where everyday items have become desired luxuries, it's up to you to satisfy the wants and needs of your town's citizens. With a rich barter-based economy, you can scrounge and trade for the luxuries your townsfolk desire and the necessities they require to deal with ongoing events and periodic shortages.

schedule.title: The Red Dragon Inn
schedule.description: The adventure is over, but the party is just beginning! Choose from 20 different zany characters as you drink, brawl, and gamble, and try to be the last one standing. Will you be Fiona the Volatile? Or Pooky, the rabbit familiar who is seriously crazy...seriously. What about Wizgille, the Gnome Artificer? Or Gog...just Gog. This will be run using the Sea Event Deck from RDI4, but not the "Gambling? I'm in!" expansion. Beginners more than welcome, all rules will be taught before the game starts.

schedule.title: The DEXCON War Chest Tournament
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A bag-building war game! At the start of the game, raise your banner call (drafting) several various units into your army, which you then use to capture key points on the board. To succeed in War Chest, you must successfully manage not only your armies on the battlefield, but those that are waiting to be deployed. Each round you draw three unit coins from your bag, then take turns using them to perform actions. Each coin shows a military unit on one side and can be used for one of several actions. The game ends when one player - or one team in the case of a four-player game - has placed all of their control markers. That player or team wins! This elimination tournament will be run in three rounds.

schedule.title: Novice Tournament
schedule.description: Just learning Daemon Dice? Then get your tournament feet wet at our Novice event. Borrow a pre-constructed 2-player 13-point army from us, or bring your own.

schedule.title: The Family Game Table
schedule.description: Bring the entire family and join other gamer families for some fun together. We will be gathering in a conference room so the littlest of our families can roam as those who wish to play a game do so. We will have a selection of games for adults, children, and everyone in between. What we play will be up to the attendees, so feel free to bring your own favorite along! Everyone is welcome to join us, but patience is a must as frequent interruptions and slow play will occur as parents tend to their children.

schedule.title: Papua
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players lead a scientific expedition to Papua New Guinea, one of the richest territories in flora and fauna, in the late years of the XIXth century. Their discoveries will astonish the scientific community - but only if they run the expedition successfully. Whomever manages to collect the most relevant discoveries will be remembered throughout history.

schedule.title: The DEXCON 22 Pun Contest
schedule.description: Our infamous Pun Contest pits the brightest (er, wackiest) contestants against each other in a knock-down, drag-out, groan-producing brawl. Run by +2 Comedy, players will compete to compose puns based on common English expressions. Once a pun is used, it cannot be used again. To make matters worse, the audience can shout out anything they want, and if an audience member steals a pun, it is also off-limits. A panel of judges will make decisions on the quality of puns. Join this event ONLY as a contestant. To be an audience member, just show up.

schedule.title: The 2019 U.S. National Dragon Dice Championship: Advanced Constructed Starter Event
schedule.description: The13th U.S. National Dragon Dice Championship comes to DEXCON 22! Bring a 36-health army, no more than 50 percent magician dice, and prepare for war! Dragonkin, Magic Items, Minor Terrains, and Promotion Dice may be used, but are not required. All spells are in play. 4.0 Rules as found on the SFR website will be used. Players may play in any or all of the five preliminary sessions, but may only qualify once. The winners at each table will advance to the final round to play for the U.S. National Championship title and a trophy!

schedule.title: ARENA Robo Rally: The Last Treadmill
schedule.description: A DEXCON 22 EXCLUSIVE! Join us for Robo Rally as never before - Giant Robots made in scale for the 50' x 20' ARENA! After the last shift leaves for the night the computers that run the factory robots break the monotony by holding rally races around the factory floor. But to make things fair the commands that each computer can issue to its robot are granted randomly by the main computer. This won't be an easy race because everybody knows that the main computer is a mean son-of-a-silicon-wafer who likes messing with the game. Robot figures will be provided but players are encouraged to bring their own. The only restriction is that it can be no larger than ten inches square and shouldn't be much higher than that either.

schedule.title: Batchelder's Bridge
schedule.description: An intellectual battle of nerves where you must out duel up to 5 other players in 30 categories. There is trivia, card playing, drawing, predicting, and more. You must forge a path from one end of the bridge to the other by outsmarting the other players.

schedule.title: Before There Were Stars...
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Since ancient times, the twinkling of the heavens inspired people across the globe to create stories that answered the most important of questions: "Who are we… and how did it all begin?" This "feel-good" game lets you appreciate the boundless imagination in all of us and awards points for the best story moments - allowing everyone to shine regardless of their skill as a storyteller. Playing this game is a breath of fresh air that never repeats itself, except in the fun and warmth of emotion it brings to your table.

schedule.title: Codenames: Marvel
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Two teams compete to see who can make contact with all of their agents first. Spymasters give one-word clues that can point to multiple words on the board. Their teammates try to guess words of the right color while avoiding those that belong to the opposing team. And everyone wants to avoid the assassin. Codenames: Marvel keeps the Codenames gameplay, while featuring characters and locations from the Marvel Comics universe, with words on one side of the cards and images on the other.

schedule.title: Dead of Winter: The Long Night
schedule.description: The game has players at a new colony location trying to survive with new survivors against brand new challenges. Can you handle being raided by members of other colonies? Will you explore more and unravel the mysteries of the Raxxon pharmaceutical location to find powerful items but release stronger enemies? Or will you upgrade your colony to help it better withstand the undead horde? These are all choices you will get to make.

schedule.title: Downfall
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! In the year 2213, the world order - as it had been known for a century and a half - came to an abrupt end over a 19 day war. The bombs started falling on the third day, and by the 19th day ninety-nine percent of the earth's population was dead or would be soon. Wars and conflicts had raged now and again for decades prior, populations rising up, and the global government seeking to quell the conflict and maintain the status quo. But in the most recent five year period, the conflicts escalated rapidly, and the world order began to come apart—leaders became scared and trigger fingers twitchy. No one knows who pressed the button first, and in the harsh realities of the world that followed, no one cared. What mattered was surviving and, if possible, rebuilding.

schedule.title: Dragon Slayer
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A push-your-luck game that's a deceptively difficult challenge. Like all great PYL games, the rules are simple, with you repeating the Dragon Hunt until you decide to stop. The very interesting twist is the player challenges. The ability to challenge - and rewards for passing or failing when challenged - add a dimension to everything that you do on your turn. What order do you go after dragons? When do you stop? When do you challenge? Who do you challenge? How do you get others not to challenge you?!

schedule.title: Dragonfire
schedule.description: A deckbuilding game set within the world's greatest role playing game, Dungeons & Dragons. Players choose from a number of races, from dwarf to elf, half-orc to human, while assuming the quintessential roles of cleric, rogue, fighter, and wizard. Equipped with weapons, spells, and magic items, players begin their adventure along the famed Sword Coast.

schedule.title: En Garde Reforged
schedule.description: A reboot of Slugfest's 2005 cinematic action card game. 2-6 impeccably dressed Renaissance-era duelists engaged in a pitched clifftop melee. Players must attempt to out maneuver their opponents in a series of one on one duels to prove their technique reigns supreme. Carefully manage your cards and keep calm, cool and collected if you hope to win the day. If you’re attacked at the wrong moment, prepare to taste cold steel!

schedule.title: Go Cuckoo!
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! On your turn in Zum Kuckuck!, you take one standing stick and put it on the nest. If both ends of the stick have the same color, you may choose to lay an egg on it. Otherwise, you take another stick whose top color is the same as the hiding color of the previous one, up to three sticks. After laying an egg or putting the third stick with different colors, your turn ends. There are penalties for a stick touching the ground or eggs falling from the nest. The first person to lay all of their eggs can then put the cuckoo on the nest and win the game.

schedule.title: Good Cop Bad Cop
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Good Cop Bad Cop is a 52 card hidden identity, deduction game where each player takes on the role of a law enforcement officer in a corrupt district. Players must investigate others to figure out who is on their side, grab one of the 2-3 guns on the table, and shoot the opposing leader to win the game. This event will integrate expansions.

schedule.title: Heroes of Land, Air & Sea
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A 4X-style board game with miniatures that tells the epic tale of orcs vs. humans, dwarves vs. elves, battling kingdoms, and the individuals who turn the tides of war. This event will include all expansions.

schedule.title: Illimat
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Illimat has the style and flavor of a classic card game with a dynamic twist. As you play, you combine cards and collect them, trying to gather more than your opponents. But hidden Luminaries and changing seasons can alter your plans. Featuring a cloth board, metal tokens, and illustrations by Carson Ellis.

schedule.title: Ingenious
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! The goal of this game is, through clever placement, to obtain points in the different symbol colours on a 120-part hex board. Points are claimed by placing a piece such that the symbols on it lie next to already-placed pieces with the same symbol.

schedule.title: Legendary Encounters
schedule.description: A deck-building game in the same family as Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game, but now players must cooperate in order to survive against hordes of aliens. Taking on the role of protagonists such as Ripley, Dallas, Bishop and Corporal Hicks, players take turns recruiting cards for their deck from a central selection in order to improve their deck and defeat Xenomorph cards that are added to the central game board.

schedule.title: Munchkin Panic
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! In this hybrid game, the Munchkin monsters have found the Castle Panic towers and are on the rampage! Players need to combine cards to hit and slay the monsters before they destroy the castle. The card combos available in Munchkin Panic are created from a unique mixing of the decks of the two source games. Each defeated monster becomes a trophy and gives up its treasure to the victor. If players work together to defeat the monsters, the player with the highest point count becomes Master Munchkin - but players must balance their self-interest with the cooperation necessary to survive. If players get too greedy, the monsters will stomp the castle flat while the players are too busy fighting amongst themselves!

schedule.title: Othello
schedule.description: The classic game of reversi, played with standard rules.

schedule.title: Outflank
schedule.description: It's war! Face down your opponent, find their weaknesses and rout their army. But beware, your own armies aren't unlimited and no army can be strong everywhere. Can you break your enemy before they break you? A fast, strategic tile laying wargame.

schedule.title: Railways of the World
schedule.description: Revisit the early days of the Age of Steam as you begin with a locomotive (the venerable John Bull, the first locomotive to run in North America) and a vision (your Tycoon "mission" card). From there, build your budding railroad network into a vast empire. Connect New York to Chicago, earn the most money, develop bigger and faster locomotives and maybe even span North America and build the Transcontinental Railway!

schedule.title: Rescue Polar Bears: Data & Temperature
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! The consumption of fossil fuel and releasing of greenhouse gases yield the global warming. Around the north pole, the last icebergs are melting and the polar bears are facing the risk of being extinct. The players form a scientific organization. They try to collect data about climate change to persuade the governments to change their energy policy. At the same time, they also need to prevent polar bears from sinking into the freezing water.

schedule.title: Sagrada
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Each player builds a stained glass window by building up a grid of dice on their player board. Each board has some restrictions on which color or shade (value) of die can be placed there. Dice of the same shade or color may never be placed next to each other. Dice are drafted in player order, with the start player rotating each round, snaking back around after the last player drafts two dice. Scoring is variable per game based on achieving various patterns and varieties of placement...as well as bonus points for dark shades of a particular hidden goal color.

schedule.title: Sentinels of the Multiverse
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A mad scientist holds the world hostage with his terrifying inventions. An alien warlord from a far away galaxy brings his limitless army of bizarre minions to conquer the planet. A giant rampaging robot cuts a swath of destruction across the coast, destroying major population centers. And who will stand in their way? A team of heroes, all with impressive powers and abilities stand between the world and the forces of evil. Will you help them? Answer the call to protect the multiverse!

schedule.title: Super Dungeon Explore
schedule.description: The Dark Consul has sent his champion, the Dragon Starfire, and its minions to ravage the Crystal Caves, and they need to be stopped! Choose from a selection of heroes such as the stalwart Noble Paladin, the spell-slinging Ember Mage, and the fierce Claw Tribe Barbarian, send them into the caves to face Starfire's monster hordes, and try to survive!

schedule.title: Take 5 (6 nimmt!)
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! You want to score as few points as possible. To play the game, you shuffle the 104 number cards, lay out four cards face-up to start the four rows, then deal ten cards to each player. Each turn, players simultaneously choose and reveal a card from their hand, then add the cards to the rows, with cards being placed in ascending order based on their number; specifically, each card is placed in the row that ends with the highest number that's below the card's number. When the sixth card is placed in a row, the owner of that card claims the other five cards and the sixth card becomes the first card in a new row.

schedule.title: Teotihuacan: City of Gods
schedule.description: Travel back in time to the greatest city in Mesoamerica. Witness the glory and the twilight of the powerful pre-Columbian civilization. Strategize, accrue wealth, gain the favour of the gods, and become the builder of the magnificent Pyramid of the Sun.

schedule.title: That's Pretty Clever & Twice As Clever
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Two great Stronghold titles combined into one slot. Choose your dice well in That's Pretty Clever to enter them into the matching colored area, put together tricky chain-scoring opportunities, and rack up the points. The dice you don't use are as important as what you do because every die that's smaller than the chosen one can be used by the other players, keeping everyone in the game at all times. Twice As Clever follows the model. Each turn the active player rolls six dice, chooses one of them to mark off a space on their scoring grid, places any dice with lower numbers on the side, then re-rolls any remaining dice. The white die is a joker and can be used as any one of the other five colors. After the active player chooses at most three dice, then the other players chooses one of the set-aside dice for use on their scoring sheet.

schedule.title: Through the Ages: A New Story of Civilization
schedule.description: A civilization building game. Each player attempts to build the best civilization through careful resource management, discovering new technologies, electing the right leaders, building wonders and maintaining a strong military. Weakness in any area can be exploited by your opponents. The game takes place throughout the ages beginning in the age of antiquity and ending in the modern age.

schedule.title: Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress
schedule.description: You and your friends take on the role of a group of disparate explorers delving into the labyrinthine halls of a vast and ancient space station. Only by working together and balancing your strength and skills can you hope to survive. With each expedition, you will discover powerful archeotech and learn more of the Blackstone Fortress’ closely guarded secrets, including, perhaps, the location of its greatest treasure.

schedule.title: The King's Abbey
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A worker placement/resource management game in which each player has their own player board that represents the abbey they have been tasked to build. Players take charge of monks that are represented by ten dice as they go out and gather resources, go on crusades, construct buildings, train clergy, bring in peasants, and defend their abbey against the darkness. Each player does this by rolling their dice and then assigning each die (monk) to different places on their player board, resource boards, and crusade cards. The places on the player boards will bring in peasants and train clergy. The places on the resource boards will give them wood, grain, stone, and sand for building the various parts of their individual abbeys.

schedule.title: Soul Calibur VI
schedule.description: RATED: T. Bring more than your fists to the fight! Featuring all-new battle mechanics and characters, SOUL CALIBUR VI marks a new era of the historic franchise. Welcome back to the stage of history!

schedule.title: Heavy Gear Blitz!
schedule.description: Heavy Gear Blitz is a miniatures wargame set in the award-winning Heavy Gear universe. In Heavy Gear Blitz players take command of detachments of Heavy Gears (light, piloted humanoid mecha) with support from tanks, infantry and other resources to take objectives and smash the enemy.

schedule.title: Action Cats!
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players take turns being the "judge," while the rest are storytellers. The judge draws a cat card from the top of the deck and gives the cat a name. The rest of the players each build a story using the cards in their hand. They tell the story to the judge, embellishing all they want (that's the fun part!), and the judge picks their favorite story as the winner!

schedule.title: Azul
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players take turns drafting colored tiles from suppliers to their player board. Later in the round, players score points based on how they've placed their tiles to decorate the palace. Extra points are scored for specific patterns and completing sets; wasted supplies harm the player's score. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

schedule.title: Born to Serve
schedule.description: The good news is that you are a super hero. The bad news is that the government, owing to the recent recession, has decided to cut funding for your super group. The loss of income leaves you looking for a new source of revenue to maintain your super heroic lifestyle. Fortunately, the restaurant across the street from your (now former) base is looking for a new waiter and would be more than willing to have a super powered server on their wait staff. Unfortunately, all the other members of your group have come up with this exact same plan. It's now a fight between you and your (now former) team mates to earn the most tips to land the one server job at the restaurant. Of course, none of you are above surreptitiously using your powers to help you secure the job. The one who earns the most tips will win. That whole crime-fighting can wait till later. Born to Serve is a board game brawl between two to four jobless superheroes for the last job in town...at the local restaurant...waiting tables. Oh, how the mighty have fallen.

schedule.title: Dragonfire
schedule.description: A deckbuilding game set within the world's greatest role playing game, Dungeons & Dragons. Players choose from a number of races, from dwarf to elf, half-orc to human, while assuming the quintessential roles of cleric, rogue, fighter, and wizard. Equipped with weapons, spells, and magic items, players begin their adventure along the famed Sword Coast.

schedule.title: Drop It
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Circles, triangles, squares and diamonds: Drop It is about letting go, with the pieces you drop landing somewhere in the vertical game board, ideally where they'll score the most points, but the tiles bounce around and don't always land where you expect them to!

schedule.title: Here, Kitty, Kitty!
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! In the crazy cat-collecting game Here, Kitty, Kitty!, your neighborhood has a cat problem. The problem is that the cats don't all belong to YOU! Everyone in the neighborhood wants to claim those adorable kitties for themselves. Outwit your fellow feline fiends as you lure cats onto your property, move cats into your house, and steal cats from your neighbors. All's fair in love and cat-collecting!

schedule.title: Legends of Andor
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Legends of Andor is a cooperative adventure board game for two to four players in which a band of heroes must work together to defend a fantasy realm from invading hordes. To secure Andor's borders, the heroes will embark on dangerous quests over the course of five unique scenarios (as well as a final scenario created by the players themselves). But as the clever game system keeps creatures on the march toward the castle, the players must balance their priorities carefully.

schedule.title: Love Letter
schedule.description: Love Letter is a game of risk, deduction, and luck. Your goal is to get your love letter into Princess Annette's hands while deflecting the letters from competing suitors. From a deck with only sixteen cards, each player starts with only one card in hand; one card is removed from play. On a turn, you draw one card, and play one card, trying to expose others and knock them from the game. Powerful cards lead to early gains, but make you a target. Rely on weaker cards for too long, however, and your letter may be tossed in the fire!

schedule.title: My First Castle Panic
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A co-operative game in which players work together to defend their castle, but this game removes the reading requirement of the earlier one and fosters the development of educational skills, such as identifying colors and shapes, problem solving, and turn taking. In the game, monsters follow a single path toward a single, large, eye-catching castle, which is protected by one wall.

schedule.title: Orphanage of Fear
schedule.description: Abandoned and unwanted with the dust bowl blotting out the sun and any hope, children have begun to disappear. The players take the role of either orphans or the boogeymen hiding among them. But the children are not entirely without help. The few toys of the orphanage, passed around and shared by the caretaker, can grant respite and reprieve to any who have them. But that doesn't stop the boogeymen from getting them either...

schedule.title: Space Base
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players assume the roles of Commodores of a small fleet of ships. Ships begin docked at their stations and are then deployed to sectors as new ships are commissioned under your command. Use cargo vessels to engage in trade and commerce; mining vessels to build reoccurring base income; and carriers to spread your influence. Establish new colonies for a new Commodore in a sector to gain even more influence. Gain enough influence and you can be promoted to Admiral!

schedule.title: Stellar Siege
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Deploy aliens, conquer planets, and out-smart your enemy in this showdown of stellar proportions! In Stellar Siege, play as one of two alien races vying for control of eight planets in a distant solar system. Each turn, you will deploy an alien to the planet whose number corresponds to the number of cards in your hand. Deploying an alien will allow you to manipulate the number of cards in your own hand or your opponent's hand. In order to conquer the most planets and win the game, you will need to balance manipulating your own hand size and your opponent’s hand size controlling where they will deploy on their next turn. The player who can do this will rule the solar system!

schedule.title: The Monster You Know
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! a super fun silly game that turns the players into monsters! Every turn each player recieves a monstrous trait they have to act out and then all players answer a question about their monster and every player adds an additional monsterous trait to thier previous one and the players monsters become more complex and hillarious to act out!  Find out who is The Monster You Know!

schedule.title: The Networks
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! You and your opponents are new television networks, and you need new programming. For this, you'll need Shows, Stars, and Ads. Shows need Stars and Ads. Stars give you bonus viewers (points), and Ads give you extra money. You'll need everything you can get; you'll have a small amount of resources and time, and you must grab the latest hot show before your opponents. But some Stars will only give their best effort if you put them on in the proper conditions. And Shows age and viewers lose interest, so you have to keep your lineup fresh by canceling shows and sending them into reruns. If you need a special push, there will be Network Cards available that can give you special powers. But will a Network Card be better than another action? You'll have to make that call. The player with the most viewers after five seasons wins!

schedule.title: Tower of Madness
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A three-dimensional clock tower, standing a foot tall and filled with marbles of four distinct colors, stands before you. Thirty unworldly tentacles push through the tower walls in every direction in this high-tension, push-your-luck dice game of Lovecraft-inspired horror. Fail your investigation dice rolls and you will be forced to draw a tentacle from the tower. Any marbles that fall as a result affect your character immediately, whether adding to your discovery total, gaining you spells and knowledge that man was not meant to have, or gaining madness; drop one of the three DOOM marbles, however, and you summon Cthulhu and end the game.

schedule.title: Ubongo
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players compete to solve individual puzzles as quickly as they can to get first crack at the gems on hand for the taking. At the start of a round, each player receives a puzzle card that depicts a shape created by some number of squares; one side of this card depicts six rows of 3 pieces, the other side depicts six rows of 4 pieces, for a more difficult puzzle. When everyone is ready, someone rolls a die to determine which row of pieces each player can use to recreate the shape on their individual card. The race is timed by a sand timer, and the outcome of this race determines the action on the main playing board.

schedule.title: Valparaiso
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! In 1811, free trade is declared for the harbor city of Valparaíso in Chile. A short time later, Chile proclaims its independence. As an influential citizen of Valparaíso, you want to push the development of your city, so you send merchants into the hinterland to get hold of important export goods and send your ships overseas to gain new achievements there. To do well in Valparaíso, you must plan well ahead, keep an eye on your opponents, and react to their actions at short notice.

schedule.title: The 2019 Northeast Regional Diamonds Championship
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! This Stronghold game by Mike Fitzgerald is a trick-taking card game in which players collect Diamonds - not cards bearing that suit, mind you, but rather actual "Diamond Crystals". What makes the game of Diamonds different from other trick-taking card games is that when you cannot follow suit you get a "Suit Action" based on what suit you do play. Suit Actions are also taken by the winner of each trick, as well as at the end of a full Round of play. Whoever has the most points in Diamond Crystals at the end of the game wins! The winner of this Championship will get a trophy, a seat in the first elimination round of the 2019 U.S. National Championship at Gen Con (August 1-4 in Indianapolis, Indiana), a FREE 4-day membership to Gen Con, and a FREE 3-night room share in Indianapolis for Gen Con!

schedule.title: Munchkin Blend - Christmas in July
schedule.description: Original Munchkin with all Santa Expansions, extra elves, and blended with Santa monsters from Axe Cop and Zombies. All "Holiday Promo" items would count as though it is really right around Christmas time, so everyone should bring their Munchkin Holiday Cards, Christmas Coins, Ornament, etc. Bonus prizes awarded for wearing Christmas themed items.

schedule.title: The 80's
schedule.description: Can you solve it? Who sang it? Can you sing it? In Paraphrase: Songs in Other Words you have to recall the the names of popular songs, but you only have a limited amount of time to do so! The clues, however, are a paraphrase of the song titles...making them a little less recognizable. Can you and your team members do it? This new game from Flying Lemur Games is on Kickstarter now. This event will be run with a prototype of the game, so the final product may differ some.

schedule.title: Artist Alley Telestrations
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! The game of Telestrations is Pictionary meets Telephone. In this adapted game, our large band of artists will play with audience members who write clues. We'll take the artwork to a whole new level!

schedule.title: Game the Gamer (Single Player)
schedule.description: Four players compete in the most dastardly of video game competitions. At the start of the game you will be given 50 dealer's room dollars. Then all you have to do to keep the money, is not come in last in the three mystery video games we will be playing. If you come in last you must return all your prize money. However before you play each game we will have an auction. Bidding with your own prize money you may buy sabotages to handicap your fellow contestants. Can you hang on to your money and survive playing with a broken controller while wearing beer goggles? Be a part of the fun before the Official YouTube launch.

schedule.title: Badass Board Game Battle
schedule.description: Think you are a master of Board Games? Here is your chance to prove it in the ultimate smack down of Board Game dominance.
