A co-operative game in which players work together to defend their castle, but this game removes the reading requirement of the earlier one and fosters the development of educational skills, such as identifying colors and shapes, problem solving, and turn taking. In the game, monsters follow a single path toward a single, large, eye-catching castle, which is protected by one wall.

schedule.title: Mystic Vale
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players take on the role of druidic clans trying to cleanse the curse upon the land. Each turn, you play cards into your field to gain powerful advancements and useful vale cards. Use your power wisely, or decay will end your turn prematurely. Score the most victory points to win the game!

schedule.title: No Holds Bard
schedule.description: The Shakespearean fighting game. Hamstring as Hamlet, beatdown as Beatrice, or pursue as the Bear! Choose from over a dozen of the Bard's characters and brawl for victory in a last-character-standing melee.

schedule.title: Pomegranate Planet
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Welcome to Pomegranate Planet, where the mighty pomegranate is valued above all else! Compete against your rival pomegranate farmers in order to grow the most pomegranates by the end of the game. You'll get your goods from the market, where farmers secretly bid on which items they hope to bring back to the fields in their farms. You'll need a combination of bluffing and strategy to get the best stuff from the market and to optimize your fields for maximum pomegranate growth.

schedule.title: Rise of Tribes
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players control a tribal faction in prehistoric times that's looking to grow, move, gather, and lead their people. The board is modular, composed of hexes in various terrain types. Each turn you roll two dice, and may select from four actions. The power of your action depends on your die roll PLUS the last couple of dice on that action card. Victory is possible in a couple ways: gathering resources to build villages and/or completing development and achievement goals for your civilization.

schedule.title: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
schedule.description: Players take on the roles of famous leaders in charge of historical civilizations, each with their own abilities. Players will be able to explore a module game board, build cities and buildings, fight battles, research powerful technology, and attract great people by advancing their culture. No matter what your play style is, there is a civilization for you!

schedule.title: Stone Age
schedule.description: You guide your clan as it tries to survive and prosper in the uncertain times of the late Stone Age. Hunt, gather resources, learn to farm and use tools, and discover the rudiments of civilization. (From the creator of St. Petersburg.)

schedule.title: Super Dungeon Explore
schedule.description: The Dark Consul has sent his champion, the Dragon Starfire, and its minions to ravage the Crystal Caves, and they need to be stopped! Choose from a selection of heroes such as the stalwart Noble Paladin, the spell-slinging Ember Mage, and the fierce Claw Tribe Barbarian, send them into the caves to face Starfire's monster hordes, and try to survive!

schedule.title: The Strip
schedule.description: A worker placement game, set in the 60s/70s, in which you build a Casino while simultaneously working with the Mafia. Your goal as a Casino owner is to build the most successful and prestigious casino while collecting staff/VIP poker cards that allow you to win against your fellow casino owners.

schedule.title: Two Rooms and a Boom
schedule.description: In this social deduction party game, there are two teams: The Red Team and the Blue Team. The Blue Team has a President. The Red Team has a Bomber. Players are equally distributed between two rooms. The game consists of five timed rounds. At the end of each round, some players will be swapped into opposing rooms. If the Red Team's Bomber is in the same room as the President at the end of the game, then the Red Team wins; otherwise the Blue Team wins. Alternate facts (lying) encouraged.

schedule.title: Unicorns
schedule.description: A cute little game of matching for children, ages 4 through 8. Kids match blue, orange, pink, purple, yellow and red unicorns. To make a pair, players take cards either from the pile, or from the other players!

schedule.title: We're Doomed!
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! The world is coming to an end! We must act now to survive!!! Players are the most powerful leaders in the world working alongside up to nine others to build a starship. Time is short! The goal? Build and be on a starship that escapes a dying world - or betray everyone to ensure your own survival. No seats on the starship are guaranteed. We're Doomed! is a quick, timed, panic-inducing game of international collaboration, retaliation, diplomacy, conspiracy, and blowing each other up for fun!

schedule.title: Super Science Playroom
schedule.description: Here at The Super Science Playroom of Tokyo, we provide plenty of enrichment toys for your favorite kaiju. This will be a game of King of Tokyo player with ALL THE EXPANSIONS! The evolution cards form "Power Up", Tokyo Tower from "King Kong", cultists from "Cthulhu", "Halloween" costumes, even the Die of Fate from "Anubis" will be present. Players will be assigned a random monster form "King of Tokyo" or "King of New York", and the 2nd edition rulebooks will be enforced. We're big now, we deserve to play with ALL! THE! THINGS!

schedule.title: Super Smash Bros 8 Player Madness
schedule.description: RATED: E10+. Gaming icons clash in the ultimate brawl you can play anytime, anywhere! Smash rivals off the stage as new characters Simon Belmont and King K. Rool join Inkling, Ridley, and every fighter in Super Smash Bros. history. Enjoy enhanced speed and combat at new stages based on the Castlevania series, Super Mario Odyssey, and more!

schedule.title: Heavy Gear Blitz!
schedule.description: Heavy Gear Blitz is a miniatures wargame set in the award-winning Heavy Gear universe. In Heavy Gear Blitz players take command of detachments of Heavy Gears (light, piloted humanoid mecha) with support from tanks, infantry and other resources to take objectives and smash the enemy.

schedule.title: The Walking Dead All Out War Miniatures Game
schedule.description: A game of fast-paced, head-to-head skirmishes set in the iconic world of The Walking Dead. This is your chance to play through the storylines of the best-selling comic series. Assemble a group of your favorite characters from The Walking Dead. Kit them out with a variety of weapons, items and abilities. Battle to achieve dominance against rival gangs in the Walker-strewn Atlanta cityscape. Experience first-hand the desperate struggle for survival faced by Rick and his fellow Survivors.

schedule.title: Bring & Battle
schedule.description: Bring 1850 points and play against friends or challenge the host. Super heavies and VDR vehicles welcome. Emphasis is on fun!

schedule.title: Space Hulk
schedule.description: Double Exposure continues a tradition with Space Hulk battles throughout the convention! Play with your favorite squad (special rules regarding various races will be available onsite) or use our pre-made squads and GET THOSE BUGS! All rules will be taught to beginners in this very easy-to-learn game of futuristic spaceship exploration.

schedule.title: Speakeasy
schedule.description: An INDEPENDENTLY PUBLISHED GAME - Part of the Indie Games Explosion! For lovers of Ultimate Werewolf and Two Rooms in a Boom. In the roaring twenties, corruptions is on the rise in your city. Through deception and social deduction, the Mob and the Feds must covertly identify and organize their teammates, listen for secret passwords, discover enemy secrets, sow misinformation, infiltrate the opposition, and find the secret passwords that will lead to the others demise.

schedule.title: Brick Thunder Road
schedule.description: A Lego version of the Milton Bradley game Thunder Road. The game is played on two 6ft long tables. It is a rolling road game with the tables on casters so that they can be swapped to create a continuous road. Thunder Road is a last man standing, Ram, Wreck, Survival game.

schedule.title: Chopstick Dexterity MegaChallenge 3000
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A simple but frantic dexterity game in which the object is to collect the most tokens by using chopsticks to pick up the object shown on the token. The theme is presented as a TV game show intended to promote the use of chopsticks among Japanese youth.

schedule.title: Christmas Cards
schedule.description: A children's card game for ages 4 through 10. Kids make pairs with Santa, Rudolph, Toy Soldier, and a Candy Cane. Because a child doesn't want to see Coal in their Stocking on Christmas morning, they must pair that with the Tree with Presents.

schedule.title: Chronicles of Crime
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A cooperative game of crime investigation, mixing an app, a board game and a touch of Virtual Reality. With the same physical components (board, locations, characters and items), players will be able to play plenty of different scenarios and solve as many different crime stories. Players start the app, choose the scenario they want to play, and follow the story. The goal being to catch the killer of the current case in the shortest short time possible.

schedule.title: Coconuts
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A dexterity game based on the "Monkey King" character from Chinese mythology. In the game, players launch coconuts toward a field of cups in the middle of the playing area. Land in a cup, and you get to stack it on your player board; land in a cup on someone else's board, and you get to move it to yours. By playing special "Monkey King Magic" cards, you can force opponents to shoot blind, take long shots, or otherwise bollix their efforts to cup a coconut. Whoever first completes a pyramid of six cups on his player board wins!

schedule.title: Dead Last
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Originally known as Tontine - it's a "social collusion" game of shifting alliances, betrayals, and murder for profit in which players must conspire and vote upon whom to kill each round. Any means of overt or covert communication is allowed - a glance, a nod, pointing under the table, flashing a card, anything – but make sure you don't tip off the target or they could ambush you instead! In the end, one or two players will remain, either claiming all the gold or squaring off in a final showdown before starting the next round of play. The first player to score 24 points of gold wins.

schedule.title: Dice Forge
schedule.description: A development game featuring innovative mechanics based on dice with removable faces. In this dice crafting game, players build their own dice. Roll your dice, manage your resources, complete ordeals before your opponents and explore multiple winning strategies. Now you control the luck of the dice!

schedule.title: Echidna Shuffle
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Echidnas pick up bugs and deliver them to their home stumps in the family-friendly game Echidna Shuffle. In more detail, players move the twelve echidnas from leaf to leaf, picking up bugs in their color from their pick-up leaf, and moving them to the three matching-colored stumps. But the forest floor is a traffic jam of echidnas that have to be moved out of the way before you can get there. The first player to deliver all three bugs wins.

schedule.title: Fano
schedule.description: An abstract strategy combat card game with a unique rock-paper-scissors attack system and a minor engine builder mechanic.

schedule.title: Flash Point: Fire Rescue
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! The call comes in... "911, what is your emergency?" On the other end is a panicked response of "FIRE!" Moments later you don the protective suits that will keep you alive, gather your equipment and rush to the scene of a blazing inferno. The team has only seconds to assess the situation and devise a plan of attack – then you spring into action like the trained professionals that you are. You must face your fears, never give up, and above all else work as a team because the fire is raging, the building is threatening to collapse, and lives are in danger. You must succeed. You are the brave men and women of fire rescue; people are depending on you. This is what you do every day. This event may use expansion sets as requested by the players.

schedule.title: Imhotep
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players become builders in Egypt who want to emulate the first and best-known architect there, namely Imhotep. Over six rounds, they move wooden stones by boat to create five seminal monuments, and on a turn, a player chooses one of four actions: Procure new stones, load stones on a boat, bring a boat to a monument, or play an action card. While this sounds easy, naturally the other players constantly thwart your building plans by carrying out plans of their own. Only those with the best timing - and the stones to back up their plans - will prove to be Egypt's best builder.

schedule.title: Outflank
schedule.description: It's war! Face down your opponent, find their weaknesses and rout their army. But beware, your own armies aren't unlimited and no army can be strong everywhere. Can you break your enemy before they break you? A fast, strategic tile laying wargame.

schedule.title: Run For Your Life, Candyman!
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! This popular game from Smirk & Dagger Games is a twisted parody of a classic board game. Yours is a sugar frosted land of confection. But underneath the candy covered veneer lies a disturbing truth. The king is selling the sweet citizens out the back door to voracious children all over the world. Now it's a mad dash for the border to save your little candy buttons. And if you have to snap a few ginger limbs to do it - well, that's the way the cookie crumbles.

schedule.title: Siege
schedule.description: Work with a friend to stop the march of the cards.  Beware: your resources weaken over time, and the deck is relentlessly alive. Siege is a colorful, cooperative game for two players who love a tense, difficult challenge.

schedule.title: Star Realms: Frontiers
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A fast paced deck-building card game of outer space combat. It combines the fun of a deck-building game with the interactivity of Trading Card Game style combat. As you play, you make use of Trade to acquire new Ships and Bases from the cards being turned face up in the Trade Row from the Trade Deck. You use the Ships and Bases you acquire to either generate more Trade or to generate Combat to attack your opponent and their bases. When you reduce your opponent’s score (called Authority) to zero, you win!

schedule.title: Subtext
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players try to communicate with one another by drawing hints about the word on their card. Drawing well is not required - just being clever in selecting your hints. Each round, one person is the dealer. This player looks at their word, then shuffles the card into the cards for the other players and distributes them randomly. By doing this, one player will have the same word as the dealer, but nobody - not even the dealer - knows who it is.

schedule.title: The Monster You Know
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! a super fun silly game that turns the players into monsters! Every turn each player recieves a monstrous trait they have to act out and then all players answer a question about their monster and every player adds an additional monsterous trait to thier previous one and the players monsters become more complex and hillarious to act out!  Find out who is The Monster You Know!

schedule.title: The Palace of Mad King Ludwig
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! King Ludwig II of Bavaria has called all great architects to design his greatest achievement: A world-renowned palace. Only the best will do! Gorgeous appointments, white stone, surrounded by water, with swans everywhere. Oh, and the Ludwig touch? All the architects must design the palace together. The designer who shows the strongest influence will receive the order to build it. In The Palace of Mad King Ludwig, each player builds rooms one at a time in a single gigantic palace. As rooms are completed, a moat slowly forms around the outside. Once the ends of the moat connect, the palace is finished, and the player who has contributed the most to the palace wins!

schedule.title: The Strip
schedule.description: A worker placement game, set in the 60s/70s, in which you build a Casino while simultaneously working with the Mafia. Your goal as a Casino owner is to build the most successful and prestigious casino while collecting staff/VIP poker cards that allow you to win against your fellow casino owners.

schedule.title: Tiny Towns
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! You are the mayor of a tiny town in the forest in which the smaller creatures of the woods have created a civilization hidden away from predators. This new land is small and the resources are scarce, so you take what you can get and never say no to building materials. Cleverly plan and construct a thriving town, and don't let it fill up with wasted resources! Whoever builds the most prosperous tiny town wins!

schedule.title: GIANT Bananagrams
schedule.description: Speed Scrabble! Not exactly, but super fun if you like word games, especially with GIANT, OVERSIZED tiles! Great for family members of all ages. Build your own crossword puzzle, but don't get too attached to it, you may need to break it all apart and start again. Oh...and you are racing against everyone else. Good luck! Not easy to win, but a whole lot of tile fun!

schedule.title: First Contact
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! We have discovered a new intelligent life form. They don't understand us so they fear us. They launch missiles at things they fear. You've got to decrypt the Rosetta Stone word "Shknorkleblorp" so we can communicate our good intentions to them before they blow you to bits. Battlestations is a tabletop starship simulator – a multi-map board game that simultaneously features ship-action in space AND the events on board the ships involved in the conflicts. It is also a roleplaying game in which your characters grow throughout campaigns, picking up experience points, upgrades, and new abilities.

schedule.title: The DEXCON Crokinole Championship
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Mayday Games presents a new series of Championships with new tournament rules. Played on regulation-sized boards, players will engage in three preliminary rounds and those with the best scores will advance to the final rounds. Flick your tokens into the center of the board, try to knock out your opponents!

schedule.title: The 2019 Northeast Regional Wordsy Championship
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Wordsy is a streamlined re-implementation of Prolix, a word game from 2010. Each round, players study the 8 letters (always consonants) on the board in real time. The first player to write down a word flips a 30-second timer. That player is now the fastest player, and every other player now has 30 seconds to write down their word. The winner of this Championship will get a trophy, a seat in the first elimination round of the 2019 U.S. National Championship at Gen Con (August 1-4 in Indianapolis, Indiana), a FREE 4-day membership to Gen Con, and a FREE 3-night room share in Indianapolis for Gen Con!

schedule.title: Novice Tournament
schedule.description: Just learning Daemon Dice? Then get your tournament feet wet at our Novice event. Borrow a pre-constructed 2-player 13-point army from us, or bring your own.

schedule.title: The DEXCON 22 Artist Jam Session
schedule.description: Join many of our artist guests as we put them in front of a giant blank canvas and let them loose. Audience members can shout encouragement and ideas and watch a creation unfold in front of their eyes!

schedule.title: Game the Gamer (Co-Op)
schedule.description: Four teams of two compete in the most dastardly of video game competitions. At the start of the game each team member will be given 50 dealer's room dollars. Then all you have to do to keep the money is not come in last in the three mystery video games we will be playing. If you come in last you must return all your prize money. However before you play each game we will have an auction. Bidding with your own prize money you may buy sabotages to handicap your fellow contestants. Can you hang on to your money and survive playing with a broken controller while wearing beer goggles? Be a part of the fun before the Official YouTube launch.

schedule.title: Konflikt '47
schedule.description: As World War II continues beyond 1945, the battling countries have become even more desperate to develop new super weapons to give them a winning advantage. Exploiting new technologies revealed from the first nuclear explosions, the Axis and Allied forces quickly develop new tanks and strange armoured walkers to become the vanguard of their armies, supported by new highly equipped or terribly twisted troops. With the Soviet Union seceding from the Allies the war now becomes a three-way conflict!

schedule.title: Animal Upon Animal
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! The animals want to show how good they are at making tall pyramids! They must be skillfully careful: Who will position the penguin on top of the crocodile, the sheep on top of the penguin, the serpent on the sheep? The hedgehog wants to stand on top of the pyramid but the height is making him dizzy. This event will use SUPER SIZE pieces for a truly unique experience!

schedule.title: One Night Ultimate Werewolf
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! One Night Ultimate Werewolf is a fast game in which everyone gets a role: One of the dastardly Werewolves, the tricky Troublemaker, the helpful Seer, or one of a dozen different characters, each with a special ability. In the course of a single morning, your village will decide who is a werewolf...because all it takes is lynching one werewolf to win! This event will be played as several rounds, keeping score for each player (winning side or losing side). Each successive round will add more complex characters, which will also be incorporated from the Daybreak expansion.

schedule.title: Time's Up!
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A party game for teams of two or more players. The same set of famous names is used for each of three rounds. In each round, one member of a team tries to get his teammates to guess as many names as possible in 30 seconds. In round one, almost any kind of clue is allowed. In round two, no more than one word can be used in each clue (but unlimited sounds and gestures are permitted). In round three, no words are allowed at all.

schedule.title: TEAM3 - United States Debut!
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A DEXCON 22 EXCLUSIVE! Join us for the United States Debut of this new party game from Brain Games - the first ever convention play, featuring 24 players trying to outwit each other in teams of three. The object of the game is to build a 3D structure. One player is the architect, and sees the plan - but cannot speak. One player is the Builder, who must actually build the structure - but cannot see. One player is the Supervisor, who must somehow interpret the Architect's gestures and tell the Builder how to build the structure. Special prizes will be awarded for the winning teams. Spectators are welcome.

schedule.title: Battle of the 80s!
schedule.description: If you love the 1980s, then "Battle of the 80s!" is, like, totally the event for you! Get ready to compete in a series of four different interactive games that test your pop culture knowledge in music, TV, movies, and trends of the most rad decade ever. You'll be teamed up color-war style as you score your way through 80s-editions of Jukebox Bingo, Picture This, Flashback, and This/That - in a race to see which team reigns 80s supreme! (Be there - or be square!!) Spectators welcome!

schedule.title: Poker 201
schedule.description: You know how to play, you know about trying to bluff, but do you understand the numbers that the pros think about? This session will help you to understand position, odds, pot odds, and forcing action. We will play some open hands, describing the different aspects of the game, then play a quick tournament to apply what we learned.

schedule.title: OBLIVION 2019: Man vs. Machine
schedule.description: A DEXCON 22 EXCLUSIVE! This gigantic mega-battle will consist of the entire ARENA combined with a simultaneous Battlefleet Gothic ship combat. "Help us, we have awakened the spirit in all of them and they have turned on us! They must be stopped before the spirit spreads! They're constructing ships... No! No! AGGGH..." This was the last distress call transmission from the Forge World of Accatran. Several patrol ships were dispatched but once they entered the system all contact was lost. Accatran is the Adeptus Mechanicus' primary research facility for finding weaknesses in alien technology through study of captured equipment, tanks and titans. Accatran is also a center of Khamrians, machine spirit, research and how to affect the machine spirits of alien machines. We are sending a fleet to investigate but our sensors show other races are sending forces to investigate also. You must determine the nature of the emergency and contain it for the betterment of the Imperium. Bring armies of any race or use our miniatures, and take part in one of the largest battles in the history of wargaming!

schedule.title: City Hall
schedule.description: Players activate various offices in City Hall and then bid influence against those offices to control how they affect the city's development. Players must choose wisely when to accept an opponent's bid, trading the ability to do something now for the ability to do something bigger later.

schedule.title: Vikings Gone Wild
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Each turn in Vikings Gone Wild - a deck-building, resource management game based on the online real-time strategy game - players can either buy permanent buildings sitting in front of them (resource factories, resources containers, etc) or buy units, towers and special cards that improve their deck and offense/defense capacity. The only way to win is by successfully attacking each other, and each attack involves interesting bluffing mechanisms in which the attacker doesn't know the defense capacity of their opponent...

schedule.title: The 2019 Northeast Regional New York Slice Championship
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Each player slices pizzas into portions, giving their opponents first choice, while they take the leftovers. There are a dozen kinds of pizza to work with, from veggie to hawaiian to meat lover's, and each player decides if they want to eat or keep some of the slices, building the best collection of pizzas possible! The winner of this Championship will get a trophy, a seat in the first elimination round of the 2019 U.S. National Championship at Gen Con (August 1-4 in Indianapolis, Indiana), a FREE 4-day membership to Gen Con, and a FREE 3-night room share in Indianapolis for Gen Con!

schedule.title: The 2019 U.S. National Dragon Dice Championship
schedule.description: The 13th U.S. National Dragon Dice Championship comes to DEXCON 22! All legal dice may be used in this event. Players bring a 36-health constructed army. All  dice found in the rules may be used. 4.0 rules as found on the SFR, Inc. web site. Players may play in any or all of the five preliminary sessions, but may only qualify once. The winners at each table will advance to the final round to play for the U.S. National Championship title and a trophy!

schedule.title: Alien Artifacts
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A 4X-style card game in which you play as an interplanetary faction, sending your research vessels into uncharted space to expand your knowledge and power. Build powerful ships, develop new technologies, and explore distant planets for anything - or anyone - you can exploit. With over two hundred cards, Alien Artifacts offers players many scoring strategies and great replay-ability.

schedule.title: Arkham Horror
schedule.description: The town of Arkham, Massachusetts is in a panic. Horrific and bizarre events have begun to occur with increasing frequency - all seeming to point towards some cataclysmic event in the near future that may spell disaster for everyone. Only one small band of investigators can save Arkham from the Great Old Ones and destruction! Arkham Horror was originally published by Chaosium, Inc. two decades ago.

schedule.title: AuZtralia
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! An adventure/exploration game set in an alternate reality 1930s. The theme is inspired by Martin Wallace's A Study in Emerald. Following the Restorationist war, the northern hemisphere lands lay poisoned and starvation was the norm. Intrepid adventurers set out to explore and settle new lands. Little did they know, after the war, the surviving Old Ones and their remaining loyal human armies made their way to the outback of Australia to lick their wounds. Build a port, construct railways, mine and farm for food. You'll need to prepare for the awakening. You'll need to fight.

schedule.title: Brick Thunder Road
schedule.description: A Lego version of the Milton Bradley game Thunder Road. The game is played on two 6ft long tables. It is a rolling road game with the tables on casters so that they can be swapped to create a continuous road. Thunder Road is a last man standing, Ram, Wreck, Survival game.

schedule.title: Dice City
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A "dice-crafting" game in which the locations in your city act as the changing faces of your dice each turn. Use tactics and strategy to press your claim! You each have several ways to promote your city; create strong armies; construct wondrous buildings; or open up trade routes. The secret is to manage your city and its natural resources carefully to make the best of your fortunes.

schedule.title: Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Welcome to Fireball Island! You may have heard stories. You may have visited when you were younger. Perhaps you even saw a fireball engulf a fellow traveler in a hellscape of horror that makes you afraid to close your eyes at night. Whatever the case, welcome back! Turns out that Vul-Kar didn't like having his gem stolen way back when, so there has been some volcanic upheaval, an explosion in our snake population, feral tigers, new types of trees bent on ending human life, and swarms of bees everywhere. But don't worry - we have top people working on it.

schedule.title: Gerrymandering
schedule.description: All things being equal this town could go to you or your political opponent. But all things aren't equal, and you're going to make sure the odds are in your favor. Change political boundaries, campaign throughout precincts and encourage demographic shifts to ensure that your party stays in power. A tile and board manipulation game for two players.

schedule.title: Groo: The Game
schedule.description: From the longest running Marvel/Epic comic comes everyone's favorite bungling barbarian, GROO! This game is just like the book - Groo means bad news! Players try to keep Groo away from their town as they build their community and recruit an army. Unfortunately, Groo can always find a way to diminish any player's hope of winning. This fast-paced game of "Hot Potato" will amuse everyone who stands in Groo's way!

schedule.title: Kokoro: Avenue of the Kodama
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! An exciting family game that can be played with up to eight players! Each player has a forest map to draw their paths and turns are simultaneous so the game plays quickly. Connecting your sanctuaries to offerings will gain you favor. Choose wisely because you never know exactly when the sanctuary will score. And you shouldn't be too greedy, if a sanctuary is not connected to more offerings than your previous sanctuary, you lose points!

schedule.title: Land and Freedom!
schedule.description: A semi-cooperative war and politics game set in the Spanish Civil War and Revolution of 1936-39. Moderates, Communists, and Anarchists must defend the Republic, while Monarchists and Fascists attempt to install a Nationalist dictatorship, but who will dictate? Each faction must work with their coalition partners to win the war, while also working to pursue their own political or revolutionary ends. Nazi Germany, Fascist Italy, the Soviet Union, and others are flooding Spain with arms to direct the course of the war. And who knows what historical events will occur, from the first African American military commander to a dictator-to-be dying by plane crash because he packed too much luggage!

schedule.title: Leaders of Euphoria
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A social deduction game in the style of Good Cop Bad Cop, but set in the world of Euphoria. It takes place earlier in the timeline than Euphoria, when the city was young and foolish. Players will have 3 cards in front of them that determine whether they are on the Euphorian or Subterran team that will be investigated throughout the game to figure out who's on their team and who's not.

schedule.title: Near and Far
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! You and up to three friends explore many different maps in a search for the Last Ruin, recruiting adventurers, hunting for treasure, and competing to be the most storied traveler. You must collect food and equipment at town for long journeys to mysterious locales, making sure not to forget enough weapons to fight off bandits, living statues, and rusty robots! Sometimes in your travels you'll run into something unique and one of your friends will read what happens to you from a book of stories, giving you a choice of how to react, creating a new and memorable tale each time you play.

schedule.title: Of Dreams and Shadows
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A cooperative board game for up to six players who take on the role of Champions trying to save their realm. Set in a dark fantasy world, the players will journey from the underworld ruins of a long-dead people to the heart of untamed forests where otherworldly creatures dwell. As they direct the actions of their Champions on the game board, the players will participate in a collaborative story. Scenarios introduce encounters and conflict, which are resolved through passing a test or making a choice. The consequences advance the storyline and drive a unique experience as part of the story changes based on each outcome.

schedule.title: Pyramid of Pengqueen
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A game with asymmetrical goals. While one player as the Mummy tries to catch tomb raiders, the other players try to secure as many treasures as possible from the Pyramid. The game is played with magnetic playing pieces on two sides of a vertical board, so the Mummy player cannot see the pieces of the tomb raiders. As the Mummy piece consists of two parts (one on each side of the board) the tomb raiders on the other hand know the movements of the Mummy.

schedule.title: Saboteur: The Lost Mines
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players take on the role of dwarves. As miners, they are in a mine, hunting for gold. Suddenly, a pick axe swings down and shatters the mine lamp. The saboteur has struck. But which of the players are saboteurs? Will you find the gold, or will the fiendish actions of the saboteurs lead them to it first? After three rounds, the player with the most gold is the winner.

schedule.title: Sagrada
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Each player builds a stained glass window by building up a grid of dice on their player board. Each board has some restrictions on which color or shade (value) of die can be placed there. Dice of the same shade or color may never be placed next to each other. Dice are drafted in player order, with the start player rotating each round, snaking back around after the last player drafts two dice. Scoring is variable per game based on achieving various patterns and varieties of placement...as well as bonus points for dark shades of a particular hidden goal color.

schedule.title: Simon's Cat: The Card Game
schedule.description: The fast-paced Simon's Cat: The Card Game features adorable art taken directly from animator and illustrator Simon Tofield's YouTube series, Simon's Cat, which has hundreds of millions of views. In the game, players go around the table playing cards to escape Simon's attention. Get caught and you get Blame; get too much Blame and you get fed last. No one wants that.

schedule.title: The Table is Lava
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players are presented with a simple challenge: Toss cards onto the table to save your meeples, while trying to knock other players' pieces into the lava at the same time. Have the most survivors, and you win!

schedule.title: Ticket to Ride
schedule.description: With elegantly simple gameplay, Ticket to Ride can be learned in 3 minutes, while providing players with intense strategic and tactical decisions every turn. Players collect cards of various types of train cars they then use to claim railway routes in North America. The longer the routes, the more points they earn. Additional points come to those who fulfill Destination Tickets - goal cards that connect distant cities; and to the player who builds the longest continuous route.

schedule.title: Tiny Epic Mechs
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players take on the roles of highly skilled and athletic Mech pilots. They compete in a free-for-all battle royale over the span of six rounds. In each round, players select four of eight available actions to program. These actions keep you moving around the arena while allowing you to deploy high-scoring defensive turrets, plant explosive land mines with hidden values, collect resources, purchase weaponry, and power up into your Power Armor or eventually the highly-sought-after Mech Suit. While each player has their own Power Armor, there is only one Mech Suit, reserved for the king of the hill.

schedule.title: Ultimate Werewolf
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Your quiet little 16th century village has suddenly become infested with some very unfriendly werewolves...can you and the other villagers find them before they devour everyone? Each player has an agenda: as a villager, hunt down the werewolves; as a werewolf, convince the other villagers that you're innocent, while secretly dining on those same villagers each night. Dozens of special roles are available to help both the villagers and the werewolves achieve their goals while thwarting their opponents.

schedule.title: Villainous
schedule.description: Each player takes control of one of six Disney characters, each one a villain in a different Disney movie. Each player has their own villain deck, fate deck, player board, and 3D character. On a turn, the active player moves their character to a different location on their player board, takes one or more of the actions visible on that space (often by playing cards from their hand), then refills their hand to four cards. Cards are allies, items, effects, conditions, and (for some characters) curses. You need to use your cards to fulfill your unique win condition.

schedule.title: Wanted: Rich or Dead
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players will take on a roles of an infamous Old West characters and shoot their way to the riches. Each turn the players are secretly choosing one of the five locations they’re heading to. After revealing the cards, the characters can use the special ability connected with that location – you can rob a Bank, buy something useful at a General Store etc. Unless of course two or more players choose the same spot – then it comes to a shootout with only one gunslinger winning at the end. The player who have the most money at the end, wins the game.

schedule.title: Word Slam
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Two teams compete against one another simultaneously. In each round, one player on each team tries to get their teammates to guess a hidden word or phrase using only the 105 explanatory cards available in the box. Speaking and acting is absolutely forbidden for the storytellers! They must tell their stories using only 105 cards, each with one word on it: a noun, verb, adjective, or preposition. A player can use as many explanatory cards as desired, and whichever team guesses correctly first scores a point. The team with the most points at the end of the game wins!

schedule.title: Zero Day War
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A game where players take the role of hackers from four different planets intent on taking advantage of the Sysnet security malfunction and stealing every file they can before the security protocols re-engage! Use your best exploits to aquire files and cause havoc for the other Hackers in the SysNet. Zero Day War sports a unique countdown mechanic that is used to activate all exploits simultaneously at the end of each Cycle. The Hacker with the most points wins! The system is yours for the taking… The Zero Day War has begun.

schedule.title: The Bottle Imp
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! The object of the game is to be the player holding the Bottled Imp Card at the end of the game's allotted 8 rounds. Each player begins the game with 5 cards in their hand. One of the players (nobody else knows who) has the Bottled Imp card.

schedule.title: The Red Dragon Inn
schedule.description: The adventure is over, but the party is just beginning! Choose from 20 different zany characters as you drink, brawl, and gamble, and try to be the last one standing. Will you be Fiona the Volatile? Or Pooky, the rabbit familiar who is seriously crazy...seriously. What about Wizgille, the Gnome Artificer? Or Gog...just Gog. This will be run using the Sea Event Deck from RDI4, but not the "Gambling? I'm in!" expansion. Beginners more than welcome, all rules will be taught before the game starts.

schedule.title: Artist Alley Codenames
schedule.description: The game of Codenames from CGE. In this adapted game, artists and attendees draw quick pictures in lieu of giving clues.

schedule.title: Beat the Mob!
schedule.description: A DEXCON 22 EXCLUSIVE! Join the ninth annual test of cerebral fitness put on by the Game Show Bro's. In each of several rounds, one person, picked at random from the audience, will be pitted head-to-head in a battle for general knowledge supremacy, against the rest of the Mob! The longer it goes, the more the player earns. And if the player blows it? The Mob splits the money! Oh yes... There are big time dealer dollar sprees available. The game is a version of the classic game show "1 Vs. 100", modified to be the ultimate convention trivia experience!

schedule.title: Star Wars: Legion
schedule.description: Star Wars: Legion invites you to join the unsung battles of the Galactic Civil War as the commander of a unique army filled with troopers, powerful ground or repulsor vehicles, and iconic characters like Darth Vader or Luke Skywalker. The Rebels have a spy at a Space Port that has information on a secret project the Empire is working on. You must find this spy and get him off the base before the Imperials get to him.

schedule.title: Warhammer Quest
schedule.description: A Dungeon Crawl Miniatures/Board Game where players take on roles such as Barbarian, Dwarf, Elf and fight monsters in a dungeon to achieve a goal. The monsters, dungeon, treasure and goal are all generated randomly by card draw as you play, so the game is different each time. Will you survive, and gain wealth and glory?

schedule.title: Strike at the Heart
schedule.description: On September 23, House Davion launched the second wave of Operation Rat by targeting nme worlds: Tsitsang, Ningpo, Hunan, Genoa. Zurich. Alrescha, New Canton, Buchlau and Tikonov. The primary focus of the second wave was the planet of Tikonov for four reasons: It was the capital of the Tikonov Commonality; it was a vital economic center of the Confederation; it was a heavily fortified world that could harbor many 'Mech regiments for a dangerous counterattack deep into the Federated Suns; and it was the base for Colonel Pavel Ridzik, commander and driving force of the Capellan military. The  AFFS High Command believed that killing the colonel and thus depriving the Capellan military of its best commanding officer would significantly reduce the morale and effectiveness of the remaining Capellan forces.

schedule.title: Island Towers of the Terror Folk
schedule.description: Journey to the towering jungle-covered islands of the Terror Folk in search of lost treasure. Who are the mysterious Terror Folk? Not the human tribesmen, and not the snake people, and not the explorers from far away: They have all come in search of something special, hidden high atop the mountainous jungle-covered Islands of the Ghost Archipelago. It will take a while to climb so high: if only you could fly...

schedule.title: AFFLICTION: Salem 1692
schedule.description: The hysteria over witches among the people of Salem swept the region like a disease in 1692. As is the case in any tragic event, there are those whom will use the circumstances to their advantage. Under the veil of the witch-hunt lie other motivations; power, greed, revenge and righteousness. Use your influence to whisper in the ear of the magistrate, Judge, Governor, or Minister to protect some and have others arrested. Will you protect your friends, accuse your enemies, generate fear, or use spectral evidence to weaken even the strongest in Salem?

schedule.title: Bosk
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A brand new release from Floodgate Games! From majestic Maples to ancestral Oaks, players nurture their trees aiming to thrive over the course of a year in a beautiful National Park. In the spring, players carefully grow their trees, scoring as hikers enjoy traveling the trails in summer. When autumn comes, leaves fall in the ever-changing direction of the wind, guided to cover the terrain and other players’ leaves. Points are awarded in winter for the most coverage of each region in the park. Gain your ground in the park to be victorious in Bosk!

schedule.title: Brick Thunder Road
schedule.description: A Lego version of the Milton Bradley game Thunder Road. The game is played on two 6ft long tables. It is a rolling road game with the tables on casters so that they can be swapped to create a continuous road. Thunder Road is a last man standing, Ram, Wreck, Survival game.

schedule.title: Captain Sonar
schedule.description: The year is 2048. You are part of a team of elite officers in command of a state-of-the-art submarine. The hunt has begun. Your mission is simple: Seek and destroy the enemy submarine. To beat the enemy, you must cooperate with your teammates. Only the team who best communicates and works together will survive the encounter. For ease of teaching new players, we'll be playing in "turn-based" mode.

schedule.title: Dead Panic
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! In Dead Panic, each player takes on the role of one of eight unique characters, which have special abilities. Players work together to survive in a remote cabin, at the center of the board, against waves of the undead that close in from the edges of the board. If the players can hold out, survivors bring pieces of the radio needed to call for rescue. Once rescue arrives, it's up to each player to leave the safety of the cabin and make it out alive!

schedule.title: Fano
schedule.description: An abstract strategy combat card game with a unique rock-paper-scissors attack system and a minor engine builder mechanic.

schedule.title: Garbage Day
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players take turns stacking garbage cards one at a time onto the overflowing garbage can, or stashing garbage cards in their rooms. But once a player's room gets too full, they must clean it by stacking all the cards from that room on top of the garbage can, very carefully, one by one. If garbage cards fall off the garbage can during your turn, place them in your overflow pile. If your overflow pile gets too big, you're eliminated from the game. If all other players have been eliminated, you win!

schedule.title: Ion: A Compund Building Game
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A card drafting game where players select from a number of available Ion Cards and Noble Gas cards with the goal of creating sets of compounds and inert noble gases. Players score points based upon the quantity and type of neutrally balanced compounds they construct and noble gas sets they collect. After three rounds, players add their total scores from each round, subtract points from Action Tiles used, and the player with the most points wins!

schedule.title: Karuba
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! This is a tile-laying race game with players starting with boards that are identical, and one player drawing tiles that they all will use. They race to get their explorers to temples first and earn points. Along the way they can collect additional points by collecting items off the paths they create.

schedule.title: Kodama: The Tree Spirits
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! From the designer of the hit game Kigi, Kodama: The Tree Spirits branches out into a fun new way to play! Grow your tree by placing cards in clever arrangements, being careful to leave room for future growth. At the end of each season, one Kodama will award you points for how well your tree suits its needs. With beautiful art and innovative mechanics, Kodama is an inTREEguing game for the whole family.

schedule.title: Munchkin Booty
schedule.description: Sail the Seven Seas. Plunder the treasure. Make your crew walk the plank. Munchkin Booty brings the greatest gold-grabbers in history – pirates! – to the world of Munchkin. Use your Silver Long Johns to beat the Lobster Mobster, drink your Demon Rum to fight off the Viking Kittens, and defend yourself with the Cutlass (or Cutlad, for the gents) against the Prince of Whales. But watch out for Sharks!

schedule.title: New World Magischola: House Rivalry
schedule.description: Experience going to magical college by enrolling in courses, studying, surviving magical mishaps and sabotage by fellow players. Be the first to pass all your courses and collect the most house points and you take the trophy! Features strategy, surprises, chance, and magic as you choose your major, follow extra-curricular activities, and earn (or lose) house points for your efforts. Every player has a character, a House, and a magical pet.

schedule.title: Orphanage of Fear
schedule.description: Abandoned and unwanted with the dust bowl blotting out the sun and any hope, children have begun to disappear. The players take the role of either orphans or the boogeymen hiding among them. But the children are not entirely without help. The few toys of the orphanage, passed around and shared by the caretaker, can grant respite and reprieve to any who have them. But that doesn't stop the boogeymen from getting them either...

schedule.title: Palaces
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A deck-building bidding game in which you win cards and build towers. On a turn, the active player chooses to draw from one of three stacks of cards, then all players bid or drop out. There is only one round of bidding per card. Bids are valued based on the size of a suit (e.g., three-of-a-kind beats two-of-a-kind, etc.), and if the size matches, you compare suits: Gold, Silver, Crystal, Marble. If size and suit match, compare a secondary bid (3 gold and 2 marble beats 3 gold and a silver).

schedule.title: Pirate Tricks
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! The Landor Syndicate, a pirate alliance in an area of space controlled by the Lunar Orion Order, needs a new leader. The outgoing Supreme Admiral is looking for his replacement. Players take on the role of rival captains recruiting crews, capturing rival pirates, and collecting treasure. Pirate Tricks is a trick-taking game with a unique scoring system. The game is played over three hands. Each hand has different scoring goals. Once the scoring cards are revealed, the players are dealt five cards. Then players each bid on another 7 cards to complete their hands.

schedule.title: Port Royal
schedule.description: The merchant players in this card drafting game, which won the Austrian Game Designers Competition under the title Handler der Karibik, are trying to earn as much as they can out of the Caribbean Sea, but if they set their goals too high, they might take home nothing for the day.

schedule.title: Rampaging Jotunn Saga
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Return to the unnamed island with every expansion for Rampaging Jotunn. Face the Frost Jotunn and 4 armies in the Winter War, sacrifice to fickle Old Gods in Seasons of Sacrifice and face the unforgiving Fire Jotunn! This is your chance to play the entire Saga!

schedule.title: So What's The Scenario?
schedule.description: A Hip-Hop based card game. Players take turns drawing from the white deck. If a Scenario Card is drawn, the scenario is read aloud and everyone else answers with their most appropriate artist. The white deck also contains Diss Cards. When Diss Cards are played, one player challenges another player to a battle. Using dice that have categories like Flow, Delivery and Bars, players pick their best artist and roll the dice for 3 rounds. Each artist has a score that corresponds with the categories - the best scores out of 3 rounds wins the battle, and of course bragging rights. SWaTS is just the right amount of randomness, personal opinion, trash-talk, strategy, debate and music discovery.

schedule.title: Space Base
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Players assume the roles of Commodores of a small fleet of ships. Ships begin docked at their stations and are then deployed to sectors as new ships are commissioned under your command. Use cargo vessels to engage in trade and commerce; mining vessels to build reoccurring base income; and carriers to spread your influence. Establish new colonies for a new Commodore in a sector to gain even more influence. Gain enough influence and you can be promoted to Admiral!

schedule.title: Splendor
schedule.description: A fast-paced and addictive game of chip-collecting and card development. Players are merchants of the Renaissance trying to buy gem mines, means of transportation, shops — all in order to acquire the most prestige points. If you're wealthy enough, you might even receive a visit from a noble at some point, which of course will further increase your prestige. In order to win the game, you must reach 15 prestige points before your opponents do.

schedule.title: Survive: Escape from Atlantis!
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! An underwater volcano has erupted and the mythical island of Atlantis is sinking! Every turn, another piece of the island sinks into the sea! Each player is in a race against time to move their Atlantean "people" to the safety of the nearby islands. But the path to safety is dangerous. Sea serpents and sharks attack your people! Whales surface and capsize your boats! Rescue as many people as you can before the game ends.

schedule.title: Telestrations
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Each player begins by sketching a Telestrations word dictated by the roll of a die. The old fashioned sand timer may limit the amount of time they get to execute their sketch, but it certainly doesn't limit creativity! Time's up! All players, all at the same time, pass their sketch to the next player, who must guess what's been drawn. Players then simultaneously pass their guess - which hopefully matches the original word (or does it??) - to the next player who must try to draw the word they see - and so on.

schedule.title: The Scarlet Pimpernel
schedule.description: The year is 1793. France cowers under the Reign of Terror, and not even the innocent are safe from the Committee of Public Safety and their precious guillotine. In the midst of this turmoil, one man uses courage and cunning to fight the brutality: The Scarlet Pimpernel. Along with his League of followers, The Scarlet Pimpernel rescues the innocent from under the very noses of the Committee, leaving behind only a card showing a small pimpernel flower. The man behind the rescues, Englishman Sir Percy Blakeney, must keep his identity a secret from all but his closest associates. In The Scarlet Pimpernel, you play as members of the league helping the Scarlet Pimpernel accomplish seven missions, rescuing the innocent from the guillotine. No mission will be as important as the last, for you save the young Dauphin, heir to the French throne, by whisking him away to Vienna.

schedule.title: Ultimate Werewolf
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Your quiet little 16th century village has suddenly become infested with some very unfriendly werewolves...can you and the other villagers find them before they devour everyone? Each player has an agenda: as a villager, hunt down the werewolves; as a werewolf, convince the other villagers that you're innocent, while secretly dining on those same villagers each night. Dozens of special roles are available to help both the villagers and the werewolves achieve their goals while thwarting their opponents.

schedule.title: Yahtzee
schedule.description: Hasbro's classic game of dice rolling for points. Uses unique sophisticated random probability elements consisting of varying amount of pips. Next generation from normal coin flipping, with three times as many results. Made of all-new medium-impact, high contrast materials. Really. Why are you reading this, anyway?

schedule.title: The 2019 Northeast Regional Pyramid Poker Championship
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Each player takes fifteen blocks and turns the blocks so that only they see what's on them. They take turns placing the blocks into a two-dimensional pyramid-shaped structure, again seeing only their blocks, then they take turns removing any one block from the pyramid and placing it into one of three poker hands that they're constructing. Each poker hand is competing against the one opposite it that's being built by the opponent. Once all the blocks have been removed, the player who wins two or three of the poker hands wins! The winner of this Championship will get a trophy, a seat in the first elimination round of the 2019 U.S. National Championship at Gen Con (August 1-4 in Indianapolis, Indiana), a FREE 4-day membership to Gen Con, and a FREE 3-night room share in Indianapolis for Gen Con!

schedule.title: The DEXCON 22 $100 Jigsaw Puzzle Championship
schedule.description: Another Double Exposure tradition! Players can play in any or all of the three speed qualifier sessions. Whoever can put their puzzle together the fastest will advance to the final session for a Trophy 'saw-off' - AND a $100 shopping spree in the DEXCON 22 Dealers' Room!

schedule.title: Dominion
schedule.description: In this popular Rio Grande game, each player starts with an identical, very small deck of cards. In the center of the table is a selection of other cards the players can "buy" as they can afford them. Through their selection of cards to buy, and how they play their hands as they draw them, the players construct their deck on the fly, striving for the most efficient path to the precious victory points by game end. Dominion is not a CCG, but the play of the game is similar to the construction and play of a CCG deck. We might be using the expansion sets, as players want.

schedule.title: First Martians: Adventures on the Red Planet
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Built on the core of the award-winning Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island, First Martians: Adventures on the Red Planet pits players against the hostile Martian environment and a whole host of new adventures and challenges. The immersion experience is further enhanced with an integrated app that maintains the balance and challenge throughout. Players have the option of taking on the design as a series of separate games, in a custom campaign mode in which each successive game builds on the last.

schedule.title: Jenga
schedule.description: Do you have a steady hand? Test your skill as you balance the wooden blocks and stack up the stories. Don't let the tower fall!

schedule.title: Tanto Cuore
schedule.description: A fun, silly deck-building card game where you endeavor to employ the most maids at your estate. Every maid you hire has special abilities and victory points that give you new opportunities to grow your staff and estate more. But treat them well, or they may get sick, develop bad habits, or quit and head back to town!

schedule.title: Telestrations After Dark
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! This is an adult version of the award winning Telestrations. Gameplay is the same, but the word content has changed to more adult fare. Some of the word cards now include stuff such as "Anaconda", "Jackhammer", "Doggie Style", and "Human Centipede".

schedule.title: The Binding of Isaac: Four Souls
schedule.description: The official Binding of Isaac multiplayer card game, about sacrifice, betrayal and hoarding. Players take turns playing loot cards and using items to kill monsters that yield more items, loot, and sometimes souls. The first player to end their turn with 4 souls is the winner. Cooperation, barter, and betrayal is encouraged.

schedule.title: Ultimate Werewolf
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Your quiet little 16th century village has suddenly become infested with some very unfriendly werewolves...can you and the other villagers find them before they devour everyone? Each player has an agenda: as a villager, hunt down the werewolves; as a werewolf, convince the other villagers that you're innocent, while secretly dining on those same villagers each night. Dozens of special roles are available to help both the villagers and the werewolves achieve their goals while thwarting their opponents.

schedule.title: We Rate Dogs!: The Card Game
schedule.description: A fun, relatively light family card game licensed from and based on the popular WeRateDogs Twitter account, with adorable dog pictures and hilarious commentary from WeRateDogs creator Matt Nelson! Players draft dogs into their kennels and then put them up for competition based on their "stats" like Floof, Sass, and Ears. Remember, they're all good dogs, Brent, so everybody's stats are at least 10/10 and go up from there (except for the dreaded Your Dog Is Actually A Baby Hippo In Disguise card!).

schedule.title: We're Doomed!
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! The world is coming to an end! We must act now to survive!!! Players are the most powerful leaders in the world working alongside up to nine others to build a starship. Time is short! The goal? Build and be on a starship that escapes a dying world - or betray everyone to ensure your own survival. No seats on the starship are guaranteed. We're Doomed! is a quick, timed, panic-inducing game of international collaboration, retaliation, diplomacy, conspiracy, and blowing each other up for fun!

schedule.title: Cutthroat Uno
schedule.description: International Games' popular game of fast decision making, played in its killer variety. Much more fast paced, and much more sniping at your opponents.

schedule.title: +2 Comedy Con-Quest
schedule.description: An 8 player tournament looking for the Geekiest mind out there. Not just knowledge, but gaming skill and debating. Each round features a debate round and a skill round, where you can flex your nerd knowledge in gaming, movies, comics and TV. Who will be the greatest geek? Come Geek Out! Members of the tournament will be chosen from the audience. Even if you aren't in the tournament, come and enjoy watching, cheering and laughing!

schedule.title: Space Hulk
schedule.description: Double Exposure continues a tradition with Space Hulk battles throughout the convention! Play with your favorite squad (special rules regarding various races will be available onsite) or use our pre-made squads and GET THOSE BUGS! All rules will be taught to beginners in this very easy-to-learn game of futuristic spaceship exploration.

schedule.title: Assault the Space Station
schedule.description: A rogue branch of the Federation has been discovered by enemy forces. They have amassed an armada to take out the station. It is your job to ensure the secrets of the Federation do not land in enemy hands. This will be played on the incredible 50' x 20' ARENA with models and toys as well as custom made ships in a 1:2500 MACRO scale. The fleets will be pre-set and players showing up in uniform will gain a bonus for their fleet.

schedule.title: Bosk
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A brand new release from Floodgate Games! From majestic Maples to ancestral Oaks, players nurture their trees aiming to thrive over the course of a year in a beautiful National Park. In the spring, players carefully grow their trees, scoring as hikers enjoy traveling the trails in summer. When autumn comes, leaves fall in the ever-changing direction of the wind, guided to cover the terrain and other players’ leaves. Points are awarded in winter for the most coverage of each region in the park. Gain your ground in the park to be victorious in Bosk!

schedule.title: Dino World
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! An archaeopteryx jumps through the thick ferns. But what the little primitive bird doesn't know, is a velociraptor has already spotted him. But even this agile hunter isn't sure when the big T-rex, who all the dinosaurs fear, will come! The player, who manages to push the dinosaur playing cards from the box so that they land on the most dinosaurs captures the most prey. Players need to aim well and push their cards skillfully. An exciting prehistoric hunt.

schedule.title: Echidna Shuffle
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Echidnas pick up bugs and deliver them to their home stumps in the family-friendly game Echidna Shuffle. In more detail, players move the twelve echidnas from leaf to leaf, picking up bugs in their color from their pick-up leaf, and moving them to the three matching-colored stumps. But the forest floor is a traffic jam of echidnas that have to be moved out of the way before you can get there. The first player to deliver all three bugs wins.

schedule.title: Epic Card Game
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! You take on the role of an elder god, in conflict with other elder gods. The cards in your deck are your champions, who fight for you, and events, which represent your will imposed on the mortal realm. In Epic, the turn sequence is easy but there are many options to choose from. You begin the game with a hand of five cards - each card costs either one gold or is free. You get one gold each turn - you don’t need to draw special resource cards or energy cards just to play with your other cards. Instead of figuring out which cards you might be allowed to play, you choose which card you want to play.

schedule.title: Gem Blenders: The Card Game
schedule.description: A LCG-styled, strategy card game that's easy to learn and difficult to master. Face off against your opponents in organizing a team of heroes that has the special ability to harness the energies within gems and use transformations called blends.

schedule.title: Hearts
schedule.description: The classic family game of avoiding hearts - or collecting them all! Rules strictly by Hoyle's Rules of Games, Third Revised and Updated Edition; no house variations allowed.

schedule.title: Land and Freedom!
schedule.description: A semi-cooperative war and politics game set in the Spanish Civil War and Revolution of 1936-39. Moderates, Communists, and Anarchists must defend the Republic, while Monarchists and Fascists attempt to install a Nationalist dictatorship, but who will dictate? Each faction must work with their coalition partners to win the war, while also working to pursue their own political or revolutionary ends. Nazi Germany, Fascist Italy, the Soviet Union, and others are flooding Spain with arms to direct the course of the war. And who knows what historical events will occur, from the first African American military commander to a dictator-to-be dying by plane crash because he packed too much luggage!

schedule.title: Lego Heroica: Twilight Parish
schedule.description: A one-of-a-kind cooperative dungeon crawl adventure made entirely from LEGO pieces. It's based on a simplistic game that LEGO released (called Heroica), but this version is completely custom and much more involved. The game does not involve building, as everything is pre-constructed, but the LEGO medium allows for a fully 3D game world with multiple layers and moving parts. Don't be fooled into thinking it's just for kids! No prior experience is expected or required, and the game is easily learned as it is played. The Twilight Parish scenario is a stand-alone adventure that has players investigating a graveyard and church to find the cause of a zombie outbreak.

schedule.title: Love Letter
schedule.description: Love Letter is a game of risk, deduction, and luck. Your goal is to get your love letter into Princess Annette's hands while deflecting the letters from competing suitors. From a deck with only sixteen cards, each player starts with only one card in hand; one card is removed from play. On a turn, you draw one card, and play one card, trying to expose others and knock them from the game. Powerful cards lead to early gains, but make you a target. Rely on weaker cards for too long, however, and your letter may be tossed in the fire!

schedule.title: Match Madness
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Be the fastest to recreate with your blocks the pattern shown on a card to win the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner. Note that this game is color-blind friendly.

schedule.title: Munchkin Warhammer 40,000
schedule.description: Become an Ultramarine, Necron, Aeldari, Ork, Death Guard, or Tyranid. Make a Pilgrimage to Holy Terra, use your Lasblaster, and of course you need More Dakka! Be vigilant; you might encounter the Sloppity Bilepiper, a Horror of Tzeentch, or even Mortarion himself!

schedule.title: Roll for the Galaxy
schedule.description: Roll for the Galaxy is a dice game of building space empires. Your dice represent your populace, whom you direct to develop new technologies, settle worlds, and ship goods. The player who best manages his workers and builds the most prosperous empire wins!

schedule.title: Spirit Island
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A complex and thematic cooperative game about defending your island home from colonizing Invaders. Players are different spirits of the land, each with its own unique elemental powers. Every turn, players simultaneously choose which of their power cards to play, paying energy to do so. Using combinations of power cards that match a spirit's elemental affinities can grant free bonus effects. Faster powers take effect immediately, before the Invaders spread and ravage, but other magics are slower, requiring forethought and planning to use effectively. In the Spirit phase, spirits gain energy, and choose how / whether to Grow: To reclaim used power cards, to seek for new power, or to spread presence into new areas of the island.

schedule.title: Stellar Siege
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Deploy aliens, conquer planets, and out-smart your enemy in this showdown of stellar proportions! In Stellar Siege, play as one of two alien races vying for control of eight planets in a distant solar system. Each turn, you will deploy an alien to the planet whose number corresponds to the number of cards in your hand. Deploying an alien will allow you to manipulate the number of cards in your own hand or your opponent's hand. In order to conquer the most planets and win the game, you will need to balance manipulating your own hand size and your opponent’s hand size controlling where they will deploy on their next turn. The player who can do this will rule the solar system!

schedule.title: Stone Age
schedule.description: You guide your clan as it tries to survive and prosper in the uncertain times of the late Stone Age. Hunt, gather resources, learn to farm and use tools, and discover the rudiments of civilization. (From the creator of St. Petersburg.)

schedule.title: Terraforming Mars
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! In the 2400s, mankind begins to terraform the planet Mars. Giant corporations, sponsored by the World Government on Earth, initiate huge projects to raise the temperature, the oxygen level, and the ocean coverage until the environment is habitable. In Terraforming Mars, you play one of those corporations and work together in the terraforming process, but compete for getting victory points that are awarded not only for your contribution to the terraforming, but also for advancing human infrastructure throughout the solar system, and doing other commendable things.

schedule.title: Thanos Rising: Avengers Infinity War
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! A cooperative dice and card game where players recruit heroes and assemble a team to face off against Thanos and his villainous forces in an effort to thwart him from accomplishing his master plan: Collecting all six Infinity Stones to power the Infinity Gauntlet and wreak havoc on the very fabric of reality. Building upon the strengths of the characters on their team, as well as other players, winning requires critical thinking and communication to reach a common goal.

schedule.title: The Monster You Know
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! a super fun silly game that turns the players into monsters! Every turn each player recieves a monstrous trait they have to act out and then all players answer a question about their monster and every player adds an additional monsterous trait to thier previous one and the players monsters become more complex and hillarious to act out!  Find out who is The Monster You Know!

schedule.title: This War of Mine: The Board Game
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! The tabletop adaptation of the award-winning video game that pictures the drama of civilians trapped in a war-torn city. You will enter this experience as a group of civilians trapped in a besieged and conflict-ridden city, enduring many hardships that often test the essence of humanity.

schedule.title: Tiny Towns
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! You are the mayor of a tiny town in the forest in which the smaller creatures of the woods have created a civilization hidden away from predators. This new land is small and the resources are scarce, so you take what you can get and never say no to building materials. Cleverly plan and construct a thriving town, and don't let it fill up with wasted resources! Whoever builds the most prosperous tiny town wins!

schedule.title: Tortuga 1667
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! The year is 1667 and you are a pirate sailing the waters of the Caribbean. A Spanish Galleon floats nearby, and you've talked your crewmates into working together to steal all of its treasure. What you haven't told your fellow pirates is that you have no intentions on sharing the treasure once you have it. Your crewmates have told you that they share your loyalty and that they'll help you maroon the greedy pirates on your ship to the rocky island of Tortuga. But you've seen your friends' loaded pistols and heard their whisperings of a mutiny. You know that nobody can be trusted.

schedule.title: Ultimate Showdown
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! The knockdown, no-holds-barred party game Ultimate Showdown pits famous people and characters in a battle to decide once and for all who can triumph under the situation at hand? Will it be the Easter Bunny vs. Ben Franklin for Best Babysitter? Or will Ghengis Khan beat out Frank Sinatra for Best Road-trip Companion? Anything goes! You pick the challenges and YOU try to get your picks to win!

schedule.title: The 2019 Northeast Regional Dimension Championship
schedule.description: An Envoy Event! Dimension is a fast-paced, innovative puzzle game that takes place in three dimensions with 60 colorful spheres. All of the players play at the same time. Everybody tries to position the spheres on their trays to earn as many points as possible. The task cards indicate how the spheres must be placed to earn points. Complete these tasks while racing against the timer. You get a point for each sphere you use and a bonus token for using all five colors, but you lose two points for each task card you don't follow correctly. Prove to your opponents that you are the master of multi-dimensional thinking! The winner of this Championship will get a trophy, a seat in the first elimination round of the 2019 U.S. National Championship at Gen Con (August 1-4 in Indianapolis, Indiana), a FREE 4-day membership to Gen Con, and a FREE 3-night room share in Indianapolis for Gen Con!

schedule.title: Lord of the Pit
schedule.description: Do you have what it takes to master the Infernal Arena? PLayers will simultaneously draft daemons from a provided pool in a timed draft. After each battle round, daemons will be refreshed in a new draft. Winners will be the most successful fighter and the toughest daemon. Daemon Dice rules as found on the SFR, Inc. web site will be used. Full event rules are available at the SFR, Inc. table.

schedule.title: The Godspell Sing-Along
schedule.description: Visit, watch, sing, dance, whatever! Day by day, we beseech thee, to learn your lessons well! Come join Ginger and Dave and be present with music and friends. No knowledge of songs or lyrics needed.

schedule.title: Imperial Island Defense
schedule.description: A huge enemy host is defending the beach and the Alliance has gathered on an off shore island for an invasion. Unfortunately, the enemy's force fields prevent Alliance deep strikes. In addition, enemy patrol boats roam the waters and their long-range cannons have found their mark and are pounding home. Time to move out... The Alliance must knock out the force field's power generators and secure the beach. Bring your entire army. If you have amphibious vehicles bring them - you'll need 'em. VDR vehicles encouraged - especially amphibious vehicles and fliers. Emphasis is on tactical team work and fun! This is a "non-standard mission" - special rules apply. Models must be painted (primer is not paint) and WYSIWYG (no proxies). Please have your models organized and know the point value on arrival!

schedule.title: The 2019 Robert Sacks Memorial Summer Diplomacy Tournament
schedule.description: The classic Avalon Hill game of pure negotiation. Join us for a marathon session and fight for the world! This tournament is dedicated (as always) to the memory of Robert Sacks, a man whose love of the game brought it to every Double Exposure event ever run in the 1990's.

schedule.title: The DEXCON 22 Miniatures Painting Contest
schedule.description: Bring your pre-painted miniatures for the off-site contest, or paint in the wargaming room with provided miniatures and paints.
